Event.Name: DebugPrerequisite
Event.InternalNotes: Not player facing.
Event.Desc: Fires when certain dev commands are used. Displays the debug string for prereqs.

Event.Name: AchievementUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires when an progress is made towards an achievement's objective.
Event.Example:
function Achievements:OnAchievementUpdated(achUpdated) if not self.wndMain then return end
if self.wndMain:FindChild("RightSummaryScreen"):IsShown() then self:LoadSummaryScreen() else local wndRightScroll = self.wndMain:FindChild("RightScroll") local nVScrollPos = wndRightScroll:GetVScrollPos() self:BuildRightPanel() wndRightScroll:SetVScrollPos(nVScrollPos) end self.wndMain:FindChild("BGLeft:HeaderPointsNumber"):SetText(AchievementsLib.GetAchievementPoints()) self.wndMain:FindChild("BGLeft:HeaderPoints"):SetText(String_GetWeaselString(Apollo.GetString("Achievement_OverallPoints"))) end

Param.Name: achUpdated
Param.Desc: The achievement that has been updated.

Event.InternalNotes: This seems to be firing 3 times for each floating text. Two are when the message is created and one when it is destroyed. All of the floaters passed out have different memory addresses, so maybe we have invisible floaters? The value we're passing out is not recognized by apollo, so why are we passing it out?

Param.Desc: The amount of XP the player needs to reach the next level. This is -1 if the player is at the maximum level.

Event.Name: ProgressClickWindowDisplay
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a CSI should be drawn or hidden.

Param.Name: bIsActive
Param.Desc: Whether or not the CSI should be shown.

Event.Name: SetProgressClickTimes
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player starts a Press and Hold, Rapid Tap, Precision, or Metronome CSI. Informs the UI of the areas the player is supposed to hit during the CSI.

Param.Name: nWidth
Param.Desc: The width of the target area. If this is 0, the target area is hidden.

Param.Name: nLocation1Start
Param.Desc: The starting location of the first target area.

Param.Name: nLocation2Start
Param.Desc: The starting area of the second target area.

Param.Name: nPasses
Param.Desc: The number of times the progress meter is supposed to move back and forth over the CSI. This value is nil for Press and Hold and Rapid Tap CSIs, 1 for Precision CSIs, and a number larger than 1 for Metronome CSIs.

Event.Name: ProgressClickHighlightTime
Event.InternalNotes: Does this really need to be fired so often?
Event.Desc: Fires twice per frame while the Precision and Metronome CSIs are active. This informs the UI of whether or not the target areas have been successfully hit by the player.

Param.Name: nTargetIdx
Param.Desc: The target area being referenced. 0 is the first target, and 1 is the second. If there is only one target, then events will still be fired for both, but only events with nTargetIdx of 0 will matter for that CSI.

Param.Name: nPercentageHighlight
Param.Desc: Informs the UI of how much the color for the target area should be changed. 0 is the default color.

Event.Name: ProgressClickWindowCompletionLevel
Event.Desc: Fires once per frame while the Click and Hold, Rapid Tap, Precision Tap, and Metronome CSIs are active. For Click and Hold and Rapid Tap CSIs, this tells the UI the CSI's progress.

Param.Name: nProgress
Param.Desc: The CSI's progress on the meter, with 0 being the beginning and 100 being the end.

Param.Name: bIsReversed
Param.Desc: Whether or not the CSI's progress is reversed. This is primarily used in Metronome CSIs.

Event.Name: StoryPanelDialog_Hide
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the UI is supposed to stop showing the currently displayed Story Panel. This event is fired to individual players.
Event.Remarks: Story Panels are windows used for messaging information to the player. They are not an actual window type, but they are grouped together so they can be controlled easily via addons. Only one Story Panel
Event.Example: This is usually shown immediately before StoryPanelDialog_Show to ensure that only one Story Panel is shown at a time.

Event.Name: StoryPanelDialog_Show
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the UI is supposed to show a Story Panel window.
Event.Remarks: Story Panels are windows used for messaging information to the player. They are not an actual window type, but they are grouped together so they can be controlled easily via addons. Only one Story Panel

Param.Name: ePanel
Param.Desc: The type of story panel that should be shown.

Param.Name: arMessageLines
Param.Desc: An array of text to show in the story panel.

Param.Name: fDisplayTime
Param.Desc: The amount of time before the Story Panel stould stop being shown.

Param.Name: eStyle
Param.Desc: The style flag for the story panel window.

Event.Name: CanVacuumChange
Event.Desc: Fires when the player's ability to vacuum nearby loot has changed due to loot dropping, being vacuumed, or being removed from the world.
Event.Example:
function HUDAlerts:OnCanVacuumChanged(bCanVacuum)
local strKeybind = GameLib.GetKeyBinding("VacuumLoot")
self.wndLootAlert:FindChild("AlertItemKeybindText"):SetText(strKeybind)
self.wndLootAlert:FindChild("AlertItemKeybind"):Show(strKeybind ~= Apollo.GetString("HUDAlert_Unbound"))
if not self.wndLootAlert:IsShown() and bCanVacuum then
self.wndLootAlert:Show(bCanVacuum, true)
self.wndLootAlert:FindChild("AlertItemTransition"):SetSprite("sprAlert_SectionGlowRingFlash")
else
self.wndLootAlert:Show(bCanVacuum)
end
self:OnUpdateInventory() -- Check Full Bag Indicator
self.wndAlertContainer:ArrangeChildrenHorz(0)
end

Param.Name: bCanVacuum
Param.Desc: Whether or not the ability to vacuum is active.

Event.Name: ShowResurrectDialog
Event.Desc: Fires when the player shows up as a ghost after death and when the player's resurrect options update.

Param.Name: bPlayerIsDead
Param.Desc: Whether the player is dead or not.

Param.Name: bWakeHere
Param.Desc: Whether the player has the option to resurrect at their current location or not.

Param.Name: bRezHolocrypt
Param.Desc: Whether the player has the option to resurrect at the nearest holocrypt or not.

Param.Name: bExitInstance
Param.Desc: Whether the player has the option to exit the instance to resurrect or not. This option is only available during dungeons, adventures, and shiphand missions.

Param.Name: bRezAtCaster
Param.Desc: Whether the player has the option to resurrect at the same location as a player who revived them or not.

Param.Name: bHasRezFromPlayer
Param.Desc: Whether another player has attempted to revive the player or not.

Param.Name: nTimeBeforeRez
Param.Desc: How long the player must wait before they are able to select any resurrect options, in milliseconds.

Param.Name: nTimeBeforeWakeHere
Param.Desc: The amount of time before the player is able to use the "Wake Here" option, in milliseconds.

Param.Name: nForceRezTimer
Param.Desc: The amount of time before the player is forced to resurrect at the nearest holocrypt.

Param.Name: bIsInstancedPvp
Param.Desc: If the player is participating in instanced PvP or not. If so, winResurrect may be handled differently.

Param.Name: bEnableRezHere
Param.Desc: If the player can resurrect at the specified location.

Param.Name: nRezCost
Param.Desc: The cost to resurrect a player.

Param.Name: nTimeBeforeRezableInSeconds
Param.Desc: The time in seconds before a player can be resurrected.

Event.Name: ChatMessage
Event.Desc: Fires when a message is sent on a chat channel

Param.Name: channelSource
Param.Desc: The channel where the message should be displayed.

Item.Name: bAutoResponse
Item.Desc: Whether or not the message is an auto response (from messaging an afk player for example)

Item.Name: bGM
Item.Desc: Whether the message was sent by a GM or not.

Item.Name: bSelf
Item.Desc: Whether the message was sent by the player or not.

Item.Name: strSender
Item.Desc: The name of the source of the message.

Item.Name: strRealmName
Item.Desc: The name of the sender's home realm.

Item.Name: nPresenceState
Item.Desc: The sender's status. This value lines up with the FriendshipLib.AccountPresenceState set of constants. Returns FriendshipLib.AccountPresenceStateAvailable if it is not a player.

Item.Name: arMessageSegments
Item.Desc: This is currently using the incorrect prefix. It is a table with different types in it.

Item.Name: bAlien
Item.Desc: Whether or not the text is flagged to show alien font.

Item.Name: bProfanity
Item.Desc: Whether or not the text contains profanity.

Item.Name: bRoleplay
Item.Desc: Whether or not the text is flagged as Role Play text.

Item.Name: strText
Item.Desc: The text that is displayed.

Item.Name: unitSource
Item.Desc: The unit that sent the message. This variable does not exist for messages not sent by a unit, such as system messages.

Item.Name: bShowChatBubble
Item.Desc: Whether or not a chat bubble should be shown above the character.

Item.Name: bCrossFaction
Item.Desc: Whether or not the message came from a character of the other faction.

Item.Name: nReportId
Item.Desc: The id that corresponds with the message. This value is used for chat reporting purposes.

Event.Name: StartSpellThreshold

Event.Name: ClearSpellThreshold
Event.Desc: Fires when the "Window of Opportunity" for spells with multiple uses (ex. Stalker's Nano Field, Esper's Psychic Frenzy) should close. This can happen either because the timer ran out, the player used another ability, or the player activated the max number of times.

Param.Name: idSpell

Param.Name: nCurrentThreshold

Event.Name: ApplyCCState

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that is affected by the CC state.

Param.Name: eState
Param.Desc: The CC state that was removed from the unit.

Param.Name: unitSource
Param.Desc: The unit that the CC state was removed from.

Event.Name: ActivateCCStateStun
Event.Desc: Fires when the player is stunned.
Event.Example:
function CrowdControlGameplay:OnActivateCCStateStun(eChosenDirection) self.wndProgress = Apollo.LoadForm(self.xmlDoc, "ButtonHit_Progress", nil, self) self.wndProgress:Show(true) -- to get the animation self.wndProgress:FindChild("TimeRemainingContainer"):Show(false)
local bLeft = eChosenDirection == Unit.CodeEnumCCStateStunVictimGameplay.Left local bUp = eChosenDirection == Unit.CodeEnumCCStateStunVictimGameplay.Forward local bRight = eChosenDirection == Unit.CodeEnumCCStateStunVictimGameplay.Right local bDown = eChosenDirection == Unit.CodeEnumCCStateStunVictimGameplay.Backward
-- TODO: Swap to Stun Breakout Keys when they exist self.wndProgress:FindChild("ProgressButtonArtLeft"):SetText(GameLib.GetKeyBinding("StunBreakoutLeft")) self.wndProgress:FindChild("ProgressButtonArtUp"):SetText(GameLib.GetKeyBinding("StunBreakoutUp")) self.wndProgress:FindChild("ProgressButtonArtRight"):SetText(GameLib.GetKeyBinding("StunBreakoutRight")) self.wndProgress:FindChild("ProgressButtonArtDown"):SetText(GameLib.GetKeyBinding("StunBreakoutDown"))
-- Disabled is invisible text, which will hide the button text self.wndProgress:FindChild("ProgressButtonArtLeft"):Enable(bLeft) self.wndProgress:FindChild("ProgressButtonArtUp"):Enable(bUp) self.wndProgress:FindChild("ProgressButtonArtRight"):Enable(bRight) self.wndProgress:FindChild("ProgressButtonArtDown"):Enable(bDown)
if not bLeft and not bUp and not bRight and not bDown then -- Error Case self:OnRemoveCCStateStun() return end
self:OnCalculateTimeRemaining() end

Param.Name: eChosenDirection
Param.Desc: The direction the player needs to press to get out of the CC State.

Event.Name: UpdateCCStateStun
Event.Desc: Fires every 0.2 seconds while the player is stunned. This event informs the UI how much progress the player has made towards breaking out of the stun.

Param.Name: fProgress
Param.Desc: The progress the player has made towards breaking out of the stun. This value is percentage based, with the player breaking out on 100 or higher.

Event.Name: RemoveCCStateStun
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player leaves the Stun CC state.
Event.Remarks: This is a more focused event than RemoveCCState, in that it only fires for the player that the state was removed from and it only applies if the CC State that was removed was Stun.

Param.Desc: The change in the number of warcoins that the guild has.

Event.Name: GuildChange
Event.Desc: Fired whenever the player is added to or removed from a guild, circle, arena team, or warparty.

Event.Name: GuildNameplateChange
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player changes the guild name on their nameplate. This event only fires for the character that changed the nameplate.

Param.Name: guildShown
Param.Desc: The guild that the player selected to show on their nameplate.

Event.Name: GuildRegistrarOpen
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with a Guild Registrar NPC.

Event.Name: GuildRegistrarClose
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player was interacting with a Guild Registrar and either interacts with another NPC or moves too far from the Registrar

Event.Name: WarPartyRegistrarOpen
Event.InternalNotes: Depricated since this only happened when Warparty Registrars were NPCs

Event.Name: WarPartyRegistrarClose
Event.InternalNotes: Depricated since this only happened when Warparty Registrars were NPCs

Event.Name: GuildBankerOpen
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with a guild bank.

Param.Name: unitBank
Param.Desc: The unit that the player interacted with to open the guild bank.

Event.Name: GuildBankerClose
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with another target or moves away from a guild bank while interacting with it.

Event.Name: WarPartyBankerOpen
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with the Warparty Bank.

Event.Name: WarPartyBankerClose
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with another NPC or moves too far away while interacting with the warparty bank, or whenever the UI calls Event_CancelWarpartyBank()..

Event.Name: GuildBankTab
Event.Desc: Fires in response to Guild:OpenBankTab(), verifying that the tab was successfully opened.

Param.Name: guildOwner
Param.Desc: The guild who owns the bank that the player is interacting with.

Param.Name: nTab
Param.Desc: The index of the tab that was opened.

Event.Name: WarPartyBattleOpen
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player presses the Warparty Crate button in the Warplot UI.

Param.Name: guildWarparty
Param.Desc: The warparty that the plot belongs to.

Event.Name: WarPartyBattleClose
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player's UI reloads and they are not on a warplot or in a warplot match.

Event.Name: WarPartyBossTokensUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player uses a boss token during a Warplot match or the player adds a boss token to the Warparty Bank.

Param.Name: guildWarparty
Param.Desc: The warparty whose boss tokens were updated.

Event.Name: GuildBankItem
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an item is added or removed from the guild bank, or moved to a different slot within the bank.

Param.Name: guildOwner
Param.Desc: The guild that owns the bank.

Param.Name: eGuildType
Param.Desc: The type of guild that owns the bank. This should always be GuildLib.GuildType_Guild.

Param.Name: nSlotIndex
Param.Desc: The bank slot where the item is placed.

Param.Name: bRemoved
Param.Desc: Whether the item was removed from the bank or not.

Event.Name: GuildBankTabCount
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a Bank Tab perk is purchased for the guild.

Param.Name: guildOwner
Param.Desc: The guild who owns the bank that the tab was added to.

Event.Name: GuildBankTabRename
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player successfully renames a guild bank tab. To actually get the new tab names, Guild:GetBankTabName() will have to be called for each tab.

Param.Name: guildOwner
Param.Desc: The guild who owns the bank that contains the renamed tab.

Event.Name: GuildName
Event.InternalNotes: No clue how to force this. Probably needs testing.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the guild's name is changed. This is only done when a player or GM sets up a new guild name after a forced name change.

Param.Name: guildUpdated
Param.Desc: The guild whose name was updated.

Event.Name: GuildFlags
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the guild turns taxes or recruitment on or off.

Param.Name: guildUpdated
Param.Desc: The guild whose flags have been updated.

Event.Name: GuildRankChange
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a guild, circle, or warparty adds a rank, removes a rank, renames a rank, or changes a rank's permissions.

Param.Name: guildUpdated
Param.Desc: The guild whose rank was updated.

Event.Name: GuildBankWithdraw
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player successfully withdraws money or items from the guild bank. This only fires for the player who performed the withdraw action.

Param.Name: guildOwner
Param.Desc: The guild who owns the bank that the player withdrew from.

Event.Name: GuildPvp
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an Arena Team's or Warparty's win/loss record or rating has updated.

Event.Name: GuildPerkActivated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a limited duration guild perk has been activated.

Param.Name: guildActivated
Param.Desc: The guild that the perk was activated for.

Param.Name: idGuildPerk
Param.Desc: The id number of the guild perk that was activated.

Event.Name: GuildPerkDeactivated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a guild perk is turned off or runs out of time.

Param.Name: guildUpdated
Param.Desc: The guild whose perk was turned off.

Event.Name: GuildMessageOfTheDay
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the guild's Message of the Day has been updated and when the player logs in on a character.
Event.Remarks: There is currently a bug where the GuildMessageOfTheDay event fires long before the chat log is loaded, so players are not seeing the message of the day.

Param.Name: guildOwner
Param.Desc: The guild that the Message of the Day belongs to.

Event.Name: FriendshipResult
Event.InternalNotes: FriendshipLib.FriendshipResult constants need to be changed to enums.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an error is encountered when working with FriendsLib functionality.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: This value is always 0.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The type of error that was fired. This lines up with the values in FriendshipLib.FriendshipResult.

Event.Name: FriendshipLoaded
Event.Desc: Fires when the FriendshipLib has loaded. This only occurrs when a character is logged in, not when reloading the UI.

Event.Name: FriendshipAdd
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a new friend is added to the friends list.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id for the new friend.

Event.Name: FriendshipUpdate
Event.Desc: Fired whenever a friend's character gets updated, such as when their level changes.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id of the player who was updated.

Event.Name: FriendshipUpdateOnline
Event.Desc: Fired whenever the player comes online or goes offline.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id of the player whose online/offline state changed.

Event.Name: FriendshipRemove
Event.Desc: Fired whenever a friend is removed from the player's friends list.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id of the player that was removed from the friends list.

Event.Name: FriendshipLocation
Event.Desc: Fired in response to FriendshipLib.GetLocations(). Returns all the necessary data to see the name of the zone that the player is in.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The friend id associated with this location.

Item.Name: strWorldZone
Item.Desc: The name of the zone where the player is.

Event.Name: FriendshipRequest
Event.InternalNotes: No implementation in code.

Event.Name: FriendshipSuggestedAdd
Event.Desc: Fired whenever a suggested player is added to the friends list.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id that was added to the friends list from the suggested list.

Event.Name: FriendshipSuggestedUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a suggested friend's information updates. This is usually due to level changes.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The id number of the suggested friend that was updated.

Event.Name: FriendshipSuggestedRemove
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player is removed from the Suggested Friends list. This includes when players on the Suggested list are removed due to going over the maximum number of friends on that list.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id of the player that was removed from the friends list.

Event.Name: UpdateInventory
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an item is added to, removed from, or moved within the player's inventory.

Event.Name: ItemModified
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player makes a change to an item. These changes include adding runes, removing runes, and unlocking additional rune slots.

Param.Name: itemModified
Param.Desc: The item that the player modified.

Event.Name: ItemDurabilityUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever one of the player's items loses some durability or gets repaired.

Param.Name: itemUpdated
Param.Desc: The item whose durability changed.

Param.Name: nPreviousDurability
Param.Desc: The item's durability before the update.

Event.Name: LootRollSelected
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player selects Need or Greed under the Need vs. Greed loot system.

Param.Name: itemRolling
Param.Desc: The item that the player chose to roll for.

Param.Name: strPlayerName
Param.Desc: The name of the player that chose to roll.

Param.Name: bNeed
Param.Desc: Whether or not the player chose to roll Need on the item.

Event.Name: LootRollPassed
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player passes on an item or does not select an option within the time limit under the Need vs. Greed system.

Param.Name: itemPassed
Param.Desc: The item that the player passed on.

Param.Name: strPlayerName
Param.Desc: The name of the player that passed on the item.

Event.Name: LootRoll
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a playerrolls on an item in the Need vs. Greed looting system. This only fires after every member has selected need, greed, or pass on the item and is sent to every member in the group.

Param.Name: itemLoot
Param.Desc: The item that the players are rolling for.

Param.Name: strPlayerName
Param.Desc: The player that rolled for the item.

Param.Name: bNeed
Param.Desc: Whether or not the player chose "Need" for the item.

Event.Name: LootRollWon
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player wins a piece of loot under the Need vs. Greed system.

Param.Name: itemWon
Param.Desc: The item that the player won.

Param.Name: strWinnerName
Param.Desc: The name of the player who won the roll.

Param.Name: bNeed
Param.Desc: Whether or not the player chose "Need" on the item.

Event.Name: LootRollAllPassed
Event.Desc: Fires when everyone in the group passes on an item under the Need vs. Greed system.

Param.Name: itemPassed
Param.Desc: The item that all of the players passed on.

Event.Name: ItemAdded
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an item is placed in a player's inventory by a method other than looting.
Event.Remarks: Examples of actions that would trigger this event include salvaging items, taking an item from the account inventory, crafting an item, and purchasing an item from a vendor.

Param.Name: itemBase
Param.Desc: The base version of the item that was added, before random stats, glyphs, or microchips are factored in.

Param.Name: nCount
Param.Desc: How many stacks of the item were added to the player's inventory.

Param.Name: eUpdateReason
Param.Desc: A value that represents the method that was used to obtain the item.

Param.Name: itemInstance
Param.Desc: The specific instance of the item. This is the version of the item that the player sees in their inventory.

Event.Name: ItemRemoved
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an item is removed from the player's inventory. This can be caused by destroying the item, turning in a quest that auto-removes the item, salvaging the item, or selling the item at a vendor.

Param.Name: itemRemoved
Param.Desc: The item that was removed from the player's inventory.

Param.Name: nCount
Param.Desc: The stack size of the item that was deleted.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The reason the item was updated.

Event.Name: ItemSentToCrate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player sends a decor item from their inventory to the crate.

Param.Name: itemMoved
Param.Desc: The decor item that the player placed in their crate.

Param.Name: nCount
Param.Desc: The stack size of the item that was sent to the crate.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The method the player used to send the item to the crate.

Event.Name: SplitItemStack
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player attempts to split a stack of items in their inventory. The default keybind for this is Shift + Left Click on the item. This event is only fired for the player who tried to split the stack.

Param.Name: itemSplitting
Param.Desc: The item stack that the player is trying to split.

Event.Name: DashCastFail
Event.Desc: Fires when the player attempts to dash while they have no dash charges.

Event.Name: CombatLogAbsorption
Event.InternalNotes: Is it anyone within AoI or just the player/target?
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a unit is granted an absorb shield.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit who used the ability.

Item.Name: unitCasterOwner
Item.Desc: The unit who controls the caster. This variable only exists if the caster is a pet.

Item.Name: unitTarget
Item.Desc: The unit affected by the ability.

Item.Name: unitTargetOwner
Item.Desc: The unit who controls the target. This only exists if the target is a pet.

Item.Name: eCombatResult
Item.Desc: The effect of the abiility on the target. This will most likely be Hit in this case.

Item.Name: splCallingSpell
Item.Desc: The spell that was used.

Item.Name: nAmount
Item.Desc: The amount of damage that the absorb shield will mitigate.

Event.Name: CombatLogCCState
Event.InternalNotes: Why does bHideFloater usually return nil instead of false?
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player enters a crowd control state.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit that cast the ability that applied the CC state.

Item.Name: unitCasterOwner
Item.Desc: The unit that owns the unitCaster. This variable will only exist if the unit that applied the state is a pet.

Item.Name: unitTarget
Item.Desc: The unit that the CC state was applied to.

Item.Name: unitTargetOwner
Item.Desc: The unit that owns the target of the ability. This variable only exists if the target was a pet.

Item.Name: eCombatResult
Item.Desc: A number that represents the effect of the ability on the player. This will most likely be either Hit or Avoid.

Item.Name: splCallingSpell
Item.Desc: The spell that was used to apply the CC state on the player.

Item.Name: eState
Item.Desc: The type of CC that the spell should cause.

Item.Name: bRemoved
Item.Desc: If this is true, then the crowd control state is removed from the player. If not, then it is added to the player.

Item.Name: strState
Item.Desc: The name of the CC state.

Item.Name: strTriggerCapCategory
Item.Desc:
The name of the CC category this effect falls under.
Results can be: Stun Root Pacify Blind Taunt Knockdown Tether Disorient Subdue Pull Knockback Snare Position Switch Pushback
Not every CC State has a dimminishing returns category.

Item.Name: bHideFloater
Item.Desc: Determines whether the floater for the state should be hidden. This variable will only be set to true or nil.

Item.Name: nInterruptArmorHit
Item.Desc: The amount of interrupt armor removed by the spell.

Item.Name: eResult
Item.Desc: The result of trying to apply the CC state to the unit.

Event.Name: CombatLogCCStateBreak
Event.Desc: Fires when the player breaks out of a CC state.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit that broke out of their CC state. This should always be the current player.

Item.Name: unitCasterOwner
Item.Desc: The unit that controls the unit that broke their CC state. This should only be returned if a pet broke out of its crowd control state.

Item.Name: eState
Item.Desc: The type of CC that the unitCaster broke out of.

Item.Name: strState
Item.Desc: The name of the CC state that the unit broke out of.

Event.Name: CombatLogDamage
Event.InternalNotes: ESpellEffectType needs to be exposed to Apollo. Need to find out wtf nRawDamage is.
Event.Desc: Fires when a unit takes damage.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit who used the spell that caused the damage.

Item.Name: unitCasterOwner
Item.Desc: The player that owns the unit who dealt the damage. This only applies if the unitCaster is a pet.

Item.Name: unitTarget
Item.Desc: The target of the ability.

Item.Name: unitTargetOwner
Item.Desc: The unit that owns the unitTarget. This only exists if unitTarget is a pet.

Item.Name: eCombatResult
Item.Desc: The effect of the ability on its target.

Item.Name: splCallingSpell
Item.Desc: The spell that caused the damage.

Item.Name: nDamageAmount
Item.Desc: The amount of damage done by the spell.

Item.Name: nRawDamage
Item.Desc: Damage amount that is directly related to ???

Item.Name: eDamageType
Item.Desc: The type of damage that was done.

Item.Name: nShield
Item.Desc: The amount of damage done to the unit's shield.

Item.Name: nAbsorbtion
Item.Desc: The amount of damage done to the player's absorption shield.

Item.Name: nOverkill
Item.Desc: The amount of damage done to the unit over their remaining HP.

Item.Name: bTargetVulnerable
Item.Desc: Whether or not the target is in the vulnerable state.

Item.Name: bTargetKilled
Item.Desc: Whether or not the unitTarget was killed by the attack.

Item.Name: bPeriodic
Item.Desc: Whether the damage was caused by an ability that does periodic damage.

Item.Name: eEffectType
Item.Desc: The spell's effect type. The values for this enum are not currently exposed in the Apollo API.

Event.Name: CombatLogDelayDeath
Event.Desc: Fires when death missed his bus?

Event.Name: CombatLogDispel
Event.Desc: Fires when a buff or debuff is dispelled.
Event.InternalNotes: Is this used anymore? Why have bRemoveSingleInstance if we're listing the number removed?

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that used the spell that triggered the event.

Param.Name: unitCasterOwner
Param.Desc: The unit who owns unitCaster. This only applies if unitCaster is a pet.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that the buff/debuff was dispelled from.

Param.Name: unitTargetOwner
Param.Desc: The unit that owns unitTarget. This only applies if unitTarget is a pet.

Param.Name: bRemoveSingleInstance
Param.Desc: Whether or not a single stack of the buff is removed.

Param.Name: nInstancesRemoved
Param.Desc: The number of stacks of the buff that are removed from the unit.

Param.Name: splRemovedSpell
Param.Desc: The spell that was removed from the unit.

Event.Name: CombatLogHeal
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a unit gets healed.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit who used the spell that caused the heal.

Param.Name: unitCasterOwner
Param.Desc: The owner of unitCaster. This only applies if unitCaster is a pet.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that received the heal.

Param.Name: unitTargetOwner
Param.Desc: The unit that owns unitTarget. This only applies if unitTarget is a pet.

Param.Name: nHealAmount
Param.Desc: The amount missing health that was healed for the target. This value does not include overheals.

Param.Name: nOverheal
Param.Desc: The amount of overhealing done by the spell.

Param.Name: eCombatResult
Param.Desc: A number representing any special things that went on with the spell, such as a critical hit.

Param.Name: splCallingSpell
Param.Desc: The spell that was used for the heal.

Param.Name: eEffectType
Param.Desc: The effect the spell has on the target.

Event.Name: CombatLogModifyInterruptArmor
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player gains or loses interrupt armor.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit who caused a player's interrupt armor to change

Param.Name: unitCasterOwner
Param.Desc: The owner of unitCaster. This is nil if unitCaster is not a pet.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit whose interrupt armor was changed.

Param.Name: unitTargetOwner
Param.Desc: The player who owns unitTarget. This is nil if unitTarget is not a pet.

Param.Name: nAmount
Param.Desc: The change in the unit's interrupt armor.

Event.Name: CombatLogTransference
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a spell does damage and heals the user at the same time.
Event.Remarks: A good example of a spell that fires this event is the Stalker ability "Nano Field". It is different from Lifesteal in that it is build into the spell, whereas lifesteal is a stat that is granted to all of the player's spells.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit who used the spell that triggered the event.

Param.Name: unitCasterOwner
Param.Desc: The player that owns unitCaster. This only applies if unitCaster was a pet.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that was affected by the spell that triggered this event.

Param.Name: unitTargetOwner
Param.Desc: The unit who owns unitTarget. This only applies if unitTarget is a pet.

Param.Name: eCombatResult
Param.Desc: The effect of the spell that triggered the event.

Param.Name: splCallingSpell
Param.Desc: The spell that triggered the event.

Param.Name: nDamageAmount
Param.Desc: The amount of damage done to unitTarget.

Param.Name: eDamageType
Param.Desc: The type of damage done by the spell.

Param.Name: nShield
Param.Desc: The amount of damage done to the target's shields.

Param.Name: nAbsorption
Param.Desc: The amount of damage done to the target's absorption shield.

Param.Name: nOverkill
Param.Desc: The amount of damage done over the target's max health.

Param.Name: bTargetVulnerable
Param.Desc: Whether or not the target is in a "Moment of Opportunity" state.

Item.Name: nHealAmount
Item.Desc: The amount that the caster is healed for.

Item.Name: eVitalType
Item.Desc: The stat that is increased after the spell is cast.

Item.Name: nOverheal
Item.Desc: The amount of healing the caster received while they were at their maximum health.

Event.Name: CombatLogVitalModifier
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure what fires this.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that used the spell that caused the event to fire.

Param.Name: unitCasterOwner
Param.Desc: The unit that owns unitCaster. This only applies if unitCaster is a pet.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that was the target of the spell.

Param.Name: unitTargetOwner
Param.Desc: The unit that owns unitTarget. This only applies if unitTarget is a pet.

Param.Name: eCombatResult
Param.Desc: The spell's effect on the target.

Param.Name: splCallingSpell
Param.Desc: The spell that caused the event to fire.

Param.Name: nAmount
Param.Desc: How much the specified vital is modified by.

Param.Name: eVitalType
Param.Desc: The vital that is modified.

Param.Name: bShowCombatLog
Param.Desc: Whether or not this event should appear in the combat log.

Event.Name: CombatLogDeflect
Event.Desc: Fires when a unit deflects an attack.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit that used the spell.

Item.Name: unitCasterOwner
Item.Desc: The unit that owns unitCaster. This variable only exists if unitCaster is a pet.

Item.Name: unitTarget
Item.Desc: The unit that deflected the spell.

Item.Name: unitTargetOwner
Item.Desc: The unit that owns unitTarget. This only exists if unitTarget is a pet.

Item.Name: eCombatResult
Item.Desc: The result of the attack. This should always be GameLib.CodeEnumCombatResult.Avoid

Item.Name: splCallingSpell
Item.Desc: The ability that was used in the attack.

Event.Name: CombatLogImmunity
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure of a case where this will fire.

Event.Name: CombatLogInterrupted
Event.Desc: Fires when a unit is interrupted by a spell. This includes if the player interrupted their own spell cast.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that cast the spell that caused the interrupt.

Param.Name: unitCasterOwner
Param.Desc: The owner of unitCaster. This only applies if unitCaster is a pet.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that was interrupted.

Param.Name: unitTargetOwner
Param.Desc: The owner of unitTarget. This only applies if unitTarget is a pet.

Param.Name: eCombatResult
Param.Desc: The result the spell that was used.

Param.Name: splCallingSpell
Param.Desc: The spell that was interrupted.

Param.Name: splInterruptingSpell
Param.Desc: The spell that caused the interrupt.

Param.Name: eCastResult
Param.Desc: Explains why the spell was interrupted.

Param.Name: strCastResult
Param.Desc: A string explaining why the spell was interrupted.

Event.Name: CombatLogKillStreak
Event.Desc: Fires when the player gets multiple kills in quick succession.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that got the kill streak. This should either be the current player or one of their pets.

Param.Name: unitCasterOwner
Param.Desc: The unit that owns unitCaster. This only applies if unitCaster is a pet.

Param.Name: eStatType
Param.Desc: The type of streak the player is on.

Param.Name: nStreakAmount
Param.Desc: The player's current streak count.

Event.Name: CombatLogKillPVP
Event.Desc: Fires when a player assists in a PvP kill.
Event.InternalNotes: Description based on use in CombatLog. If it's wrong, then we should look into it.
Event.Remarks: Currently bugged. This is being fired for a player when they die in PvP, not for when they get a kill assist.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that assisted in the kill.

Param.Name: unitCasterOwner
Param.Desc: The unit that owns unitCaster. This only applies if unitCaster is a pet.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that was killed in PvP.

Param.Name: unitTargetOwner
Param.Desc: The unit that owns unitTarget. This only applies if unitTarget was a pet.

Param.Name: eCombatResult
Param.Desc: The result of using the ability.

Param.Name: splCallingSpell
Param.Desc: The spell that killed the player.

Event.Name: CombatLogDeath
Event.InternalNotes: Why are we returning a table with only one element?
Event.Desc: Fires when the player dies.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit that died. This will always be the current player.

Event.Name: CombatLogResurrect
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player is rezzed. This includes all methods of resurrection.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that was resurrected.

Event.Name: CombatLogStealth
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player enters or leaves stealth.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit whose stealth state has changed.

Param.Name: bExiting
Param.Desc: Whether or not the player left stealth.

Event.Name: CombatLogMount
Event.Desc: Fires if the player mounts or dismounts.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The player that mounted.

Param.Name: bDismounted
Param.Desc: Whether or not the player dismounted.

Event.Name: CombatLogPet
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player summons or despawns a pet, or a pet dies.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit who used the ability to summon, kill, or despawn the pet.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The pet that was spawned.

Param.Name: unitTargetOwner
Param.Desc: The unit that owns the pet. This is the current player.

Param.Name: bDismissed
Param.Desc: Whether or not the pet was despawned.

Param.Name: bKilled
Param.Desc: Whether or not the pet was killed.

Param.Name: eCombatResult
Param.Desc: The end result of the spell that was used.

Event.Name: CombatLogExperience
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player gaines experience or elder points.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that gained the experience or elder points. This will always be the current player.

Param.Name: nXP
Param.Desc: The base amount of experience gained.

Param.Name: nRestXP
Param.Desc: The amount of experience gained from the player's rested bonus.

Param.Name: nEP
Param.Desc: The amount of elder points the player gained.

Param.Name: nRestEP
Param.Desc: The amount of elder points gained from the player's rested bonus.

Event.Name: CombatLogEndGameCurrencies
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player gains non-credit currencies.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that gained the currency. This is always the current player.

Param.Name: monLoot
Param.Desc: The currency that was gained.

Event.Name: CombatLogLoot
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player loots money or an item. This will fire for each visible "item" looted in the world and each item distributed to the player via the group's looting system.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that received the money or item.

Param.Name: monLoot
Param.Desc: The money object for the money that was looted. If there was no money looted, this will be nil.

Param.Name: itemLoot
Param.Desc: The item that was looted. If no item was looted in this event, this will be nil.

Param.Name: nItemAmount
Param.Desc: The stack size of itemLooted for this event. If money was looted in this event and not an item, this value will be 0.

Event.Name: CombatLogCrafting
Event.Desc: Fires when the player finishes crafting an item using a non-simple craft schematic.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit who crafted the item. This should always be the current player.

Item.Name: itemCrafted
Item.Desc: The item that the player crafted.

Event.Name: CombatLogExtracting
Event.InternalNotes: What fires this?

Event.Name: CombatLogModifying
Event.InternalNotes: Unknown functionality. Possibly depricated.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that fired this event.

Event.Name: CombatLogDurabilityLoss
Event.Desc: Fires when a player's equipment loses a point of durability.
Event.InternalNotes: Does not appear to be fired anymore?

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit wearing the equipment that lost durability. This will always be the current player.

Param.Name: nAmount
Param.Desc: The amount of durability that was lost.

Event.Name: CombatLogItemDestroy
Event.Desc: Fires when the player destroys an item.
Event.Remarks: Note: This is not triggered by salvaging, selling, or turning an item in for a quest.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that destroyed the item.

Param.Name: itemDestroyed
Param.Desc: The item that was destroyed.

Event.Name: CombatMomentum
Event.Desc: Fires whenever one of the player's "momentum" bonuses increases.

Param.Name: eType
Param.Desc: The type of momentum bonus that was increased.

Param.Name: nCount
Param.Desc: The current count for the momentum bonus.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: A string for displaying the event.

Event.Name: CombatLogString
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a string is directly written in the combat log. Instances where this is occurring include breaking CC, ....
Event.InternalNotes: Need to research all the cases where this occurs. Why are we showing this when we have a CCStateBreak event?

Param.Name: strLogMessage
Param.Desc: The message printed to the combat log.

Event.Name: ElderPointsGained
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player gains elder points.

Param.Name: nAmount
Param.Desc: The base number of elder points the player gained.

Param.Name: nRested
Param.Desc: The number of elder points granted by the player's rested bonus.

Event.Name: GameClickProp
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player left clicks on a non-interactive object in the world.

Param.Name: idProp
Param.Desc: The id number of the prop that the player selected.

Event.Name: GameClickUnit
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player left clicks on a unit in game.

Param.Name: unitSelected
Param.Desc: The unit that was clicked on.

Event.Name: GameClickWorld
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player left clicks a location in the world.

Param.Name: vec3Location
Param.Desc: The location where the player clicked in the world.

Event.Name: UI_EffectiveLevelChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player's effective level changes due to rallying or mentoring.

Param.Name: nNewEffectiveLevel
Param.Desc: The player's current effective level.

Event.Name: HousingResult
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an error is thrown due to a housing operation.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: The name of the player who caused the error.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The error message sent. These are found in the HousingLib.HousingResult set of constants.

Event.Name: HousingRealtorOpen
Event.InternalNotes: This is no longer being used so far as I know.

Event.Name: HousingNeighborsLoaded
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player is removed from the Neighbors list.

Event.Name: HousingNeighborUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player is added as a neighbor, a neighbor goes offline or comes online, or a player is set as a roommate.

Param.Name: idNeighbor
Param.Desc: The neighbor id of the player that was updated.

Event.Name: HousingNeighborInviteRecieved
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player is sent an invite from another player.

Param.Name: strInvitorName
Param.Desc: The name of the player that sent the neighbor invite.

Event.Name: HousingNeighborInviteAccepted
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player is added to the Neighbors list.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: The new neighbor's name.

Event.Name: HousingNeighborInviteDeclined
Event.Desc: Fired whenever a player declines a neighbor invite that they received. This event is sent to both the person who sent the invite and the person who declined the invite.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: The name of the player who declined the invite.

Event.Name: HousingPrivacyUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player changes their housing plot's visiter rules to or from Private.

Param.Name: bIsPrivate
Param.Desc: Determines whether or not the building is private.

Event.Name: HousingRandomResidenceListRecieved
Event.Desc: Fires in response to HousingLib.RequestRandomResidenceList().
Event.Example: Note, this event does not contain the resdence list. It only informs the player that the list is ready to be obtained via the HousingLib.GetRandomResidenceList.

Event.Name: DecorPreviewOpen
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player opens the decor or plug preview window.

Param.Name: idItemDisplayed
Param.Desc: The id number for the plug or decor being previewed.

Event.Name: DecorPreviewClose
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a decor or plug preview window closes.

Event.Name: PetCustomizationFailed
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player attempts to customize their pet or scanbot and the attempt is not successful.

Item.Name: ePetType
Item.Desc: The type of pet that the player tried to customize.

Item.Name: idPet
Item.Desc: The id number of the pet.

Item.Name: nFlairSlotIndex
Item.Desc: The flair slot that the player tried to modify.

Item.Name: pcFlair
Item.Desc: The piece of flair that the player tried to set to nFlairSlotIndex.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The reason why the customization attempt failed.

Event.Name: PetCustomizationUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player successfully update's a pet or scanbot's customization options.

Param.Name: pcCustomization
Param.Desc: The pet's new customization info.

Event.Name: PetFlairCleared
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure how this is fired.

Event.Name: PetFlairUnlocked
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player unlocks a new piece of flair for their pet or scanbot.

Param.Name: idFlair
Param.Desc: The id number of the pet flair that was unlocked.

Event.Name: KeyBindingKeyChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player saves changes to their keybindings. The event is fired once for each keybinding that was changed.

Param.Name: strKeybinding
Param.Desc: The name of the keybinding that was changed.

Event.Name: AcceptProgressInput
Event.Desc: Fires when CSIs turn player input on and off. This is only used for the "Memory" CSI.

Param.Name: bShouldAccept
Param.Desc: Whether or not the CSI will accept user input.

Event.Name: HighlightProgressOption
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a button flashes during Memory CSIs.

Param.Name: nButton
Param.Desc: The button that should be highlighted.

Event.Name: ToggleMarketplaceWindow
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with a Commodities Marketplace NPC. This is only handled by the player who triggered the event.

Event.Name: MarketplaceWindowClose
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player is interacting with the Commodities Exchange NPC, then interacts with another NPC or moves too far from the Commodities Exchange NPC.

Event.Name: CommodityInfoResults
Event.Desc: Fires for each item returned by MarketplaceLib.RequestCommodityInfo(). It contains information on all of the buy and sell orders out for the item.

Param.Name: idItem
Param.Desc: The id number for the item that the results are referencing.

Item.Name: nBuyOrderCount
Item.Desc: The number of buy orders out for the item.

Item.Name: nSellOrderCount
Item.Desc: The number of sell orders out for the item.

Item.Name: monPrice
Item.Desc: The amount that the buy order is paying per item.

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of items that the buy order will purchase before it is fulfilled.

Item.Name: monPrice
Item.Desc: The sell order's price per item.

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of items in the sell order.

Param.Name: arOrders
Param.Desc: A listing of all of the buy and sell orders open for the item.

Event.Name: OwnedCommodityOrders
Event.Desc: Fires in response to MarketplaceLib.RequestOwnedCommodityOrders().

Param.Name: arOrders
Param.Desc: An array that contains the player's open buy and sell orders on the commodity exchange.

Event.Name: PostCommodityOrderResult
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player attempts to post a buy or sell order on the commodities exchange. Informs the player if the order was successfully placed or an error was thrown.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The result of the operation. This will return the error that is received, or OK if the operation was successful.

Param.Name: orderPosted
Param.Desc: The commodity order that the player attempted to post on the Commodities Exchange.

Param.Name: monCost
Param.Desc: The cost to post the order.

Event.Name: CommodityAuctionRemoved
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a buy or sell order is removed from the Commodities Exchange.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The reason the auction was removed from the Commodities Exchange. This will either be Fill, Expire, or Cancel.

Param.Name: orderRemoved
Param.Desc: The order that was removed from the Commodities Exchange.

Event.Name: ToggleAuctionWindow
Event.Desc: Fires when the player interacts with an auctioneer NPC. This is only fired for the player who pressed the keybinding.

Event.Name: AuctionWindowClose
Event.Desc: Fires whent he player moves out of range of an Auctioneer NPC.
Event.Example:
function MarketplaceAuction:OnDocumentReady() Apollo.RegisterEventHandler("AuctionWindowClose", "OnDestroy", self) end
function MarketplaceAuction:OnDestroy() if self.wndMain and self.wndMain:IsValid() then self:OnSearchClearBtn() self.wndMain:Destroy() end
Event_CancelAuctionhouse() end

Event.Name: OwnedItemAuctions
Event.Desc: Fires in response to the MarketplaceLib.RequestOwnedItemAuctions() function.

Param.Name: arAuctions
Param.Desc: An array of the player's open bids and listed items on the auction house.

Event.Name: ItemAuctionSearchResults
Event.Desc: Returns results from the the MarketplaceLib.SearchAuctionableItems() function.

Param.Name: nPage
Param.Desc: The page that the player is currently viewing.

Param.Name: nTotalResults
Param.Desc: The total number of search results that the player has received.

Param.Name: arAuctions
Param.Desc: An array containing all of the auctions returned in the search results.

Event.Name: ItemAuctionOutbid
Event.Desc: Fires whenever someone else places a higher bid or buys an auction that the player had bid on.

Param.Name: auctBidOn
Param.Desc: The item that the player was outbid on.

Event.Name: ItemAuctionWon
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player wins an auction.

Param.Name: auctWon
Param.Desc: The auction that the player won.

Event.Name: ItemAuctionExpired
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an auction's listing expires.

Param.Name: auctExpired
Param.Desc: The auction that expired.

Event.Name: ItemCancelResult
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player tries to cancel one of their auctions.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The result of the player's attempt to cancel the auction. If it was successful, this value will be Ok.

Param.Name: auctCanceled
Param.Desc: The auction that the player attempted to cancel.

Event.Name: PostItemAuctionResult
Event.Desc: Fires when the player attempts to post an auction on the Auction House.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: If there was a problem posting the auction, this will contain the error explaining why it failed. Otherwise, this value will be Ok.

Param.Name: auctPosted
Param.Desc: The auction that the player tried to post.

Event.Name: ItemAuctionBidResult
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player places a bid or selects the "Buy Now" option for an item on the auction house.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The result of the player's attempt to place a bid on the auction. A result of Ok means the bid was successful.

Param.Name: auctBidOn
Param.Desc: The auction that the player bid on or bought.

Event.Name: PlayerPathMissionUnlocked
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player unlocks a new path mission. If multiple missions are unlocked at once, an event will be fired for each of them.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The mission that was unlocked.

Event.Name: PlayerPathMissionUnlockedSound
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a path mission is unlocked.

Event.Name: PlayerPathMissionComplete
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player completes a path mission.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The mission that the player just completed.

Event.Name: PlayerPathMissionCompleteSound
Event.InternalNotes: Does not seem to be referenced in Lua. Unsure how this is actually fired.

Event.Name: PlayerPathRewardAvailable
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player completes all of the path missions in an episode.

Param.Name: peCompleted
Param.Desc: The path episode that the player completed.

Event.Name: InvokeScientistExperimentation
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with an object or NPC that starts a Scientist Experimentation minigame.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The mission that the experimentation minigame belongs to.

Event.Name: ScientistExperimentationResult
Event.InternalNotes: PathMission.ScientistExperimentationResult needs to be converted to an enum.
Event.Desc: Fires in response to a valid call to PathMission:AttemptScientistExperimentation(). This event returns the results of the player's attempt.

Param.Name: arResults
Param.Desc: An array of all the results from the player's experimentation attempt. These values line up with the PathMission.ScientistExperimentationResult set of int constants.

Event.Name: PublicEventStart
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a public event begins.

Param.Name: peStarting
Param.Desc: The public event that just started.

Event.Name: PublicEventUpdate
Event.InternalNotes: Need to find a test case for this
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a public event updates.

Param.Name: peUpdated
Param.Desc: The public event that was updated.

Event.Name: PublicEventObjectiveUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player progresses a public event objective.

Param.Name: peoUpdated
Param.Desc: The public event objective that was updated.

Event.Name: PublicEventLiveStatsUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires once per second during events with live stats, such as PvP matches.

Param.Name: peUpdated
Param.Desc: The public event whose stats were updated.

Event.Name: PublicEventStatsUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever players' public event stats update.
Event.Remarks: The types of actions that will fire this update are more directly related to progressing the event, such as picking up a mask in Walatiki Temple or speaking to a villager during the Malgrave Adventure.

Param.Name: peUpdated
Param.Desc: The public event whose stats were updated.

Event.Name: PublicEventEnd
Event.Desc: Fires when a public event ends.
Event.InternalNotes: Lots of int constants that need to be converted to enums. Lots of values that might not need to be passed. Lots of values that don't seem consistent.

Param.Name: peEvent
Param.Desc: The public event that ended.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The reason the event ended. This lines up with the PublicEvent.PublicEventParticipantRemoveReason set of int constants.

Item.Name: nElapsedTime
Item.Desc: The amount of time that elapsed since the event started, in milliseconds.

Item.Name: eRewardTier
Item.Desc: The reward tier that the player earned. This value lines up with the PublicEvent.PublicEventRewardTier set of int constants.

Item.Name: eRewardType
Item.Desc: The reason the player received the reward. This lines up with the PublicEvent.PublicEventRewardTier set of int constants.

Item.Name: arRewardThresholds
Item.Desc: The thresholds that the player needs to cross to achieve bronze, silver, and gold rewards.

Item.Name: arTeamStats
Item.Desc: The total stats for each team involved in the event.

Item.Name: nDamage
Item.Desc: The amount of damage the team dealt.

Item.Name: nDamageReceived
Item.Desc: The amount of damage that the team took.

Item.Name: nHits
Item.Desc: The number of attacks the team made that connected with the enemy.

Item.Name: nHaters
Item.Desc: The number of people who are gonna hate.

Item.Name: nKills
Item.Desc: The number of enemy units the team managed to land the killing blow against.

Item.Name: nMaxMultiKills
Item.Desc: The highest number of enemies that were killed with a single attack.

Item.Name: nDeaths
Item.Desc: The number of times players on the team died.

Item.Name: nHealed
Item.Desc: The amount of healing the team did.

Item.Name: nHealingReceived
Item.Desc: The amount of healing that was done to players on the team.

Item.Name: nContributions
Item.Desc: The number of objectives the team completed.

Item.Name: nLongestLife
Item.Desc: The longest amount of time the team spent between deaths, in milliseconds.

Item.Name: nAssists
Item.Desc: The number of enemies players on the team helped kill, but did not land the killing blow against.

Item.Name: nSaves
Item.Desc: The number of times the team stopped the enemy from capturing an objective.

Item.Name: nOverhealed
Item.Desc: The amount of healing the team did when their target was already at their max health.

Item.Name: nOverhealingReceived
Item.Desc: The amount of healing that was done to players on the team while they were at max health.

Item.Name: nLongestImpulse
Item.Desc: The highest number of attacks that the team avoided in a row.

Item.Name: nKillStreak
Item.Desc: The team's highest kill streak.

Item.Name: arCustomStats
Item.Desc: An array of stats that are specific to the event.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the stat.

Item.Name: nValue
Item.Desc: The value of the stat.

Item.Name: arParticipantStats
Item.Desc: The stats for each player involved in the event.

Item.Name: nDamage
Item.Desc: The amount of damage the player did.

Item.Name: nDamageReceived
Item.Desc: The amount of damage the player took.

Item.Name: nHits
Item.Desc: The number of attacks the player made that hit an enemy.

Item.Name: nHaters
Item.Desc: The number of people who are hating on the player.

Item.Name: nKills
Item.Desc: The number of killing blows the player landed.

Item.Name: nMaxMultiKills
Item.Desc: The most enemies that were killed in a single attack made by the player.

Item.Name: nDeaths
Item.Desc: The number of times the player died.

Item.Name: nHealed
Item.Desc: The amount of healing the player did.

Item.Name: nHealingReceived
Item.Desc: The amount of healing that other players did to the player.

Item.Name: nContributions
Item.Desc: The number of objectives the player completed.

Item.Name: nLongestLife
Item.Desc: The longest amount of time the player spent between deaths.

Item.Name: nAssists
Item.Desc: The number of enemies the player helped kill, but did not land the killing blow against.

Item.Name: nSaves
Item.Desc: The number of times the player prevented the enemy from completing an objective.

Item.Name: nOverhealed
Item.Desc: The amount of healing the player did on targets that were already at their max health.

Item.Name: nOverhealingReceived
Item.Desc: The amount of healing done to the player while they are at max health.

Item.Name: nLongestImpulse
Item.Desc: The highest number of attacks that the player avoided in a row.

Item.Name: nKillStreak
Item.Desc: The highest kill streak the player achieved.

Item.Name: arCustomStats
Item.Desc: An array of custom stats that are specific to the event.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the stat.

Item.Name: nValue
Item.Desc: The value of the stat.

Item.Name: arObjectives
Item.Desc: An array of the public event's objectives.

Item.Name: eStatus
Item.Desc: The status of the public event. This lines up with the PublicEventObjective.PublicEventStatus set of int constants.

Item.Name: peoObjective
Item.Desc: One of the objectives for this event.

Event.Name: PublicEventLocationAdded
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure of where to get this event to fire. Needs further testing.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a new location is added to a public event.

Param.Name: peUpdated
Param.Desc: The public event that the location was added to.

Event.Name: PublicEventLocationRemoved
Event.InternalNotes: Unable to get this to fire. Need a test case.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a location is removed from the public event.

Param.Name: peUpdated
Param.Desc: The public event that the location was removed from.

Event.Name: PublicEventObjectiveLocationAdded
Event.InternalNotes: Needs a test case.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a location is added to a public event objective.

Param.Name: peoUpdated
Param.Desc: The objective that the location was added to.

Event.Name: PublicEventObjectiveLocationRemoved
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a location is removed from an objective.
Event.Example: This event is fired after speaking to villagers during the Exodus portion of the Malgrave Adventure.

Param.Name: peoUpdated
Param.Desc: The public event objective that the location was removed from.

Event.Name: PublicEventInitiateVote
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the public event requires the group to vote on a decision before progressing.

Event.Name: PublicEventVoteTallied
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a group member selections an option during a public event vote.

Param.Name: nSelection
Param.Desc: The option that was selected by a player.

Event.Name: PublicEventVoteEnded
Event.Desc: Fires when every member of a group has voted when the public event requires it, or when the voting timer runs out.

Param.Name: nWinner
Param.Desc: The voting option with the most votes.

Event.Name: PlayerPathMissionUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a path mission is unlocked, advanced, completed, or failed.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The path mission that was updated.

Event.Name: PlayerPathMissionAdvanced
Event.Desc: Fires whenever progress is made on a multi-step path mission.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The mission that was advanced.

Event.Name: PlayerPathRefresh
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player needs to redraw their path information, such as on reloadui or changing zones.

Event.Name: PlayerPathAdd
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure how this is being used. Cannot get it to fire.

Event.Name: PlayerPathExplorerScavengerHuntStarted
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with the NPC that starts a Scavenger Hunt mission.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The Scavenger Hunt mission that was started.

Event.Name: PlayerPathExplorerPowerMapStarted
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player successfully starts a Tracking mission.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The Tracking mission that the player started.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that the player is supposed to follow for the mission.

Event.Name: PlayerPathExplorerPowerMapWaiting
Event.Desc: Fires when the unit that is being tracked in a Tracking mission reaches its destination before the player.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The Tracking mission that the player is on.

Param.Name: nVictoryDelay
Param.Desc: The amount of time the player has to reach the destination before the mission fails.

Event.Name: PlayerPathExplorerPowerMapFailed
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player fails a Tracking mission.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The mission that the player failed.

Event.Name: PlayerPathExplorerPowerMapEntered
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player enters an area where a Tracking mission can be started

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The Tracking mission that can be started at this location.

Event.Name: PlayerPathExplorerPowerMapExited
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player leaves a location where a power map mission can be started.

Param.Name: pmMission
Param.Desc: The mission that could have been started from the location that the player left.

Event.Name: SettlerHubReward
Event.InternalNotes: Need to find out how these work.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever settlers unlock a reward for the players in the zone.

Param.Name: strNotification
Param.Desc: The message that was broadcast, telling players about the reward that was unlocked.

Event.Name: PlayerPathScientistScanBotDeployed
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player summons their scanbot.

Event.Name: PlayerPathScientistScanBotDespawned
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player manually despawns their scanbot or their scanbot runs out of HP.

Event.Name: PlayerPathScientistScanBotCooldown
Event.Desc: Fires when the player's ability to summon their scanbot is on cooldown, such as after the player despawns their scanbot or their scanbot is destroyed.

Param.Name: fCooldown
Param.Desc: The number of seconds before the player can summon their scanbot.

Event.Name: SoldierHoldoutStatus
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a holdout's state updates. This is sent to every player involved in the holdout.

Param.Name: solUpdated
Param.Desc: The soldier event whose state was updated.

Event.Name: SoldierHoldoutNextWave
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the next wave of a soldier holdout begins. This event fires for everyone participating in the holdout.

Param.Name: solHoldout
Param.Desc: The holdout that triggered the event.

Event.Name: UpdateSoldierBuild
Event.InternalNotes: Are soldier buildings still a thing?

Event.Name: SoldierHoldoutEnd
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a soldier holdout ends, no matter if it was successful or unsuccessful. This event fires for everyone who participated in the holdout.

Param.Name: solHoldout
Param.Desc: The holdout that ended.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The reason the holdout ended. This value lines up with the PathMission.PlayerPathSoldierResult set of int constants.

Event.Name: SettlerHubUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a settler builds an improvement, the time on an improvement is updated, or a player adds time to an improvement. This event is only sent to settlers.

Event.Name: InvokeSoldierBuild
Event.InternalNotes: Soldier improvements are not currently in the game, but may be someday.

Event.Name: SettlerInfrastructureAdvanced
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a the completion percentage of an infrastructure project is updated. This event is only sent to settlers.
Event.InternalNotes: Need to find out how this is called, because it doesn't seem to be

Event.Name: SettlerInfrastructureComplete
Event.Desc: Fires when a settler brings the last resource needed to finish an infrastructure project.

Event.Name: SettlerInfrastructureStarted
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a settler interacts with an infrastructure NPC while the project is not in progress.

Event.Name: SettlerInfrastructureUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a the completion percentage of an infrastructure project is updated. This event is only sent to settlers.

Event.Name: SettlerNotifyUse
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure of how this is being used. Not handled in Lua.

Event.Name: InvokeSettlerBuild
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a settler interacts with a settler depot.

Param.Name: unitHub
Param.Desc: The settler hub that the player is interacting with.

Param.Name: arImprovements
Param.Desc: An array of settler improvements that can be built at this hub.

Event.Name: SettlerBuildResult
Event.InternalNotes: We really need an enum saying wtf eResult is.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player build's a settler improvement.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The result of the player's build action.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: The name of the improvement that was built.

Event.Name: SettlerBuildStatusUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player builds or adds time to a settler improvement.

Param.Name: idHub
Param.Desc: The id number of the hub that the player built the improvement at.

Param.Name: unitHub
Param.Desc: The settler hub that the improvement was buit at.

Event.Name: SettlerHubClose
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the UI calls Event_CancelSettlerHub() or the player moves too far from a settler hub that they are interacting with.

Event.Name: SplineHintObjectEnd
Event.InternalNotes: No clue how to fire this.

Event.Name: TradeSkills_Learned
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player learns a new crafting tradeskill. This does not get fired for learning Runecrafting or harvesting (Mining, Survivalist, Relic Hunter) tradeskills.

Param.Name: eTradeskill
Param.Desc: The tradeskill that was learned.

Event.Name: UnitTextBubbleCreate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an unit should display a text bubble over their head.

Param.Name: unitSpeaker
Param.Desc: The unit that the text bubble is attached to.

Param.Name: strText
Param.Desc: The text in the text bubble.

Param.Name: bImmediate
Param.Desc: Whether the text bubble should be shown immediately or fade in.

Param.Name: fRange
Param.Desc: The maximum range that people can see the text bubble from.

Event.Name: UnitTextBubblesDestroyed
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a text bubble's internal timer has expired.

Event.Name: UnitGuildNameplateChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a nearby player updates their guild tag on their nameplate.

Param.Name: unitUpdated
Param.Desc: The unit whose guild tag was updated.

Event.Name: UnitMemberOfGuildChange
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a nearby player is added or removed from a guild.

Param.Name: unitUpdated
Param.Desc: The player that was added to or removed from a guild.

Event.Name: UnitGroupChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player is added or removed from the group. This is sent to every member of the group.

Param.Name: unitUpdated
Param.Desc: The unit that was added or removed from the group.

Event.Name: UnitTitleChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a nearby unit changes their title.

Param.Name: unitUpdated
Param.Desc: The unit who changed their title.

Event.Name: UnitLevelChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a nearby player's level or effective level changes.
Event.InternalNotes: Firing multiple times for the same level change. Only seems to fire once for each effective level change.

Param.Name: unitUpdated
Param.Desc: The unit whose level or effective level changed.

Event.Name: GalacticArchiveArticleAdded
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player unlocks the first entry of a particular Galactic Archive Article.

Param.Name: artNewArticle
Param.Desc: The article that was just unlocked.

Event.Name: GalacticArchiveEntryAdded
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a new entry is unlocked for an already known Galactic Archive Article.

Param.Name: artParent
Param.Desc: The article that this entry belongs to.

Param.Name: entUnlocked
Param.Desc: The newly unlocked entry.

Event.Name: GalacticArchiveRefresh
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the Galactic Archive refreshes. This is generally when the player changes zones.

Event.Name: GalacticArchiveLinkClick
Event.InternalNotes: This isn't being referenced in Lua and is likely depricated.
Event.Desc: Fired whenever a player clicks a link in a Galactic Archive article.

Param.Name: artLinkTarget
Param.Desc: The target of the link that was clicked.

Event.Name: PlayerChanged
Event.Desc: Fires when the player first logs in, indicating that it has loaded.

Event.Name: CharacterCreated
Event.Desc: Fires when the player's character is first placed in the world.
Event.Remarks:
Note: This is not fired if the UI is reloaded.
Also Note: All of the character's information may not be populated in other systems when the character is created. This is an important event, but extra checks, such as GameLib.IsCharacterLoaded() could prove useful here.

Event.Name: MouseOverUnitChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the mouse is moved over a unit or off of a unit.

Param.Name: unitMouseOver
Param.Desc: The unit that the mouse is currently over. This value is nil if the mouse moves off of a unit.

Event.Name: AlternateTargetUnitChanged
Event.Desc: Fires when the player's focus target changes.

Param.Name: unitFocus
Param.Desc: The player's new focus target.

Event.Name: TargetedByUnit
Event.InternalNotes: The logic on when this is fired seems kinda really odd...
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player's threat is increased with a hostile NPC to the point that it targets the player. This only fires for the person being targeted.
Event.Remarks: This isn't fired if the player's threat level is 0, if the unit doing the targeting is friendly, or if the unit doing the targeting is a player.

Param.Name: unitTargeting
Param.Desc: The unit that is targeting the player.

Event.Name: UnTargetedByUnit
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a unit stops targeting the current player.

Param.Name: unitAttacking
Param.Desc: The unit who changed their target.

Event.Name: TargetThreatListUpdated
Event.InternalNotes: Why does this not pass out an array?
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the threat list for the targeted unit updates. This is fired to any character that is targeting the unit whose threat table was updated.
Event.Remarks: Note, this is not fired if the targeted unit is a player.

Param.Name: unitTarget1
Param.Desc: The player at the top of the threat list.

Param.Name: nTarget1Threat
Param.Desc: unitTarget1's threat vs. the target unit.

Param.Name: unitTarget2
Param.Desc: The unit with the second highest threat against the target unit.

Param.Name: nTarget2Threat
Param.Desc: unitTarget2's threat vs. the target unit.

Param.Name: unitTarget3
Param.Desc: The unit with the third highest threat against the target unit.

Param.Name: nTarget3Threat
Param.Desc: unitTarget3's threat vs. the target unit.

Param.Name: unitTarget4
Param.Desc: The player with the fourth highest threat against the target unit.

Param.Name: nTarget4Threat
Param.Desc: unitTarget4's threat vs. the target unit.

Param.Name: unitTarget5
Param.Desc: The unit with the fifth highest threat against the target unit.

Param.Name: nTarget5Threat
Param.Desc: unitTarget5's threat vs. the target unit.

Event.Name: LogOut
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player finishes logging out with their character.

Event.Name: ChatZoneChange
Event.Desc: Fires when the Zone channel changes, such as when a player moves from one zone to another.

Param.Name: strNewZone
Param.Desc: The name of the new zone that the player has moved into.

Event.Name: ChatFlag
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure if this is a thing. We aren't handling it anywhere in Lua and there's no API calls to get the channel's flags

Event.Name: ChatResult
Event.Desc: Fires when there is an error with a chat message that the player tried to send.
Event.InternalNotes: Enum for ChatSystemLib.ChatChannelResult constants?

Param.Name: channelSource
Param.Desc: The channel where the original message was sent.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The error with the message that was sent. This value lines up with the ChatSystemLib.ChatChannelResult constants.

Event.Name: ChatTellFailed
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player makes an unsuccessful tell

Param.Name: channelSource
Param.Desc: The channel that the player attempted to use for the failed tell. This is likely the Whisper channel.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: The name of the player you attempted to send a whisper to.

Event.Name: ChatJoin
Event.Desc: Fires when the player joins a chat channel.

Param.Name: chanJoined
Param.Desc: The chat channel that the character just joined.

Event.Name: ChatJoinResult
Event.InternalNotes: We need an enum for ChatSystemLib.ChatChannelResult
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player fails to join a channel.

Param.Name: chanJoin
Param.Desc: The channel that the player attempted to join.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The reason why the player failed to join the channel. This value lines up with the ChatSystemLib.ChatChannelResult system of int constants.

Event.Name: ChatLeave
Event.Desc: Fires when the player leaves or is kicked from a chat channel.

Param.Name: chanLeft
Param.Desc: The channel that the player left.

Param.Name: bKicked
Param.Desc: Whether or not the player was kicked from the channel

Param.Name: bBanned
Param.Desc: Whether or not the player was banned from the channel.

Event.Name: ChatList
Event.InternalNotes: Is this still needed since we have the channel:GetMembers() function? We still have a handler for it, but nothing is calling Channel:RequestMembers() anymore.
Event.Desc: Fired in response to the ChatChannel:RequestMembers() function. Passes the channel that was polled for its members.

Param.Name: channelSource
Param.Desc: The channel that is being polled for its members.

Event.Name: ChatAction
Event.InternalNotes: ChatSystemLib.ChatChannelAction should be an enum, not int constants
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an action is taken on a custom chat channel. These actions include passing the owner of the channel to another player, adding or removing the Moderator status from a player, muting and unmuting a player, kicking a player from the channel, and adding/removing a password to the channel.

Param.Name: channelSource
Param.Desc: The channel that the action was applied to.

Param.Name: eAction
Param.Desc: The action that fired the event. This value lines up with the ChatSystemLib.ChatChannelAction set of constants.

Param.Name: strActor
Param.Desc: The player who performed the action.

Param.Name: strActedOn
Param.Desc: The target of the action.

Event.Name: WhoResponse
Event.InternalNotes: Need an enum for Paths
Event.Desc: The response the player gets when they use the /who slash command.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The player's name.

Item.Name: nLevel
Item.Desc: The player's level.

Item.Name: eRaceId
Item.Desc: The player's race.

Item.Name: eClassId
Item.Desc: The player's class.

Item.Name: ePlayerPathType
Item.Desc: The player's path. This lines up with the PlayerPathLib.PlayerPathType set of constants.

Item.Name: idWorldZone
Item.Desc: The id of the zone the player is in.

Item.Name: strRace
Item.Desc: The name of the player's race.

Item.Name: strClass
Item.Desc: The name of the player's class.

Item.Name: strZone
Item.Desc: The name of the zone the player is in.

Item.Name: strPath
Item.Desc: The name of the player's path.

Event.Name: P2PTradeCommit
Event.Desc: Fired whenever the player commits to a trade using a TradeCommitButton or an ActionConfirmButton whose data is set to GameLib.CodeEnumConfirmButtonType.CommitTrade.

Event.Name: MatchingLeaveQueue
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player successfully leaves a matching queue, declines to join a pending match, or allows a pending match notification to time out.

Event.Name: MatchingJoinQueue
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player successfully joins a matching queue.

Event.Name: MatchingGameReady
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player is able to join a matching game.

Param.Name: bInProgress
Param.Desc: Whether the match that the player has already started or not.

Event.Name: MatchingGamePendingUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever players that were sent the pending game notification accept or decline to join the match.

Event.Name: MatchingCancelPendingGame
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player fails to respond to a pending Match notification before it times out or a member of the group declines to join the pending game.

Event.Name: MatchingAverageWaitTimeUpdated
Event.InternalNotes: Need to find out how often this is fired.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the server recognizes a change in the average wait time for the Match the player is queued for.
