Event.Name: MatchingRoleCheckStarted
Event.Desc: Fires when a group queues for a dungeon or adventure or when they look for new members from the queue.

Event.Name: MatchingRoleCheckHidden
Event.Desc: Fires if the player is the one who joined the queue for a dungeon or adventure. If the player is part of a group that joined the queue together but is not the leader of that group, they will not receive this event.

Event.Name: MatchEntered
Event.Desc: Fired whenever the player enters a PvP Match.

Event.Name: MatchFinished
Event.Desc: Fires when the PvP Match ends.

Event.Name: MatchExited
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player leaves a PvP Match.

Event.Name: MatchLeft
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player leaves the matching game.

Event.Name: MatchJoined
Event.Desc: Fires when the player initially joins a match.

Event.Name: MatchVoteKickBegin
Event.Desc: Fires in response to someone in the group starting a vote to kick another player from the group using the MatchingGame:InitiateVoteToKick() function.

Param.Name: unitMember
Param.Desc: The member that will be kicked if the vote is successful.

Event.Name: MatchVoteKickEnd
Event.Desc: Fires when the server determines that a vote to kick a player has finished or was canceled.

Event.Name: MatchLookingForReplacements
Event.Desc: Fires when an existing group starts looking for replacements. This event is the result of the MatchingGame:LookForReplacements() function successfully processing.

Event.Name: MatchStoppedLookingForReplacements
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a group that is looking for replacements fills or in response to MatchingGame:StopLookingForReplacements()

Event.Name: PVPMatchStateUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the PvP match's state is changed.

Param.Name: eState
Param.Desc: The match's new state.

Param.Name: fTimeRemaining
Param.Desc: The amount of time remaining before the match automatically changes states, in seconds.

Event.Name: PVPMatchFinished
Event.Desc: Fires when a PvP match ends.

Param.Name: eWinner
Param.Desc: The team that won the match.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The reason that the match ended.

Param.Name: nRatingChangeTeam1
Param.Desc: The amount that Team 1's rating was changed by.

Param.Name: nRatingChangeTeam2
Param.Desc: The amount that Team 2's rating was changed by.

Event.Name: PVPDeathmatchPoolUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the respawn pool is updated during a PvP match with the Deathmatch ruleset, such as Arenas.

Param.Name: nLivesRemainingTeam1
Param.Desc: The number of respawns team 1 has left.

Param.Name: nLivesRemainingTeam2
Param.Desc: The number of respawns team 2 has left.

Event.Name: PVPMatchTeamInfoUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the information for a team in a PvP match is updated during a match. This includes when a team first joins a match.
Event.Example: Examples of changes that could fire this are updating the team's name or rating.

Event.Name: UnitPvpFlagsChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a nearby player changes their PvP flag state.

Param.Name: unitUpdated
Param.Desc: The unit who toggled their PvP flag state.

Event.Name: PvpRatingUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player's or PvP team's rating changes.

Param.Name: eRatingType
Param.Desc: The type of rating that was changed.

Event.Name: AvailableMail
Event.InternalNotes: How is this different from AlertMailInfo?
Event.Desc: Fires mail is added to the player's inbox.
Event.Example:
function Mail:OnAvailableMail(arItems, bNewMail) if not self.wndMain:IsVisible() then self:CalculateMailAlert() return end
self:PopulateList() end

Param.Name: arMail
Param.Desc: An array of mail IDs for the mail added to the player's inbox.

Param.Name: bIsNewMail
Param.Desc: Whether or not the messages added to the player's inbox are "new".

Event.Name: AlertMailInfo
Event.Desc: Fires when the player gets new mail.

Param.Name: tMessageInfo
Param.Desc: A table containing information about the new piece of mail.

Item.Name: strId
Item.Desc: A string with the mail's unique id, in string format.

Item.Name: strSenderName
Item.Desc: The name of the player who sent the mail.

Item.Name: strSubject
Item.Desc: The subject of the mail.

Item.Name: strBody
Item.Desc: The body of the email.

Item.Name: strBodyAML
Item.Desc: The body of the email, along with any formatting strings. This element is not present on every mail message.

Item.Name: fDeliveryTime
Item.Desc: The number of seconds until the mail is received.

Item.Name: fExpirationTime
Item.Desc: The number of seconds until the mail expires.

Item.Name: monCOD
Item.Desc: The amount of money that must be paid before any items can be retreived.

Item.Name: monGift
Item.Desc: The amount of money sent to the recipient.

Item.Name: bIsRead
Item.Desc: Determines whether or not the piece of mail has been read.

Item.Name: bIsSaved
Item.Desc: Determines if the player has archived this piece of mail or not.

Item.Name: bIsReturnable
Item.Desc: Determines whether or not the player can return the piece of mail to the sender. This will typically be false for NPCs or CSRs.

Item.Name: eSenderType
Item.Desc: A number representing the source of the mail. These values line up with the MailSystem.EmailType set of constants.

Item.Name: arAttachments
Item.Desc: A table containing information on the items that are attached to the mail.

Item.Name: itemAttached
Item.Desc: The item object that is attached to the piece of mail

Item.Name: nStackCount
Item.Desc: The number of items in the stack

Item.Name: nServerIndex
Item.Desc: The index of the attachment

Event.Name: UnavailableMail
Event.InternalNotes: Why does this return an array with one element???
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a piece of mail is deleted or the player reports a piece of mail as spam.

Param.Name: strMailId
Param.Desc: An array of strings that contain the mail's Id

Event.Name: RefreshMail
Event.InternalNotes: Why is the id a string?
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player removes money or items attached to a piece of mail.

Param.Name: strMailId
Param.Desc: The mail's unique id number....as a string. Yeah, it's weird.

Event.Name: Vacuum
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player press the key bound to vacuum looting.

Event.Name: FactionFloater
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player gains reputation with a faction and float text should be shown.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit who gained the reputation. This should always be the current player.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: The string that should be displayed in the floating text.

Param.Name: nAmount
Param.Desc: The amount of reputation gained.

Param.Name: strFactionName
Param.Desc: The name of the faction that the player gained reputation with.

Param.Name: idFaction
Param.Desc: The id number of the faction that the player gained reputation with.

Event.Name: QuestFloater
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the quest is advanced, abandoned, failed, or completed. This event is meant to give the UI the information it needs to show floating text related to the quest's state change.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit who the quest belonged to.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: The message that should be shown in the floating text.

Param.Name: queUpdated
Param.Desc: The quest that was updated.

Event.Name: RecallShardChanged
Event.InternalNotes: Does not seem to be called from code. Probably depricated.

Event.Name: CraftingSchematicList
Event.InternalNotes: Does not appear to be getting called in code.

Event.Name: ProfessionsLoaded
Event.Desc: Fires when the player's tradeskills are done loading.

Event.Name: ProfessionUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a profession gains XP, gains a talent point, chooses a talent, unlocks a schematic, or gets traded for another tradeskill.
Event.Remarks: Note, this does not get fired for updates to Runecrafting.

Event.Name: CraftingSchematicLearned
Event.Desc: Fires when the player learns a new crafting schematic.

Param.Name: eTradeskill
Param.Desc: The tradeskill associated with the schematic.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The id number for the schematic that the player learned.

Event.Name: CraftingSchematicComplete
Event.Desc: Fires when the player finishes crafting an item.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The id number for the schematic that was completed.

Param.Name: bSuccess
Param.Desc: Whether or not the crafting attempt was successful.

Param.Name: nXPGained
Param.Desc: The amount of XP gained from the crafting attempt.

Param.Name: arMaterials
Param.Desc: The id number of each material that is returned to the player.

Param.Name: idResultSchematic
Param.Desc: The schematic id for the final item that is created. This can be different from idSchematic when crafting a variant.

Param.Name: idCraftedItem
Param.Desc: The item that was crafted from the schematic.

Event.Name: CraftingDiscoveryHotCold
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player completes a coordinate crafting session inside a discovery area.

Param.Name: eHotColdResult
Param.Desc: Returns how close the previous crafting attempt was to a discoverable recipe.

Param.Name: eDirection
Param.Desc: The direction of the discoverable schematic from the previous result.

Event.Name: CraftingSchematicInfoReceived
Event.InternalNotes: No longer appears to be called by anything in code.

Event.Name: CraftingUpdateCurrent
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the current crafting schematic is updated. This includes starting/resuming a schematic, adding additives and catalysts, adding/removing/modifying microchips, and completing the craft.

Event.Name: TradeskillAchievementComplete
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player finishes an entry on a tradeskill's tech tree.
Event.Remarks: Elements on the tech tree are Achievement type objects, hence the name of the event.

Param.Name: idAchievement
Param.Desc: The id number for the achievement that the player earned.

Event.Name: TradeskillAchievementUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever progress is made on an entry in the player's tech tree.

Param.Name: achUpdated
Param.Desc: The tech tree entry that was updated.

Param.Name: nCurrentProgress
Param.Desc: The progress the player has made towards completing the achievement.

Param.Name: nProgressNeeded
Param.Desc: The total amount of progress needed to complete the achievement.

Event.Name: ShowItemInDressingRoom
Event.Desc: Fires when the player presses Control + right click on a piece of equipment in a bag window.

Param.Name: itemPreview
Param.Desc: The item that the player wants to preview.

Event.Name: CraftingModItem
Event.InternalNotes: The functionality tied to this event seems to be depricated.
Event.Desc: Fires when the player is holding ALT and clicks on an item. This fires when the mouse button is raised.

Param.Name: itemMod
Param.Desc: The item that the player is attempting to moddify.

Event.Name: ShowTutorial
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a tutorial should be shown or when the UI calls Event_ShowTutorial(). It informs the UI which tutorial to display and where to display it.

Param.Name: idTutorial
Param.Desc: The tutorial's id number.

Param.Name: bInstant
Param.Desc: Whether the tutorial is shown immediately or is placed in a queue.

Param.Name: strText
Param.Desc: The text for the tutorial.

Param.Name: eAnchor
Param.Desc: The anchor that the tutorial should be attached to.

Param.Name: wndContainer
Param.Desc: The window where the tutorial is displayed.

Param.Name: nOffsetX
Param.Desc: The amount the window is offset from the anchor along the X axis.

Param.Name: nOffsetY
Param.Desc: The amount the window is offset from the anchor point along the Y axis.

Event.Name: LootRollUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a new item is added or removed from the list of items that the player can roll for.

Event.Name: MasterLootUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the items available to be assigned by the master looter change. This is fired for everyone in the party or raid.

Event.Name: PendingLootInteract
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure how to get this to fire.

Event.Name: MapTrackedUnitUpdate
Event.InternalNotes: Unable to figure out how to track units on the zone map, so unable to get this to fire.

Event.Name: MapTrackedUnitDisable
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure of how to track units on the map, so unable to get this to fire.

Event.Name: NextFrame
Event.InternalNotes: Really? We're firing an event every frame that's just saying the frame updated?
Event.Desc: Fires once every frame.

Event.Name: DialogClosing
Event.InternalNotes: Unknown usage.

Event.Name: ScriptResurrect
Event.Desc: Fires when the player is forced to resurrect by a scripted event in game.

Event.Name: GuildQueueStateChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the arena team's or warparty's enters a queue, leaves a queue, enters a match, or leaves a match.
Event.Remarks: Possible values for the different states are: GuildLib.GuildQueueState_Normal GuildLib.GuildQueueState_Queuing GuildLib.GuildQueueState_Queued GuildLib.GuildQueueState_InBattle

Param.Name: guildUpdated
Param.Desc: The guild who's queue state has updated.

Param.Name: eOldState
Param.Desc: The guild's previous queue state. This lines up with the GuildLib.GuildQueueState set of constants.

Param.Name: eNewState
Param.Desc: The guild's new queue state. This lines up with the GuildLib.GuildQueueState set of constants.

Event.Name: DuelAccepted
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player accepts a duel request.

Param.Name: fCountdownTimer
Param.Desc: The countdown timer before the duel starts (in seconds).

Event.Name: CharacterFlagsUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player's state flags are updated. Changing any of the following states will trigger this event: PvP Flag Block Friendships Limit Hazard Rez Ignore Duel Requests Hide Top Guild Holomark Hide Left Guild Holomark Hide Right Guild Holomark Hide Back Guild Holomark Disable Character Display Guild Holomark Near Require Name Change

Event.Name: RefreshHealthShieldBar
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the a unit's health or shields is updated.
Event.Remarks: Note, this is not fired if the player's absorption shield is updated. Also, if the damage is applied to both health and shields, this event will fire twice.
Event.InternalNotes: It would be awesome if we could get the unit whose health / shields updated and if it fired when absorb shields update.

Event.Name: ToggleChallengesWindow
Event.InternalNotes: This does not seem to be called.

Event.Name: ToggleTradeskills
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player presses the key bound to Tradeskills. This only fires for the player that pressed the key.

Event.Name: WorkOrderLocate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player clicks a work order quest in the Quest Tracker.
Event.Remarks: This event is intended to open the tradeskill window to the appropriate schematic

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The id number of the schematic required for the work order.

Event.Name: InterfaceMenu_ToggleLoreWindow
Event.InternalNotes: This should probably be renamed to something more generic like every other event.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player presses the key bound to the Lore window.

Event.Name: ToggleSocialWindow
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player presses the key bound to the Social window. It is only sent to the player that pressed the button.

Event.Name: ToggleReputationInterface
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the UI calls Event_ToggleReputationWindow(). This is only fired to the player with the addon that called the function.

Event.Name: InvokeFriendsList
Event.InternalNotes: The keybinding that would have called this is removed.

Event.Name: ChallengeShared
Event.InternalNotes: Is this even possible anymore?
Event.Desc: Fired when a challenge is shared with the player.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number of the challenge being shared.

Param.Name: idSharingPlayer
Param.Desc: The id number of the player who shared the challenge.

Param.Name: nTimeToAccept
Param.Desc: The amount of time the player has to accept the challenge (in seconds).

Event.Name: ChallengeShareTimedOut
Event.InternalNotes: Is sharing challenges even a thing?
Event.Desc: Fires when the player runs out of time to accept a shared challenge.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number of the challenge that was shared.

Event.Name: StanceChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player changes their character's innate ability. This event is only sent to the player who triggered it.

Event.Name: ActionBarNonSpellShortcutAddFailed
Event.Desc: Fires when a non-spell fails to be placed on the action bar.
Event.Example: function FloatText:OnActionBarNonSpellShortcutAddFailed() local strMessage = Apollo.GetString("FloatText_ActionBarAddFail") self:OnSpellCastFailed( LuaEnumMessageType.GenericPlayerInvokedError, nil, GameLib.GetControlledUnit(), GameLib.GetControlledUnit(), strMessage ) end

Event.Name: StunVGPressed
Event.Desc: Fired once every half second that the player is stunned. This informs the UI of whether the player pressed the correct button to break out of the stun. This event is only fired for the person who is stunned.

Param.Name: bButtonPressed
Param.Desc: Whether the player pressed the correct button or not.

Event.Name: ItemLink
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player attempts to add an item link to the chat window.

Param.Name: itemLinked
Param.Desc: The item that was linked in chat.

Event.Name: ToggleFramerate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player toggles the framerate display (Ctrl + F by default). This is only fired for the client where the key combination was pressed.

Event.Name: HintArrowDistanceUpdate
Event.InternalNotes: Unable to get this to fire.

Event.Name: DyeLearned
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player learns a new dye color.

Param.Name: idDye
Param.Desc: The id number of the dye.

Param.Name: arDyeInfo
Param.Desc: A list of ids for each dye the player has learned.

Event.Name: PlayerEquippedItemChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player equips or removes a piece of equipment.

Param.Name: eSlot
Param.Desc: The equipment slot that was updated.

Param.Name: itemNew
Param.Desc: The item that was placed in the slot after the update. If no item was added, then this value will be nil.

Param.Name: itemOld
Param.Desc: The item that was in the slot before the update. If the slot was empty, this value will be nil.

Event.Name: Group_Request_Result
Event.Desc: Fires whenever actions related to joining an existing group processed by the server.

Param.Name: strPlayerName
Param.Desc: The name of the player whose group the player is attempting to join.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The type of action that was processed.

Param.Name: bIsJoin
Param.Desc: Whether the message is an attempt to join the group or not.

Event.Name: Group_JoinRequest
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player sends a request to join an existing party.

Param.Name: strRequesterName
Param.Desc: The name of the player requesting to join the group.

Event.Name: Group_Referral
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a group member referrs another player for an invitation to the group.

Param.Name: nMemberIdx
Param.Desc: The group index of the member who sent the referral.

Param.Name: strTargetName
Param.Desc: The name of the player that was referred to the group.

Event.Name: Group_MemberOrderChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the group's order has changed.
Event.Example: Note, this functionality is not currently implemented, so this event will never fire.

Event.Name: Group_MentorLeftAOI
Event.Desc: Fired whenever a pair of players using mentoring get too far apart, when the players move within range again, and when the timer to move within range runs out.

Param.Name: nTimeUntilCanceled
Param.Desc: How long the players have (in seconds) to return to eachother's Area of Interest before the Mentoring status is canceled.

Param.Name: bTimerStop
Param.Desc: Whether or not the countdown timer has stopped. This can be because the players have moved within range of eachother or the timer has expired.

Event.Name: RaidInfoResponse
Event.InternalNotes: Unsure how to get this to fire. I don't think we're handling it atm.

Event.Name: GuildInfoMessage
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a guild's Info Message is updated.

Param.Name: guildOwner
Param.Desc: The guild whose Info Message has changed.

Event.Name: GuildEventLogChange
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player joins the guild, a player leaves the guild, the guild unlocks a perk, activates a perk, or calls Guild:RequestEventLogList()

Param.Name: guildSource
Param.Desc: The guild whose logs have changed.

Event.Name: GuildBankLog
Event.InternalNotes: Lots of coding standard fixes needed.
Event.Desc: Returns the results from Guild:RequestBankLogs(), Guild:RequestMoneyLogs(), and Guild:RequestRepairLogs().

Param.Name: guildOwner
Param.Desc: The guild that owns the bank that the logs belong to.

Param.Name: arLogs
Param.Desc:
Each log entry contains the name of the player who performed the action and the time since the action occurred. All other variables depend on the type of log entry. The different combinations are:
uMoneyDeposit
uMoneyWithdraw
uRepairWithdraw
nTab uItemDeposit nStack
nTab uItemWithdraw nStack

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the player that performed the action in the log.

Item.Name: fOccuredAgoDays
Item.Desc: The amount of time since the action was created (in days).

Item.Name: uMoneyDeposit
Item.Desc: The money that was deposited in the bank.

Item.Name: uMoneyWithdraw
Item.Desc: The money that was withdrawn from the bank.

Item.Name: uRepairWithdraw
Item.Desc: The money that was spent on a guild repair.

Item.Name: nTab
Item.Desc: The tab that an item was added or removed from.

Item.Name: nStack
Item.Desc: The number of items in the stack that was added or removed from the guild bank.

Item.Name: uItemDeposit
Item.Desc: The item that was deposited in the guild bank.

Item.Name: uItemWithdraw
Item.Desc: The item that was withdrawn from the guild bank.

Event.Name: FriendshipInvitesRecieved
Event.InternalNotes: PlayerPathLib.PlayerPathType needs to be converted to an enum. Some variables need coding standard fix.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player receives a new friend invite.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The friend id associated with the invite.

Item.Name: strCharacterName
Item.Desc: The name of the character that sent the invite.

Item.Name: nClassId
Item.Desc: The inviting character's class.

Item.Name: nPathId
Item.Desc: This lines up with the PlayerPathLib.PlayerPathType set of constants.

Item.Name: nLevel
Item.Desc: The invitor's current level.

Item.Name: bIsNew
Item.Desc: Whether or the player has seen the invite before or not.

Item.Name: strNote
Item.Desc: The note that was sent along with the invite.

Item.Name: fDaysUntilExpired
Item.Desc: The number of days before the invite automatically expires.

Event.Name: FriendshipInviteRemoved
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player declines a friend invite from another player.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id of the invite that was removed.

Event.Name: FriendshipAccountInvitesRecieved
Event.Desc: Fired whenever the player receives an account friend invite from another player or when the player logs in.
Event.InternalNotes: FriendshipLib.CharacterFriendshipType needs to be set as an enum. strInviteType needs to use proper naming convention.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The friendship id for the invite.

Item.Name: strInviteType
Item.Desc: The type of invite that was received. This value lines up with the FriendshipLib.CharacterFriendshipType set of int constants.

Item.Name: strNote
Item.Desc: The note that was sent along with the invite.

Item.Name: strDisplayName
Item.Desc: The display name of the player who sent the invite. This should be the name of the character that they're currently on @ the realm that that player is on.

Item.Name: bIsNew
Item.Desc: Whether the invite has been seen by the player before or not.

Event.Name: FriendshipAccountInviteRemoved
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player declines an account friend invite from another player.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The id number for the invite that was sent.

Event.Name: FriendshipAccountFriendsRecieved
Event.InternalNotes: FriendshipLib.AccountPresenceState needs to be converted to an enum
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player accepts an account friend invite that was sent to them, when another player accepts an account friend invite that they sent, or when the player logs in.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The new friend id.

Item.Name: strPublicNote
Item.Desc: The new friend's public note.

Item.Name: strPrivateNote
Item.Desc: The new friend's private note.

Item.Name: strCharacterName
Item.Desc: The name of the character that the account friend is currently on.

Item.Name: nPresenceState
Item.Desc: The player's current presence state. This lines up with the FriendshipLib.AccountPresenceState set of contants.

Item.Name: fLastOnline
Item.Desc: The amount of time since the player was last online (in days). If this value is 0, then the player is online.

Event.Name: FriendshipAccountFriendRemoved
Event.Desc: Fires whenever one person on either side of an account friendship removes the other as an account friend.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id of the account friend that was removed.

Event.Name: FriendshipAccountCharacterLevelUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an account friend's character gains a level.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The friend id of the player that gained a level.

Event.Name: FriendshipAccountDataUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an account friend's nickname, presence, public note, or online/offline status changes.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The account friend ID of the player.

Event.Name: FriendshipAccountPersonalStatusUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires if an account friend logs on or off, updates their presence, or updates their public note.

Event.Name: CombatLogFallingDamage
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player takes fall damage

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that took the falling damage. This should always be the current player.

Param.Name: nAmount
Param.Desc: The amount of damage the player took.

Event.Name: CombatLogDatacube
Event.InternalNotes: Need to change DatacubeLib.DatacubeType int contstants to enums.
Event.Desc: Fires when the player interacts with a datacube, journal, or TFBTF entry in the world.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit that activated the datacube. This will always be the current player.

Item.Name: eDatacubeType
Item.Desc: The type of datacube. This can be either DatacubeLib.DatacubeType_Datacube, DatacubeLib.DatacubeType_Chronicle (Tales from Beyond the Fringe), or DatacubeLib.DatacubeType_Journal.

Item.Name: bHasPieces
Item.Desc: Whether or not the datacube has multiple parts. This should only be true for Tales from Beyond the Fringe.

Event.Name: ShieldsOverloaded
Event.InternalNotes: Need to figure out how shields get overloaded.
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a unit's shields are overloaded or the overload effect ends.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit whose shields are overloaded or lost the overloaded state.

Param.Name: bOverloaded
Param.Desc: Whether the shields entered or left the overloaded state.

Event.Name: RealmBroadcastTierMedium
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a medium priority message is broadcast to the entire realm.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: The message that was broadcast.

Event.Name: RealmFirstAchievementAnnounce
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player or guild is the first on the realm to earn an achievement. This only applies to select achievements, such as hitting a certain level, reaching the highest tier of a tradeskill, and clearing certain dungeons and raids, etc.

Param.Name: idAchievement
Param.Desc: The achievement that the player or guild earned.

Param.Name: bGuildAchievement
Param.Desc: Whether the achievement was a guild achievement or not.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: The name of the player or guild who earned the achievement.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: The message that is broadcast to the realm when the achievement is earned.

Event.Name: RealmBroadcastTierHigh
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a high priority message is broadcast to the entire realm.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: The message that was broadcast.

Event.Name: GameClickSky
Event.Desc: Fires when the player left clicks on the sky.

Event.Name: HousingMannequinOpen
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with a Mannequin.

Event.Name: HousingMannequinClose
Event.Desc: Fires when the player is interacting with a mannequin and either interacts with another NPC or moves too far away from the mannequin.

Event.Name: HousingBasicsUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player changes the visitor rules for their housing plot.

Event.Name: HarvestItemsSentToOwner
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player harvests resources on a neighbor's housing plot while the plot's Resource Sharing returns more than 0% to the owner.

Item.Name: item
Item.Desc: The item that is sent to the plug's owner.

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The stack count of the item that is sent to the plug's owner.

Event.Name: ToggleAuctionList
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player presses the keybinding tied to the Marketplace Listings. This event is only fired for the player who presses the keybind.

Event.Name: DuelLeftArea
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player leaves the dueling area.

Param.Name: fWarningTime
Param.Desc: The amount of time (in seconds) that the player has to re-enter the dueling area before they forfiet.

Event.Name: DuelCancelWarning
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player re-enters the dueling area while the "Left Area" warning is displayed.

Event.Name: SpecChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player attempts to change their spec. This event is only seen by the player that triggers the event.

Param.Name: nSpecIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the spec that the player changed to.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The result of the player's attempt to change their spec. This will show any errors caused by the attempt, or OK if successful.

Event.Name: CharacterEldanAugmentationsUpdated
Event.InternalNotes: We may want to rename this event from Eldan Augmentations to AMPs
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player selects an AMP or purchases an AMP reset.

Event.Name: CharacterUnlockedInlaidEldanAugmentation
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player unlocks a new AMP.

Event.Name: PlayedTime
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player types /played in chat.

Param.Name: strCreationMessage
Param.Desc: A string describing when the character was created.

Param.Name: strPlayedTotal
Param.Desc: A string describing the amount of time the player has played the game.

Param.Name: strPlayedThisLevel
Param.Desc: A string describing how much time the player has spent in game since gaining a level.

Param.Name: strPlayedThisSession
Param.Desc: A string describing how long the player has played since logging in this session.

Param.Name: strCreationDate
Param.Desc: A string that contains the character's creation date and time.

Param.Name: nTimePlayedTotal
Param.Desc: The amount of time that the player has played this character, in seconds.

Param.Name: nTimePlayedLevel
Param.Desc: The amount of time that the player has played since the character last leveled up, in seconds.

Param.Name: nTimePlayedSession
Param.Desc: The amount of time the player has played since logging in, in seconds.

Event.Name: PublicEventCleared
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a PublicEvent is removed from the player's list of active events.
Event.InternalNotes: This doesn't seem to be called like I thought. Might not ever be called. This might be depricated and replaced with PublicEventLeave.

Param.Name: peEnding
Param.Desc: The PublicEvent that was cleared from the active list.

Event.Name: PlayerPathSoldierNewWhackAMoleBurrows
Event.InternalNotes: Have not been able to find any of these missions in game. Also, this is not referenced in lua. Depricated?

Event.Name: SoldierHoldoutDeath
Event.Desc: Fires if a player that has either triggered the Holdout or damaged Holdout NPCs dies.

Param.Name: solHoldout
Param.Desc: The holdout that the player was participating in.

Event.Name: TradeSkillSigilResult
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player attempts to add a rune to a rune slot on a piece of equipment.

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The result of the player's attempt to add a rune to a piece of equipment.

Event.Name: TradeskillEngravingStationOpen
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with an Engraving Station NPC.

Event.Name: TradeskillEngravingStationClose
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with another NPC or moves away from the Engraving Station while they are interacting with it.

Event.Name: UnitEvaded
Event.Desc: Fires if an NPC evades or resets due to the player being in stealth for too long.
Event.Remarks: Note: This does not fire for creatures tethering naturally.
Event.InternalNotes: We need an enum for eReason.

Param.Name: unitEvading
Param.Desc: The unit that evaded.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that the NPC was targeting before it evaded.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The reason that the NPC evaded. This should be either 2 (Timeout), 5 (FailedToPath) or 6 (StealthWanderTimeout)

Param.Name: strText
Param.Desc: The floating text that should be shown when the unit evades.

Event.Name: MountUnlocked
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player unlocks a new mount.

Param.Name: nMountId
Param.Desc: The id number of the mount that was unlocked.

Event.Name: Inspect
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the server returns information from the Unit:Inspect() function.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that the inspect function was called on.

Param.Name: arItems
Param.Desc: The items that unitTarget currently has equipped.

Event.Name: ChatAccountTellFailed
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player tries to send an account whisper to an invalid player.

Param.Name: channelWhisper
Param.Desc: The chat channel that the player tried to whisper from. This should always be the "Account Whisper" channel.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: The name of the player who was intended to receive the account whisper.

Event.Name: AccountSupportTicketResult
Event.InternalNotes: Need more info on this one. It seems to be the channel to display the success/fail message and whether or not it succeeded or failed, but it's hard to tell
Event.Desc: Informs the player if the ticket that they submitted successfully made it to the server or not.
Event.Example: function ChatLog:OnAccountSupportTicketResult( channelSource, bSuccess ) if( bSuccess ) then ChatSystemLib.PostOnChannel(ChatSystemLib.ChatChannel_System, Apollo.GetString("PlayerTicket_TicketSent"), "") else ChatSystemLib.PostOnChannel(ChatSystemLib.ChatChannel_System, Apollo.GetString("PlayerTicket_TicketFailed"), "") end end

Param.Name: channelGM
Param.Desc: The chat channel where the message will be displayed.

Param.Name: bSuccess
Param.Desc: Whether or not the ticket was successfully sent.

Event.Name: ChatReply
Event.Desc: Fires when the player uses the ChatReply keybinding.

Event.Name: ChatReWhisper
Event.InternalNotes: We are not using this at the moment, making the keybinding do nothing.
Event.Desc: Fires when the Chat Re-Whisper keybinding is pressed.

Event.Name: CityDirectionsList
Event.Desc: Fires when the player interacts with a guard in a capital city.

Event.Name: CityDirectionsClose
Event.Desc: Fires when the City Directions UI closes.

Event.Name: CityDirectionMarked
Event.Desc: Fires when a city direction marker is displayed on the map / minimap

Item.Name: idDestination
Item.Desc: The direction marker's ID.

Item.Name: eType
Item.Desc: The type of NPC that the player is being guided towards.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the direction marker's destination.

Item.Name: x
Item.Desc: The x coordinate of the city direction's destination.

Item.Name: y
Item.Desc: The y coordinate of the city direction's destination.

Item.Name: z
Item.Desc: The z coordinate of the city direction's destination

Event.Name: CityDirectionClear
Event.Desc: Removes the specified direction marker from the map.

Param.Name: idDirection
Param.Desc: The ID number for the direction that should be cleared.

Event.Name: CraftingStationClose
Event.Desc: Fired when the player stops interacting with or moves too far away from a crafting station.

Event.Name: MatchVoteSurrenderBegin
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a call to MatchingGame:InitiateVoteToSurrender() is successfully called by someone on the player's team during a PvP match.

Event.Name: MatchVoteSurrenderEnd
Event.Desc: Fires when the server determines that a vote to surrender a PvP match has finished or was canceled.

Event.Name: PvpKillNotification
Event.Desc: Fires when a player is killed in PvP.

Param.Name: strVictimName
Param.Desc: The name of the player that was killed.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The reason the victim died.

Param.Name: strKillerName
Param.Desc: The name of the unit that killed the victim.

Param.Name: eKillerClass
Param.Desc: The killer's class.

Param.Name: eVictimTeam
Param.Desc: The team that the victim is on.

Event.Name: MatchingEligibilityChanged
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a group member's eligibility for the dungeon that the group is queued for changes.

Event.Name: WarplotBattleStateChanged
Event.Desc: Fires when the player enters the warplot or when one of the warparty's plugs is destroyed.

Event.Name: WarPartyMatchResults
Event.Desc: Fires when a Warplot match ends. This event is sent to every player involved in the match.

Item.Name: nRating
Item.Desc: The amount that the team's rating changed by.

Item.Name: nRepairCost
Item.Desc: The amount it will cost the team to repair their warplot.

Item.Name: nDestroyedPlugs
Item.Desc: The number of the team's plugs that were destroyed during the match.

Item.Name: nWarCoinsEarned
Item.Desc: The number of Warcoins that the team earned during the match.

Event.Name: MailBoxActivate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player interacts with a mailbox.

Event.Name: MailBoxDeactivate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player is interacting with a mailbox and interacts with another targets or moves far enough away from the mailbox.

Event.Name: MailResult
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an error is thrown when the player attempts to perform a mail action

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The reason the operation failed.

Event.Name: MailAddAttachment
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player right clicks an item in their inventory to attach it to a mail message.
Event.Example: The value from this function can be passed into functions such as Unit:LockInventorySlot().

Param.Name: nLocationId
Param.Desc: An id number that represents the item's location in the player's inventory.

Event.Name: TutorialPlaybackEnded
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the VO for a tutorial ends.

Event.Name: ZoneCompletionUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player enters a zone, explores a new part of the zone, or completes a challenge, task, datacube, or path mission

Param.Name: idZone
Param.Desc: The id number for the zone whose completion percentage was updated.

Event.Name: ZoneMapPlayerIndicatorUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player is added or removed from the Zone Map.
Event.Remarks: An example of this is when a player joins or leaves a group.

Param.Name: bVisible
Param.Desc: Whether the player is visible on the map or not.

Event.Name: AccountPendingItemsUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires when items are added or removed from the pending list for the player's account inventory.

Event.Name: AccountInventoryUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires when the Account Inventory for the current account has changed.

Event.Name: AccountEntitlementUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires when a change is made to the current account's entitlements.
Event.Example: function AccountInventory:OnAccountEntitlementUpdate() if not self.wndMain or not self.wndMain:IsValid() then return end self:RefreshEntitlements() end

Event.Name: CharacterEntitlementUpdate
Event.InternalNotes: Need a way to test this to see how it works.

Event.Name: WalletUpdate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the wallet tied to a player's account updates. The wallet is used to purchase microtransaction items.

Param.Name: nAmount
Param.Desc: The amount of currency that was added to the player's wallet.

Event.Name: NewCustomerSurveyRequest
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player is asked to fill out a customer survey.

Param.Name: nSurveyCount
Param.Desc: The number of customer surveys the player has queued.

Event.Name: GenericEvent_PlayerCampStart
Event.InternalNotes: This does not appear to be fired from code.
Event.Desc: Fired whenever the player starts to log off.

Event.Name: GenericEvent_PlayerExitCancel
Event.Desc: Fires when the player cancels the log off timer.

Event.Name: LoginError
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an error is thrown while the player attempts to log in.

Param.Name: strErrorMessage
Param.Desc: The error message that should be shown to the player.

Param.Name: bHandled
Param.Desc: Whether or not the error was handled before it affected the player.

Event.Name: ReputationLevel
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player reaches a new reputation level with a faction.

Param.Name: strReputationLevel
Param.Desc: The name of the reputation level that the player reached.

Param.Name: strFactionName
Param.Desc: The name of the faction that the player gained reputation with.

Event.Name: ReputationBoundryWarning
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player has 75% of the reputation required to reach the next reputation level with a faction

Param.Name: strReputationLevel
Param.Desc: The name of the reputation level that the player is approaching.

Param.Name: strFactionName
Param.Desc: The name of the faction that the player gained reputation with.

Event.Name: Group_MentorRelationship
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a player begins mentoring another player. This event is passed to every member in the group.

Param.Name: unitMentor
Param.Desc: The unit that is mentoring the other member.

Param.Name: unitMentee
Param.Desc: The unit being mentored.

Event.Name: MatchingPvpInactivityAlert
Event.Desc: Fires at regular intervals if the player is AFK in a PvP match. This is triggered when the player has 2 minutes, 1 minute, 30 seconds, and 5 second intervals before they are removed from a match.

Param.Name: nRemainingTimeMs
Param.Desc: The amount of time before the player is removed from the match, in Milliseconds.

Event.Name: ToggleGhostModeMap
Event.InternalNotes: Could not get this to fire.
Event.Desc: Fired whenever the player presses the button to toggle the ghost mode. This is only fired for the player.

Event.Name: BankSlotPurchased
Event.Desc: Fires when the player successfully purchases a bank slot.
Event.Example: function BankViewer:OnBankSlotPurchased() self.wndMain:FindChild("BankTitleText"):SetText(Apollo.GetString("Bank_BuySuccess")) Apollo.CreateTimer("BankViewer_NewBagPurchasedAlert", 12, false) self:Build() end

Event.Name: CombatLogLAS
Event.Desc: Fires when a player changes their Limited Action Set.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that changed their Limited Action Set. This should always be the current player.

Event.Name: CombatLogBuildSwitch
Event.Desc: Fires when the player switches to a different action set.

Item.Name: unitCaster
Item.Desc: The unit who changed their build. Since this event shold only be fired for the current player, this should always be them.

Item.Name: nNewSpecIndex
Item.Desc: The index of player's new spec.

Event.Name: CommodityAuctionFilledPartial
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a buy or sell order on the Commodities Exchange is partially filled by another player.

Param.Name: nFilledCount
Param.Desc: How many items in the order were actually bought or sold.

Param.Name: orderFilled
Param.Desc: The order that was partially filled.

Event.Name: CommodityAuctionsDisabled
Event.Desc: Fired when the Commodity Exchange gets disabled or enabled.
Event.Remarks: This is only for actions taken by GMs that enable and disable the Commodity Exchange for everyone on the server

Param.Name: bDisabled
Param.Desc: Whether or not this event was fired because the Commodity Exchange is disabled.

Event.Name: ItemAuctionBidPosted
Event.Desc: Fires whenever someone places a bid on an item that the player has posted on the Auction House. This does not apply for items where the person who bought the item selected the "Buy Now" option

Param.Name: auctBidOn
Param.Desc: The auction that was bid on.

Event.Name: ItemAuctionsDisabled
Event.Desc: Fires if the Auction House is disabled or re-enabled by the server.

Param.Name: bDisabled
Param.Desc: Whether or not the Auction House is disabled.

Event.Name: CREDDExchangeWindowClose
Event.Desc: Fires when the player changes their interaction target from a CREDD Exchange to another NPC, when a player moves far enough away from a CREDD Exchange, or after Event_CancelCREDDExchange() is called.

Event.Name: ToggleCREDDExchangeWindow
Event.Desc: Fires when the player interacts with a CREDD Exchange NPC.

Event.Name: CREDDExchangeInfoResults
Event.Desc: Returns results for the CREDDExchangeLib.RequestExchangeInfo() call from the server.

Item.Name: nBuyOrderCount
Item.Desc: The number of CREDD buy orders that are open.

Item.Name: nSellOrderCount
Item.Desc: The number of CREDD sell orders that are open.

Item.Name: monPrice
Item.Desc: The amount that the buy order is paying for CREDD.

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of CREDD that the buy order tries to buy before it is fulfilled.

Item.Name: monPrice
Item.Desc: The amount of money the sell order is asking for each CREDD.

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of CREDD available in the sell order.

Param.Name: arOrders
Param.Desc: A table with all the CREDD buy and sell orders.

Event.Name: PublicEventLeave
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player leaves a public event area or zone.

Param.Name: peEvent
Param.Desc: The public event that the player left.

Param.Name: eReason
Param.Desc: The reason the event was fired. This lines up with the PublicEvent.PublicEventParticipantRemoveReason set of int constants.

Event.Name: MailRead
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player opens a piece of mail that was previously unread.

Param.Name: strMailId
Param.Desc: The identifier for the mail that was read.

Event.Name: ProfessionAchievementUpdated
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player crafts an item that advances a node in the Tradeskill tech tree.

Param.Name: achUpdated
Param.Desc: The achievement that go updated.

Function.Name: Event_FireGenericEvent
Function.Desc: Fires an event for other addons to handle.
Function.Remarks: This will fire any custom event, making it easy to pass information between addons on the same machine. Any additional parameters passed in to the function will be passed along in the function handler.

Param.Name: strEventName
Param.Desc: The event that you want to fire.

Function.Name: Event_ToggleQuestLog
Function.Desc: Fires the ToggleQuestLog event.

Function.Name: Event_ToggleCodex
Function.Desc: Fires the ToggleCodex event.

Function.Name: Event_ShowQuestLog
Function.Desc: Fires the ShowQuestLog event.

Param.Name: idQuest
Param.Desc: The id number of the quest that the Quest Log should open to.

Function.Name: Event_HideQuestLog
Function.Desc: Fires the HideQuestLog event.

Function.Name: Event_ToggleAchievementWindow
Function.Desc: Fires the ToggleAchievementWindow event.

Function.Name: Event_CloseVendorWindow
Function.Desc: Fires the CloseVendorWindow event.

Function.Name: Event_CancelVending
Function.Desc: If the player's current interact target is a Vendor NPC, this function deselects it and fires the CloseVendorWindow event.

Function.Name: Event_CancelTaxiVendor
Function.Desc: If the player's current interact target is a Taxi NPC, this function deselects it and fires the TaxiWindowClose event.

Function.Name: Event_CancelConverting
Function.Desc: If the player's current interact target is a resource conversion NPC, this function deselects it and fires the ResourceConversionClose event.

Function.Name: Event_CancelExperimentation
Function.InternalNotes: If there is no event tied to it and it does not cancel the mission, what's the point?
Function.Desc: If the player's current interact target is a Scientist Experimentation mission, this clears it.
Function.Remarks: Currently, this only changes things on the back end. This function will not cancel the Experimentation mission and has no event tied to it.

Function.Name: Event_CloseTradeskillTrainerWindow
Function.InternalNotes: Why do we have this? It seems less safe than Event_CancelTradeskillTraining.
Function.Desc: Calls the CloseTradeskillTrainerWindow event and clears the player's interact target if it is a tradeskill trainer (which will call CloseTradeskillTrainerWindow a second time).
Function.Remarks: This differs from the Event_CancelTradeskillTraining function in that it is guarenteed to call CloseTradeskillTrainerWindow, even if the player isn't targeting a tradeskill trainer. Because of this, Event_CancelTradeskillTraining is a safer function to use.

Function.Name: Event_CancelTradeskillTraining
Function.Desc: If the player's current interact target is a Tradeskill Trainer NPC, this function deselects it and fires the CloseTradeskillTrainer event.

Param.Name: nRelativePosition2

Event.Name: ActionSetError
Event.Desc: Fires when the player attempts to save an invalid action set.
Event.Example:
function Abilities:OnActionSetError(eResult) local strMessage = nil if eResult == ActionSetLib.CodeEnumLimitedActionSetResult.InVoid then strMessage = Apollo.GetString("ActionSet_Error_InTheVoid") end
if strMessage then self:BuildWindow() -- This can happen after the set has "successfully" closed, so bring it back up if closed self:HelperShowError(strMessage) end end

Param.Name: eResult
Param.Desc: The message describing why there is an error in the current action set.

Function.InternalNotes: If we're actually going to use this, we should expand it. Otherwise, cut it.
Function.Desc: Returns one of three resolutions that were used in early development.
Function.Remarks: This should not be used, as we have other ways of getting a more accurate look at the client's resolution.
Function.Example:
The table that is polled has three resolutions that fill indexes 0-2. These are:
0 = "1024x768" 1 = "1280x1024" 2 = "1600x1200"

Function.Name: String_GetString
Function.InternalNotes: This seems like a precursor to Apollo.GetString(). We should probably use one or the other.
Function.Desc: Returns a localized string using the specified string id.

Param.Name: idString
Param.Desc: The id number for the string that this should return.

Function.Name: String_GetWeaselString
Function.InternalNotes: Needs more localization documentation
Function.Desc: Concatinates localized strings that contain tokens with other parameters.
Function.Example:
Localized strings can have a number of different tokens that are used to create specialized strings. Input tokens always begin with $ and include the parameter number that goes in that location. For example: $1n will add the first parameter at this location and expects a string. $5f will add the fifth parameter at this location and expects a floating point value.
Input token key: n = string c = integer f[0-9] = floating point number that is limited to 0-9 decimal places. If the number of decimal places is not set, it will not use a limit.
^ = capitalize the next string ~ = uncapitalize the next string
m = force pluralization of the string (note, this requires the string to have pluralization text, which is explained below) + = show the count and the pluralized name. This requires a table with "count" (the number of the thing) and "name" (the string to pluralize) as variables within the table. # = pluralize the string based on the "count", but do not show the count. This requires a table with "count" (the number of the thing) and "name" (the string to pluralize) as variables within the table. Example:
EnumName: CRB_Knife string: knife{p:knives}
EnumName: CRB_Stab_Em_With_Your string: Stab em with your $#(1)
EnumName: CRB_Stab_Em_With_Your_Count string: Stab em with your $+(1)
Lua: local nNumberOfKnives = 1
local tActor1 = { ["count"] = nNumberOfKnives, ["name"] = Apollo.GetString("CRB_Knife") }
Print(String_GetWeaselString(Apollo.GetString("CRB_Stab_Em_With_Your"), tActor1)) tActor1[count] = 2
Print(String_GetWeaselString(Apollo.GetString("CRB_Stab_Em_With_Your"), tActor1)) Print(String_GetWeaselString(Apollo.GetString(CRB_Stab_Em_With_Your_Count), tActor1))
Output: Stab em with your knife Stab em with your knives Stab em with your 2 knives

Param.Name: idString
Param.Desc: The id number of the base string.

Param.Name: oParameter
Param.Desc: The function can take in any number or type of parameter depending on what the string needs. Every variable after the idString needs to match the type and order that the string is expected.

ReturnValue.Desc: The final string after the variables are added.

Event.Name: LootBindcheck
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player attempts to loot an item that is Bind on Pickup while in a group.

Param.Name: tLootInfo
Param.Desc: A table that contains information about the Bind on Pickup items that the player is trying to loot.

Item.Name: nLootId
Item.Desc: A unique identifier for the item that was dropped.

Item.Name: itemDrop
Item.Desc: The item that was dropped.

Event.Name: BarberOpen
Event.InternalNotes: This is a depricated event used for Character Customization.

Event.Name: BarberClose

Library.Name: Apollo
Library.Desc: A library that primarily contains system-level functionality, such as registering events, controling addons, detecting key presses, and manipulating console variables.

Event.Name: TextMessage
Event.InternalNotes: The only place we were calling this has been commented out. It is no longer in use.

Event.Name: SystemKeyDown
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player presses a key.

Param.Name: nKey
Param.Desc: The ASCII code for the key that was pressed.

Event.Name: DragDropSysBegin
Event.Desc: Fires when the player starts a drag-drop operation by holding the mouse button down while the cursor is over a BagWindow or ActionBarButton.

Param.Name: wndSource
Param.Desc: The window that the object originated from.

Param.Name: strType
Param.Desc: The type of object that will be affected by the drag-drop operation. This should either be "DDBagItem" for items and "DDSpellbookItem" for spells.

Param.Name: nStartLocation
Param.Desc: The location where the object was grabbed.

Event.Name: DragDropSysEnd
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player lets go of the mouse button during a drag-drop operation.

Param.Name: strType
Param.Desc: The type of object that was dragged by the operation.

Param.Name: nEndLocation
Param.Desc: The location where the object was dropped.

Event.Name: LuaError
Event.Desc: Fires whenever an error is thrown in an addon's code.
Event.Remarks: It's worth noting that the information in tAddonInfo may not reflect the addon that actually caused the error. If the source of the error is an addon that is hooking into a function in another addon, tAddonInfo will contain information on the addon that was hooked into, not the addon that was the source of the error.

Param.Name: tAddonInfo
Param.Desc: Information on the addon that threw the error.

Item.Name: eStatus
Item.Desc: The addon's current status.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the addon where the error was thrown.

Item.Name: bCarbine
Item.Desc: Whether the addon that threw the error is a Carbine addon or a 3rd party addon.

Item.Name: strAuthor
Item.Desc: The addon's author.

Item.Name: arErrors
Item.Desc: An array of strings that contain the error messages.

Param.Name: strError
Param.Desc: The error messages for the Lua error.

Param.Name: bCanIgnore
Param.Desc: Whether the player can ignore the error or not.

Event.Name: ModuleLoaded
Event.Desc: Fires when every addon has finished loading.

Event.Name: ModuleRestore
Event.InternalNotes: This does not seem to be fired anywhere in code.

Event.Name: SaveModules
Event.Desc: Fires immediately before any addon calls its OnSave() function.

Function.Name: StartTimer
Function.Desc: Starts a timer that is not currently running.
Function.Remarks: Timers created by Apollo are being replaced by ApolloTimer objects in the default UI. That does not mean that this functionality is being depricated.

Param.Name: strTimerName
Param.Desc: The name of the timer that the function should start.

Function.Name: StopTimer
Function.Desc: Stops a timer that is currently running.

Param.Name: strTimerName
Param.Desc: The name of the timer that the function should stop.

Function.Name: RegisterSlashCommand
Function.Desc: Registers a slash command with Apollo and sets up a function to handle the event fired when the command is used.

Param.Name: strCommand
Param.Desc: The slash command that will get registered with Apollo. This string should contain everything that comes after the / in the command.

Param.Name: strFunction
Param.Desc: The function that will handle the event that gets fired when the slash command is used.

Param.Name: tAddonHandler
Param.Desc: The instance of the addon that will handle the event fired by the slash command. This is usually the addon's "self".

Function.Name: RegisterEventHandler
Function.Desc: Matches an event that is fired with the Lua function that will handle the event.

Param.Name: strEventName
Param.Desc: The name of the event to be handled.

Param.Name: strFunctionName
Param.Desc: The name of the function that will be called when the event is fired.

Param.Name: tLuaEventHandler
Param.Desc: The addon's "self".

Function.Name: RegisterTimerHandler
Function.Desc: Pairs a timer with a function that will be called whenever the timer's interval expires.
Function.Remarks: The default UI will replace RegisterTimerHandler calls with ApolloTimers in the near future, but this method of using timers will not be depricated.

Param.Name: strTimerName
Param.Desc: The name of the timer that the function will pair with the handler function.

Param.Name: strFunction
Param.Desc: The function that will be called whenever the timer's interval expires.

Param.Name: tAddon
Param.Desc: The instance of the addon that will handle the event fired when the timer's interval expires. This is usually the addon's "self".

Function.Name: CreateTimer
Function.Desc: Creates a timer that can be run from Lua.
Function.Remarks:
Newly created timers are in the Running state and must be manually stopped. Timers created this way have no functionality without a timer handler that listens for when the timer fires. These timers are not destroyed when they fire.
While Apollo's timer functionality still works, we are moving more towards using ApolloTimers. That doesn't mean that this functionality is or will become depricated any time soon (we'll let you know when it does), but you will see far fewer instances of us using them in code.
Function.Example:
function TimerExample:OnLoad() Apollo.RegisterTimerHandler("TestTimer", "OnTestTimer", self) Apollo.CreateTimer("TestTimer", 1.0, false) end
function TimerExample:OnTestTimer() Print("Timer has fired") end

Param.Name: strTimerName
Param.Desc: The name of the timer.

Param.Name: nInterval
Param.Desc: How often the timer will fire.

Param.Name: bContinuous
Param.Desc: Whether the timer will constantly run or only fire once before needing to be restarted.

Function.Name: ParseInput
Function.Desc: Parses the input for slash commands. If the first character is not a "/", it will not recognize the text as a slash command and will print it to the Say chat channel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Returns the string for Console_CommandNotFound if the slash command that was passed in was invalid. Otherwise, this returns an empty string.

Param.Name: strInput
Param.Desc: The string that the function will parse.

Function.Name: LoadSprites
Function.Desc: Loads a sprite set.
Function.InternalNotes: Really need to figure out what exactly this does.

Param.Name: strFile
Param.Desc: The name of the form that contains the sprites, or the XmlDoc that contains them.

Param.Name: strDoc
Param.Desc: The name of the spriteDoc. This variable is optional.

Function.Name: LoadAnimations
Function.Desc: Attempts to load a specific animation file.
Function.InternalNotes: Does this still have a use?

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the animation was successfully loaded or not.

Param.Name: strFileName
Param.Desc: The file name of the animation that the function will try to load.

Function.Name: LoadGlobalAnchors
Function.InternalNotes: Unused, so unsure of how/when we'd need this.
Function.Desc: Loads the global anchors for the specified file.

Function.Name: BeginDragDrop
Function.Desc: Starts a drag-drop operation on the item that the player clicked on.

Param.Name: wndSource
Param.Desc: The window where the operation began.

Param.Name: strType
Param.Desc: The type of object that is being dragged in the operation. This can be either "DDBagItem" or "DDSpellbookItem".

Param.Name: strSprite
Param.Desc: The file name of the sprite that replaces the cursor during the operation.

Param.Name: nStartLocation
Param.Desc: The location where the drag-drop operation started.

Function.Name: BeginClickStick
Function.Desc: Causes the item or spell that the player clicked on to stick to the cursor until the player clicks again. It is treated like drag-drop functionality, only the player does not have to hold a button until the end of the operation.

Param.Name: wndSource
Param.Desc: The window where the click-stick operation began.

Param.Name: strType
Param.Desc: The type of item that the click stick is affecting. This value can be either "DDBagItem" or "DDSpellbookItem".

Param.Name: strSprite
Param.Desc: The file name of the sprite that replaces the cursor while the click-stick operation is active.

Param.Name: nStartLocation
Param.Desc: The location where the operation began.

Function.Name: DPF
Function.Desc: Sends the string that is passed in to the client logs.

Param.Name: strDebugMessage

Item.Name: name

Item.Name: size

Param.Name: oValue

Param.Desc: The new value of the console variable. The type of variable used must match the type needed by the Console Variable.

Param.Name: strVarName
Param.Desc: The name of the console variable whose value is requested.

ReturnValue.Desc: This value can be of any basic type (integer, float, boolean, string, nil), depending on which console variable is requested.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the Shift key is down or not.

Function.Name: IsControlKeyDown

Function.Name: GetTickCount

Function.Name: RegisterAddon
Function.Desc: Registers an addon to be loaded by Apollo. Addons that are not registered do not work.

Param.Name: tAddon
Param.Desc: The instance of the addon that is registering with Apollo. This is represented by "self".

Param.Name: bHasConfigureFunction
Param.Desc: Whether addon has a Configure button in the Esc menu. If this value is true, then the addon needs an OnConfigure() function to handle the button signal event.

Param.Name: arDependencies
Param.Desc: An array of addon names that must be loaded before this addon can be successfully loaded.

Param.Name: nLuaEventHandler
Param.Type: LuaTable but the Id is immediately converted to an Integer

Function.Name: SuspendAddon
Function.Desc: Turns off an addon that is throwing errors until the UI is reloaded.
Function.Remarks: If the addon that the function tries to suspend has no errors, it will not be suspended.

Param.Name: strAddonName
Param.Desc: The name of the addon that the function will try to suspend.

Function.Name: LinkAddon
Function.Desc: Associates a module with a parent module in Apollo. This allows Apollo to manage the addon's memory better.
Function.Example:
local kOffsetEnum = { Left = 1, Top = 2, Right = 3, Bottom = 4, }
function ContainerManager:OnDocumentReady() if self.xmlDoc == nil then return end
self.luaLeftContainer = Container:new() self.luaRightContainer = Container:new() self.luaLeftContainer:Init(self) self.luaRightContainer:Init(self)
self.luaLeftContainer:Move(-100, 0) self.luaRightContainer:Move(100, 0) end
function Container:new(o) o = o or {} setmetatable(o, self) self.__index = self return o end
function Container:Init(luaManager) Apollo.LinkAddon(luaManager, self)
self.luaContainerManager = luaManager self.wndMain = Apollo.LoadForm(self.luaManager.xmlDoc, "ContainerWindow", nil, self) end
function Container:Move(nDeltaX, nDeltaY) local tOffsets = {self.wndMain:GetAnchorOffsets()}
tOffsets[kOffsetEnum.Left] = tOffsets[kOffsetEnum.Left] + nDeltaX tOffsets[kOffsetEnum.Right] = tOffsets[kOffsetEnum.Right] + nDeltaX
tOffsets[kOffsetEnum.Top] = tOffsets[kOffsetEnum.Top] + nDeltaY tOffsets[kOffsetEnum.Bottom] = tOffsets[kOffsetEnum.Bottom] + nDeltaY
self.wndMain:SetAnchorOffsets(unpack(tOffsets)) end

Param.Name: tTarget
Param.Desc: The "self" of the module that the function will link to.

Param.Name: tSource
Param.Desc: The "self" of the module that is calling the function.

Function.Name: GetAddon
Function.Desc: Gets all of the functions and variables from the instance of the specified addon that is currently running.

Param.Name: strAddonName
Param.Desc: The name of the addon that the function will try to find.

ReturnValue.Desc: All of the addon level variables contained in the addon, as well as a metatable with all of the addon's functions.

Function.Name: GetObjectSize
Function.Desc: Gets the memory size of an object.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The function will return the size of this variable. Any variable type can be passed in.

ReturnValue.Desc: The size of the variable, in bytes.

Function.Name: LoadForm
Function.Desc: Loads a window from the specified form file
Function.Example: self.wndMain = Apollo.LoadForm("SampleAddon.xml", "SampleAddonForm", nil, self)

Param.Name: strFile
Param.Desc: The path to the XML document that contains the window, or the pre-loaded XML form.

Param.Name: strFormName
Param.Desc: The name of the window form that the function will try to load.

Param.Name: wndParent
Param.Desc: The newly loaded window will be a child of this window.

Function.Name: GetMouseTargetWindow
Function.Desc: Gets the window that the mouse is currently hovering over.

ReturnValue.Desc: The top-most window that the mouse is hovering over.

Function.Name: GetMouse
Function.Desc: Gets the mouse's position in screen coordinates.

ReturnValue.Desc: The mouse's current coordinates in screen space.

Function.Name: GetDisplaySize
Function.Desc: Gets the size of the client, as well as the size of the viewable portion of the client window.
Function.Remarks: In fullscreen mode, the width/height and raw width/height do not match up exactly, but the difference is relatively insignificant. In windowed mode, this is much more pronounced.

ReturnValue.Desc: The width and height of the window and the viewable portion of the window, as well as the scale that everything is drawn to.

Item.Name: nWidth
Item.Desc: The window's width.

Item.Name: nHeight
Item.Desc: The window's height.

Item.Name: nRawWidth
Item.Desc: The width of the portion of the window where the game is actually shown.

Item.Name: nRawHeight
Item.Desc: The height of the portion of the window where the game is actually shown.

Item.Name: fScale
Item.Desc: Objects in the game are scaled by this amount before being drawn.

Function.Name: DisableAddon
Function.Desc: Disables the specified addon if it has any errors. Disabled addons do not load after the UI is reloaded.

Param.Name: strAddonName
Param.Desc: The name of the addon that should be disabled.

Function.Name: UnlinkAddon
Function.Desc: Frees up the memory used by a linked addon.

Param.Name: tTarget
Param.Desc: The addon that the module was linked to.

Param.Name: tSource
Param.Desc: The instance of the module that is being unlinked. This is usually the module's "self".

Function.Name: GetTextWidth
Function.Desc: Gets the number of pixels it takes to draw a specific piece of text with a specific font.

Param.Name: strFontName
Param.Desc: The name of the font that to use in the width check.

Param.Name: strInput
Param.Desc: The text that the function is checking.

ReturnValue.Desc: The width, in pixels, that it takes to draw the text with the given font.

Function.Name: IsCapsLockOn
Function.Desc: Gets the state of the Caps Lock button.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether Caps Lock is on or not.

Function.Name: GetAddonInfo
Function.Desc: Gets a lot of performance information and a list of errors for the specified addon.

Param.Name: strAddonName
Param.Desc: The name of the addon.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains a large amount of information on the addon.

Item.Name: strFolder
Item.Desc: The name of the folder where the addon is found.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The addon's name.

Item.Name: strConfigureButtonText
Item.Desc: The text that is shown on the addon's configure button.

Item.Name: bCarbine
Item.Desc: Whether the addon is an official Carbine addon or not.

Item.Name: strAuthor
Item.Desc: The name of the addon's author.

Item.Name: bLoadOnStart
Item.Desc: Whether the addon is automatically loaded when the player logs in or the UI is reloaded.

Item.Name: nMemoryUsage
Item.Desc: How much memory the addon takes up.

Item.Name: nTotalCalls
Item.Desc: The number of API function calls the addon has made since it was started.

Item.Name: fTotalTime
Item.Desc: The total amount of processing time the addon has used since it was started, in milliseconds.

Item.Name: fLongestCall
Item.Desc: The longest it took to complete any one function call in the addon since the addon started.

Item.Name: fCallTimePerSecond
Item.Desc: The amount of processing time the addon is currently taking every second.

Item.Name: fCallTimePerFrame
Item.Desc: The amount of processing time the addon is currently taking every frame.

Item.Name: bRunning
Item.Desc: Whether the addon is currently running or not.

Item.Name: eStatus
Item.Desc: The addon's current status.

Item.Name: fLastModified
Item.Desc: The number of seconds since the addon was last modified.

Item.Name: bIgnoreVersion
Item.Desc: Whether the addon should ignore API version mismatches for loading purposes.

Item.Name: nAPIVersion
Item.Desc: The API version that the addon uses.

Item.Name: bHasConfigure
Item.Desc: Whether the addon has a configure menu that was set up when the addon was registered.

Item.Name: arErrors
Item.Desc: An array of error messages that were caused by the addon.

Item.Name: strLastModified
Item.Desc: The date and time that the addon was last modified.

Item.Name: strLastModifiedSort
Item.Desc: The string used when sorting the addons by the date they were last modified. The string lists the year, month, day, and time.

Item.Name: arReplacedAddons
Item.Desc: The name of each addon that this addon replaces.

Param.Desc: If this is true, then the tooltip will be drawn to the right of the anchor point. If it is false, it will be drawn to the left.

ReturnValue.Desc: A bit flag of the Meta Keys that are currently pressed down. The value lines up with the GameLib.CodeEnumInputModifier enum.

Function.Name: AddAddonErrorText
Function.InternalNotes: We should take either a string or table and not give the users the choice.
Function.Desc: Adds a message to an addon's info.
Function.Example: The text that is added to the addon's error list can be found by calling Apollo.GetAddonInfo() on the item and accessing the arErrors element in the error that is returned.

Param.Desc: The addon that threw the error. This can either be an instance of the addon itself or the addon's name.

Param.Name: strAddToError

Function.Name: RegisterWindowSubclass

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the Subclass is registered or not.

EnumSet.Name: AddonLoadStatus

Function.Name: GetAPIVersion

Function.Name: GetPackage

Function.Name: RegisterPackage
Function.Desc: Registers a package with Apollo so it can be used by other addons.

Param.Name: strModule

Param.Name: arDependencies

Function.Name: FormatNumber
Function.Desc: Formats a number to include region-specific notations, such as commas/periods in integers with 4+ digits, and truncates the value to a specific number of decimal places.

Param.Name: oNumber
Param.Desc: The number that needs to be formatted. This can be either an integer or float.
