Param.Name: bCommas
Param.Desc: Determines whether or not commas should be shown in numbers with 4 or more digits

ReturnValue.Desc: The formatted number with all relevant punctuation

Function.Name: StringToLower
Function.InternalNotes: Need to find out what makes this different from string.lower()
Function.Desc: Changes all of the characters in a string to lower case.

Param.Name: strInput
Param.Desc: The string that will be changed to lower case.

ReturnValue.Desc: The updated string.

Function.Name: SetMoveMetaKey
Function.Desc: Changes the meta key used for sprinting.

Param.Name: eMetaKey
Param.Desc: The meta key that the sprint action should be bound to.

Function.Name: GetMoveMetaKey
Function.Desc: Gets the meta key that is bound to the Sprint action.

ReturnValue.Desc: The meta key that is bound to the Sprint action.

Function.Name: LoadTemplates
Function.InternalNotes: Not quite sure what's going on with this one...

Function.Name: GetObjectize
Function.Desc: (lives in LuaObjectizer of UiModule.cpp) Does a lua_pushnumber of pObject's size.

Library.Name: AbilityBook
Library.Desc: A library that contains a large number of functions that are centered around the Limited Action Set.

Function.Name: GetAbilitiesList
Function.Desc: Returns a table with information on each of the character's abilities.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of tables that contain information on each spell that the player has access to.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The id number of the base spell.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The spell's name.

Item.Name: nMaxTiers
Item.Desc: The maximum number of tiers that the spell has.

Item.Name: bIsActive
Item.Desc: Determines whether the ability is unlocked or not.

Item.Name: nCurrentTier
Item.Desc: The current tier set for the spell.

Item.Name: strAbilityDescription
Item.Desc: The description of the spell that is listed in the tooltip.

Item.Name: strAbilityPerTierPointDescription
Item.Desc: A listing of what is added to the spell after each tier upgrade. This does not include the Tier 4 and Tier 8 bonuses.

Item.Name: tTiers
Item.Desc: An array of tables that contain information for each tier of the spell. The contents of this table differ depending on whether the spell is a combat or non-combat spell, or if the spell summons a mount.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the spell.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The id number of the base spell.

Item.Name: nTier
Item.Desc: The tier that is listed in this table.

Item.Name: nTrainingCost
Item.Desc: The number of credits required to unlock the base spell.

Item.Name: nTierPointCost
Item.Desc: The number of Ability Points required to upgrade to this tier.

Item.Name: bCanPurchase
Item.Desc: Whether or not the player meets the requirements to unlock the spell.

Item.Name: bAmpUnlocked
Item.Desc: Whether the spell requires an AMP to be active before it can be unlocked. This variable is only used for Combat spells.

Item.Name: nLevelReq
Item.Desc: The level required to unlock this spell's tier.

Item.Name: bIsActive
Item.Desc: Whether the player is using this tier of the spell.

Item.Name: strTierBonusDescription
Item.Desc: The tier bonus that the player gets at this tier.

Item.Name: splObject
Item.Desc: The spell for this tier.

Item.Name: nTierSpellId
Item.Desc: The id number for the spell at this tier. This variable is only used for non-combat spells.

Item.Name: nPreviewCreatureId
Item.Desc: The id number of the creature spawned when using this ability. This is primarily used for preview purposes and only exists for Mount type spells.

Item.Name: nPreviewHoverboardItemDisplay
Item.Desc: The id number of the hoverboard. This is primarily used for preview purposes and is only set if the spell is a mount.

Item.Name: bIsHoverboard
Item.Desc: Specifies whether the spell is for a hoverboard or another type of mount. This variable is only set if the spell summons a mount.

Param.Name: eSpellType
Param.Desc: A number representing the spell's type. Non-Combat abilities have either the Mount, Misc, or Path tags.

Function.Name: ActivateSpell
Function.Desc: Sets the spell's activated state. Spells are considered activated when they are able to be added to the player's limited action set.

Param.Name: bActive
Param.Desc: Whether the spell should be made active or inactive.

ReturnValue.Desc: Returns a boolean stating whether or not the spell was successfully activated.

Function.Name: GetAbilityInfo
Function.Desc: Gives the UI information on a specific spell.

Param.Name: idSpell
Param.Desc: The id number of the spell that is being queried.

Param.Name: eSpellType
Param.Desc: The type of spell being queried. This should match up with the type of spell that was used in the first argument.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains information on the spell

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The id number of the base level of the spell.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the spell.

Item.Name: nMaxTiers
Item.Desc: The maximum number of tiers allowed for the spell.

Item.Name: bIsActive
Item.Desc: Whether the spell has been purchased or not.

Item.Name: nCurrentTier
Item.Desc: The tier that the spell is currently set to.

Item.Name: strAbilityDescription
Item.Desc: The description of the ability, as shown in the tooltip.

Item.Name: strAbilityPerTierPointDescription
Item.Desc: The description of the spell.

Item.Name: tTiers
Item.Desc: Information on each tier of the spell.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the spell.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The id number of the base spell.

Item.Name: nTier
Item.Desc: The tier that is referenced in this table.

Item.Name: nTrainingCost
Item.Desc: The amount of currency needed to train this spell. This value is usually only set for the base level of the spell.

Item.Name: nTierPointCost
Item.Desc: The number of Ability Points that the player must use to unlock this tier.

Item.Name: bCanPurchase
Item.Desc: Determines whether the player meets the requirement to purchase this tier of the ability.

Item.Name: bAmpUnlocked
Item.Desc: Determines whether the spell is unlocked via an AMP or not.

Item.Name: nLevelReq
Item.Desc: The level the player must reach before using this tier of the spell.

Item.Name: bIsActive
Item.Desc: Whether the player is using this tier or not.

Item.Name: strTierBonusDescription
Item.Desc: The description of the spell at this tier.

Item.Name: splObject
Item.Desc: The spell at this tier.

Item.Name: nTierSpellId
Item.Desc: The id number of the spell. This only exists for non - combat spells.

Item.Name: nPreviewCreatureId
Item.Desc: The id number of the mount that can be previewed from this spell. This variable only exists if the spell type is Mount.

Item.Name: nPreviewHoverboardItemDisplay
Item.Desc: The id of the hoverboard that should be displayed in the mount preview. This value is only valid if the spell type was set to Mount and the mount happens to be a Hoverboard.

Item.Name: bIsHoverboard
Item.Desc: Determines whether the mount is a hoverboard or not. This is only set if the Mount tag was passed in.

Function.Name: UpdateSpellTier
Function.InternalNotes: Another one that returns false when it fails but nothing when it passes
Function.Desc: Sets the spell to the specified tier in the cached copy of the Action Set. This is not the saved copy, so any changes that are not saved are not permenantly set.

Param.Name: idBaseSpell
Param.Desc: The id number for the base spell.

Param.Name: nTier
Param.Desc: The tier that the spell is being set to.

Function.Name: ClearCachedLASUpdates
Function.Desc: Clears any unsaved changes to the player's limited action set.

Function.Name: IsLASChangeActive
Function.Desc: Checks to make sure that the Change Spec ability is active.

ReturnValue.Desc: Informs the UI whether the Limited Action Set can be chaged.

Function.Name: GetTagsForSpell
Function.Desc: Gets the category that the spell belongs to.

Param.Name: idSpell
Param.Desc: The id number for the spell that is being checked.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of strings that contain the names of the categories that the spell belongs to.

Function.Name: GetSpellTierLevelRequirements
Function.Desc: Gets the level requirememts for the player to learn each spell tier.

ReturnValue.Desc: The level the character has to be in order to unlock each tier of a spell. Index 1 is the base spell, while 2 is Tier 1, etc.

Function.Name: SetCurrentSpec
Function.InternalNotes: We're returning false again when we don't return anything if it's successful...
Function.Desc: Selects a specific Action Set for the player.

Param.Name: nSpecNumber
Param.Desc: The Action Set that the player will switch to.

Function.Name: NextSpec
Function.InternalNotes: This also has a case where it is returning false when it shouldnt.
Function.Desc: Cycles to the next Action Set available to the player. If the player is already at their latest action set, it cycles to the first Action Set.

Function.Name: PrevSpec
Function.Desc: Cycles back to an earlier Action Set. If the player is already at their first Action Set, it cycles to the last one.

Function.Name: GetTotalPower
Function.Desc: Gets the total amount of AMP points availalble to the player.

ReturnValue.Desc: The total number of AMP points the player has.

Function.Name: GetAvailablePower
Function.Desc: Gets the amount of AMP power the player has left. This value accounts for any changes that have not been saved.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of AMP points the player has not spent.

Function.Name: GetEldanAugmentationData
Function.InternalNotes: Why are we returning false in some cases?
Function.Desc: Gets information for each AMP for the player's class.

Param.Name: nSpecIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the Action Set that the function should return the AMP data for. If this value is not valid, the function will return False.

ReturnValue.Desc: The information for each category and each AMP.

Item.Name: tCategories
Item.Desc: The information for each category.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc:
The id number for the AMP category. The categories (in order) are:
Damage/Support Support Support/Utility Utility Damage/Utility Damage

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The localized name of the category.

Item.Name: fPowerInCategory
Item.Desc: The amount of AMP power the player has used on the category.

Item.Name: nHighestTierUnlocked
Item.Desc: The highest tier that the player can access in the category. This value ranges from 1-3.

Item.Name: nCategoriesToUnlock
Item.Desc: The number of categories that can help unlock this category.

Item.Name: tUnlockedCategories
Item.Desc: Information on the categories that help unlock this category. The number of entries should match nCategoriesToUnlock.

Item.Name: nUnlockCategoryId
Item.Desc: The id number of the category that helps unlock this one.

Item.Name: nTier2Amount
Item.Desc: The amount of power that is needed in this category for the category in the parent table to increase to tier 2.

Item.Name: nTier3Amount
Item.Desc: The amount of power that is needed in this category for the category in the parent table to increase to tier 3.

Item.Name: tAugments
Item.Desc: The information for each AMP.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The id number for the AMP.

Item.Name: eEldanAvailability
Item.Desc: The current state of the AMP.

Item.Name: nPowerCost
Item.Desc: The amount of AMP power required to activate the AMP.

Item.Name: nItemIdUnlock
Item.Desc: The item id for the for the item that unlocks the AMP.

Item.Name: bUnlocked
Item.Desc: Whether the item is unlocked or not.

Item.Name: nEldanAugmentationIdRequired
Item.Desc: The id number of the AMP the player has to activate before this one unlocks.

Item.Name: bRequiredOkay
Item.Desc: Whether the required AMPs have been activated or not.

Item.Name: nDisplayRow
Item.Desc: The row that the AMP is drawn on.

Item.Name: nDisplayColumn
Item.Desc: The column that the AMP is drawn on.

Item.Name: nCategoryId
Item.Desc: The id number of the category that the AMP belongs to.

Item.Name: nCategoryTier
Item.Desc: The tier that the AMP is in.

Item.Name: nSpellIdAugment
Item.Desc: The id number of the spell that unlocks when the AMP is learned.

Item.Name: strTitle
Item.Desc: The name of the AMP.

Item.Name: strDescription
Item.Desc: The description of what the AMP does.

Function.Name: CommitEldanAugmentationSpec
Function.Desc: Submits the currently selected AMPs so they are saved to the player's current spec.

Function.Name: ClearCachedEldanAugmentationSpec
Function.Desc: Removes any changes that were made to players AMPs but were not saved.

Function.Name: UpdateEldanAugmentationSpec
Function.Desc: Saves the AMPs in the Action Set that the player has been working in.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the operation was successful or not.

Param.Name: nSpecIdx
Param.Desc: The Action Set number that is being updated.

Param.Name: nActivatedAmps
Param.Desc: The number of activated AMPs in the Action Set.

Param.Name: tUnlockedAmps
Param.Desc: A table with a list of activated AMP ids, indexed by those ids.

Function.Name: ValidateEldanAugmentationSpec
Function.InternalNotes: Failed operations are often returning false instead of enum values
Function.Desc: Checks to make sure that the specified action set is valid and ready to be updated.

Param.Name: nSpecIdx
Param.Desc: The Action Set that the function is trying to save.

Param.Name: nUnlockedAmps
Param.Desc: The number of AMPS that the player has activated.

Param.Name: tUnlockedAMPIds
Param.Desc: A table that contains the id numbers of every AMP that the player has activated.

ReturnValue.Desc: The result of the operation

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumSpecConstant
EnumSet.Desc: This is a single value representing the maximum number of specs the player can have.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumSpecError
EnumSet.Desc: Error messages that the player can receive when attempting to save their spec. Ok is the success case.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumEldanAvailability
EnumSet.Desc:
This enum rempresents the AMP's current state.
Unavailable - The player has not unlocked the AMP Inaccessible - The player has not unlocked that AMP's tier Inactivated - The player has not spent points to activate this AMP Activated - The player has spent points to activate this AMP

Function.Name: GetCurrentSpec
Function.Desc: Gets the number of the Action Set that the player is currently using.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of the Action Set that the player is currently using.

Function.Name: GetNumUnlockedSpecs
Function.Desc: Gets the number of Action Sets the current player has unlocked.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of Action Sets the player has unlocked.

Function.Name: RespecEldanAugmentations
Function.Desc: Attempts to reset the player's AMPs for their current spec.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the reset was successful or not.

Function.Name: GetEldanAugmentationRespecCost
Function.Desc: Gets the cost to respec the character's AMPs, in copper.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of credits required to reset the character's AMPs, in copper.

Function.Name: GetAvailableLockedInPower
Function.Desc: Gets the amount of unused AMP power the player has left in their current saved spec. This value does not account for any changes that the player has made that have not been saved.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of unused AMP power in the current spec.

Function.Name: GetEldanAugmentationResetData
Function.InternalNotes: This is also returning false. Unsure how we get this to return anything but false and 0.

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of results possible when the player resets their AMPs.

Item.Name: nSpecIndex
Item.Desc: The spec that was affected most.

Item.Name: eLimitedActionSetReslut
Item.Desc: The result that the SpecIndex is tied to.

Function.Name: CanTrainTier
Function.Desc: Returns a bool that indicates if training is possible

Function.Name: TrainTier
Function.Desc: Attempts to train the next tier of the ability with the corresponding ID

Function.Name: GetExplorerRelicList
Function.Desc: Creates an array of Spells obtained via Explorer Relics

Library.Name: AchievementsLib
Library.Desc: Contains a list of functions that are helpful for building and orgainzing the Achievements UI or anything that requires achievement information.

Function.Name: GetAchievementZones
Function.Desc: Returns a list of all of the zones used in any achievement.
Function.Remarks: There's really no way to map an achievement to the zone with this function at the moment. It still returns valid information, but it might not be very useful.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The zone's id number.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the zone.

Function.Name: GetAchievements
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all achievements or guild achievements.

Param.Name: bIsGuild
Param.Desc: Determines whether the function should return guild achievements or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array with every achievement of the specified type.

Function.Name: GetAchievementsForCategory
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all the achievements for the given category.
Function.Remarks: The function will only return achievements at the category level if bRecurse is not set to true.

Param.Name: idCategory
Param.Desc: The category of achievements that should be returned.

Param.Name: bRecurse
Param.Desc: Whether or not the function should recurse through the category's subcategories when searching.

Param.Name: bGetGuild
Param.Desc: Whether the function should return guild achievements or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array that contains all of the achievements for the given category (and subcategories if bRecurse was set to true)

Function.Name: GetTradeskillAchievements
Function.Desc: Gets all of the achievements for a specific tradeskill.

Param.Name: eTradeskill
Param.Desc: The function will return the achievements for this tradeskill.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array that contains all of the achievements for the specified tradeskill

Function.Name: GetAchievementCategoryTree
Function.Desc: Gets a tree structure for the different types of achievements for the UI. The heirarchy goes Categories > Groups > Subgroups.

Param.Name: bGetGuildAchievements
Param.Desc: Whether the function should return Guild Achievements or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table with information on the categories, groups, and subgroups of achievements.

Item.Name: nCategoryId
Item.Desc: The id number for the category.

Item.Name: strCategoryName
Item.Desc: The category's name.

Item.Name: tGroups
Item.Desc: A table with the groups found within this category.

Item.Name: nGroupId
Item.Desc: The id for the achievement group.

Item.Name: strGroupName
Item.Desc: The name for the achievement group.

Item.Name: tSubGroups
Item.Desc: A table with information on the sub groups within this group.

Item.Name: nSubGroupId
Item.Desc: The id number for the sub group of achievements.

Item.Name: strSubGroupName
Item.Desc: The name of the sub group of achievements.

Function.Name: GetTradeskillAchievementCategoryTree
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all of the categories and subcategories for a tradeskill's tech tree.
Function.Remarks: The Group returned in this function is always the tradeskill itself, with its subgroups being the different ranks of that tradeskill.

Param.Name: eTradeskill
Param.Desc: The function will return the tech tree for this tradeskill.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table containing the name of the tradeskill and its subcategories.

Item.Name: nGroupId
Item.Desc: The id number for the tradeskill.

Item.Name: strGroupName
Item.Desc: The tradeskill's name.

Item.Name: tSubGroups
Item.Desc: An array of the different ranks for the tradeskill.

Item.Name: nSubGroupId
Item.Desc: The id number for the rank of the tradeskill.

Item.Name: strSubGroupName
Item.Desc: The name of this rank of the tradeskill.

Function.Name: GetTradeskillAchievementLayout
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all of the achievements for a specific tradeskill rank.
Function.Remarks: Once this list is populated, call Achievement:GetTradeskillLayout() to get the achievement's position in the tech tree.

Param.Name: nSubcategoryId
Param.Desc: The id number for the tradeskill's rank.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of the achievements for the specified tradeskill rank.

Function.Name: GetAchievementPoints
Function.Desc: Returns the number of achievement points that the player has earned from completed achievements.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of points the player has earned.

Function.Name: GetRecentCompletedAchievements
Function.Desc: Gets the latest achievements that the player has earned.

Param.Name: nMaxCount
Param.Desc: The maximum number of values you want the achievement to return.

Param.Name: bGetGuild
Param.Desc: Whether the function should return guild achievements or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of the most recent achievements the player has earned, in order of most recent to least.

Function.Name: GetGuildAchievementPoints
Function.Desc: Returns the number of Guild Achivement Points the player's current guild has earned.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of Guild Achievement Points that the guild has earned.

Function.Name: GetAchievementData
Function.Desc: Does a lua_newtable describing many (10+) fields relating to an achievement specified by nAchievementId.

Function.Name: GetAchievementCategories
Function.Desc: Does a lua_newtable with an index, id, and nameString of achievement categories.

Library.Name: ChallengesLib
Library.Desc: A library that allows the UI to interact with the challenge system.

Event.Name: ChallengeActivate
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a challenge is activated

Param.Name: clgActivated
Param.Desc: The challenge that was activated.

Event.Name: ChallengeUnlocked
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a new challenge is unlocked.

Param.Name: clgUnlocked
Param.Desc: The challenge that was unlocked.

Event.Name: ChallengeCompleted
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player completes a challenge.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number of the challenge.

Param.Name: strHeaderText
Param.Desc: The channel's name.

Param.Name: strDescription
Param.Desc: The challenge's description text.

Param.Name: nDuration
Param.Desc: The amount of time (in milliseconds) that the Challenge Complete window will appear on the screen.

Event.Name: ChallengeAbandon
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player abandons a challenge, clears their challenge data, or reqests that the challenge is abandoned via the ChallengesLib.ShowAbandonChallenge() function

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number of the challenge that was abandoned.

Param.Name: strDescription
Param.Desc: The challenge's fail message.

Event.Name: ChallengeTypeAlreadyActive
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player activates a challenge when they already have an active challenge of the same type.
Event.Remarks: Only one challenge of each type can be active at any given time. If another is activated, the previous one is abandoned.

Param.Name: idActivating
Param.Desc: The id of the challenge that was activated.

Param.Name: idAbandoned
Param.Desc: The id of the challenge that was abandoned.

Event.Name: ChallengeLeftArea
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player leaves the challenge area.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number for the challenge that fired the event.

Param.Name: strHeader
Param.Desc: The header that should be shown on the challenge tracker after this event is fired.

Param.Name: strDescription
Param.Desc: The message that should be shown to the player after the event is fired.

Event.Name: ChallengeFlashStartLocation
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the player leaves the challenge area and the challenge has a valid start location. It tells the UI that it should attempt to lead the player back to the start location.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number for the challenge that fired the event.

Param.Name: strDescription
Param.Desc: The message that should be communicated to the player when the UI receives this message.

Param.Name: fDuration
Param.Desc: How long the start location should flash, in seconds.

Param.Name: tLocation
Param.Desc: The coordinates that the player should be directed towards.

Function.Name: GetActiveChallengeList
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all of the challenges that the player has unlocked.
Function.InternalNotes: This is either poorly named or not providing the advertised functionality.

ReturnValue.Desc: A map of all of the player's unlocked challenges, indexed by Id.

Function.Name: ActivateChallenge
Function.Desc: Activates the challenge with the specified id.
Function.Example: If the challenge was unlocked, not activated, and not on cooldown, the server will respond with the ChallengeActivate event.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number of the challenge that the player wants to activate.

Function.Name: ShowAbandonChallenge
Function.Desc: Fires the ChallengeAbandoned event with a confirmation message.
Function.InternalNotes: The event that is fired seems odd considering that it does not actually abandon the challenge.
Function.Example: It is worth noting that this function does NOT abandon the challenge. The name of the event may give that impression, but it does not actually abandon it.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number of the challenge that the player is trying to abandon.

Function.Name: AbandonChallenge
Function.Desc: Abandons the challenge with the specified id.
Function.Example: If the challenge was active, the server will respond with the ChallengeAbandon event.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number of the challenge that will be abandoned.

Function.Name: ProcessRewards
Function.Desc: Tells the server to choose the reward that the player will receive from the challenge.
Function.Example: If this is called on a challenge that is not active, not on cooldown, and the player has received the challenge's reward list, then the server should fire the ChallengeRewardReady event once it has determined the reward the player will receive.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The server will attempt to choose the reward for the challenge with this id number.

Param.Name: nRewardIdx
Param.Desc: The reward number that the player selected to receive the bonus multiplier.

Function.Name: GetTimeRemaining
Function.Desc: Gets the amount of time left for a specific timer used by the specified challenge.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The function will get the remaining time for the challenge with this id number.

Param.Name: eTimerFlags
Param.Desc: The type of timer that the function is searching for. The different types of timers are found in the ChallengesLib.ChallengeTimerFlags set of contstants.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of time left for the challenge's timer, in string form.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The function will return the reward list for this challenge.

ReturnValue.Desc: A mostly-array that contains information on the different rewards that the quest can grant. It is not a true array since strChallengeName is an index in the top level table, and not in any of the sub tables in the array.

Item.Name: strChallengeName
Item.Desc: The name of the challenge. This variable is an index of the array and not part of the individual tables in the array.

Item.Name: nChallengeTier
Item.Desc: The challenge tier that the player has to achieve to select this reward.

Item.Name: idReward
Item.Desc: The reward's id number.

Item.Name: nAmount
Item.Desc: The number of the item that the player gets if the reward is chosen.

Item.Name: itemReward
Item.Desc: The item that the player receives if this reward is selected.

Item.Name: monReward
Item.Desc: The money that the player receives if this reward is selected.

Item.Name: splReward
Item.Desc: The spell that is cast on the player if this reward is selected.

Item.Name: splAdvSpell
Item.Desc: The spell that is granted if this reward is selected. This type of spell is only granted during adventures.

Item.Name: nXP
Item.Desc: The amount of XP that the player earns if this reward is selected. This type of reward should only appear in adventures.

Item.Name: nRepId
Item.Desc: The id number for the faction that the player gains reputation with if this reward is selected. This reward type should only appear in adventures.

Item.Name: nRepAmount
Item.Desc: The amount of reputation that the player gains if this reward is selected. This reward type should only appear in adventures.

Function.Name: AcceptRewards
Function.Desc: Attempts to collect a reward from a challenge.
Function.Example: This should only be called after the ChallengeRewardReady event has been fired for the challenge.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The function will attempt to grant the player the reward from the challenge with this id.

Function.Name: GenerateRewardList
Function.Desc: Requests the challenge reward list for the specified quest from the server.
Function.Example: If the challenge has a reward that the player did not collect (Challenge:ShouldCollectReward() == true), the server will respond with the ChallengeRewardListReady event.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The function will request the challenge reward list for the challenge with this id number.

Function.Name: ShowHintArrow
Function.Desc: Shows the hint arrow that points to the area where the specified challenge takes place.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number of the challenge that should show its hint arrow.

Function.Name: GetLootBonusMultiplier
Function.Desc: Gets the bonus multiplier that a player can attach to a specific reward for a particular challenge tier.

Param.Name: nTier
Param.Desc: The function will return the multiplier for this reward tier.

ReturnValue.Desc: The multiplier that is granted to whatever reward the player selects in the challenge reward list.

Function.Name: GetTierName
Function.Desc: Gets the name for the specified challenge tier.

Param.Name: nTier
Param.Desc: The function will get the name of this tier.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the challenge tier. If the tier number that was passed in was invalid, this will be an empty string.

Function.Name: AcceptSharedChallenge
Function.Desc: Accepts a challenge that another player has shared with the player.
Function.Remarks: Challenge sharing is not currently implemented, so this is currently depricated.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number for the challenge that was shared with the player.

Function.Name: RejectSharedChallenge
Function.Desc: Declines a shared challenge.

Param.Name: idChallenge
Param.Desc: The id number for the challenge that the function will reject.

Function.Name: GetRewardData
Function.Desc: Does a lua_newtable describing many (10+) fields relating to a reward specified by nChallengeId.

Function.Name: GetTimeRemainingForScreen
Function.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of the time remaining for screen specified by nChallengeId.

Function.Name: JoinChannel
Function.Desc: Attempts to join the specified channel.
Function.InternalNotes: Need to figure out what nOrder is for.
Function.Example: If the player is attempting to join a non-custom channel, then eChannel is the only parameter that should be sent. Otherwise, everything except eChannel should be used.

Param.Name: eChannel
Param.Desc: The channel that the player wants to join. This value lines up with the ChatSystemLib.ChatChannel set of constants and is only used if the player is trying to join a channel that was set up by the game.

Param.Name: strChannelName
Param.Desc: The name of the custom channel that the player is trying to join.

Param.Name: strPassword
Param.Desc: The password that is required to join the chat channel.

Param.Name: nOrder
Param.Desc: Unsure what this variable is for...

Function.Name: GetChannels
Function.Desc: Gets a list of channels that the player is in.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of ChatChannels that the player is currently in.

Function.Name: PostOnChannel
Function.Desc: Posts a text message to a specific chat channel.

Param.Name: eChannelId
Param.Desc: The channel that the message will be posted to. This value lines up with the ChatSystemLib.ChatChannel set of constants.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: The message that will be sent via the channel.

Param.Name: strSenderName
Param.Desc: The name of the player or NPC that the channel will say that the message came from.

Param.Name: unitSource
Param.Desc: The unit that the message came from.

Param.Name: bBubble
Param.Desc: Whether the unit should show a speech bubble or not.

Function.Name: SplitInput
Function.Desc: Checks a string for a slash command and divides it into the command and its arguments.

Param.Name: strInput
Param.Desc: The string that the function will split.

Item.Name: chatCommand
Item.Desc: The channel that the command was sent over.

Item.Name: bValidCommand
Item.Desc: Whether the command is recognized by the game or not.

Item.Name: strCommand
Item.Desc: The slash command portion of the string.

Item.Name: strMessage
Item.Desc: The arguments that were sent along with the slash command.

Function.Name: Command
Function.Desc: Processes the slash command that is sent through the function.
Function.Remarks: This function will process both commands that are built into the game and commands that are registered using Apollo.RegisterSlashCommand.

Param.Name: strCommand
Param.Desc: The command that the chat system will process, along with any parameters required by the command.

Function.Name: GetEmotes
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all of the emote commands available to the player.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of emote commands that the player can use.

Function.Name: GetCommands
Function.Desc: Gets a list of commands that are available to the player.
Function.Remarks: The command list contains both game commands and any command registered via Apollo.RegisterSlashCommand

ReturnValue.Desc: An array that contains the names of all of the commands that are available to the player.

Function.Name: PrepareInfractionReport
Function.Desc: Creates an IncidentReport based on a specified chat line.

ReturnValue.Desc: An IncidentReport that is populated with information pulled from the specified chat line.

Function.Name: GetInputTypeForString
Function.Desc: Does a lua_newtable with eType, nChannel, strChatType, strCommand, strAbbrev, strArgs, bCommandSet.

Function.Name: LeaveChannel
Function.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Function.Name: CreateChannel
Function.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Function.Name: ShowTextFloater
Function.Desc: Displays a text floater coming from the specified unit.
Function.InternalNotes: There's quite a few things in here that I'm kinda iffy about and would like to get clarification on.

Param.Name: unitSource
Param.Desc: The unit that the floater will be tied to.

Param.Name: nValue
Param.Desc: The value that should be shown on the floater.

Param.Name: strValue
Param.Desc: The text that should be shown on the floater.

Param.Name: tOptions
Param.Desc: A table that contains a laundry list of ways the text floater can be manipulated.

Item.Name: nColor
Item.Desc: A hex value that contains the RGB color values that the floater should use.

Item.Name: arFrames
Item.Desc: A list of each frame of an animation that the floater will do.

Item.Name: fTime
Item.Desc: The amount of time that the frame should last, in seconds.

Item.Name: fScale
Item.Desc: The amount that the floater's text will be scaled by for this frame.

Item.Name: nColor
Item.Desc: A hex value that contains the RGB values that the text will use this frame.

Item.Name: fAlpha
Item.Desc: The floater's alpha value this frame.

Item.Name: fRotation
Item.Desc: The amount that the floater is rotated this frame, in degrees.

Item.Name: fVelocityDirection
Item.Desc: The direction the text will move this frame, in degrees.

Item.Name: fVelocityDirectionRange
Item.Desc: The amount of variation allowed in the velocity's direction, in degrees.

Item.Name: fVelocityMagnitude
Item.Desc: The speed that the float text is moving at during this frame, in pixels.

Item.Name: fVelocityMagnitudeRange
Item.Desc: The amount of variation in the velocity's magnitude that can be used during this frame, in pixels.

Item.Name: fAccelerationDirection
Item.Desc: The direction that the float text will accelerate in during this frame, in degrees.

Item.Name: fAccelerationDirectionRange
Item.Desc: The amount of variation in the float text's acceleration direction, in degrees.

Item.Name: fAccelerationMagnitude
Item.Desc: The amount that the floater will accelerate by this frame, in pixels per second.

Item.Name: fAccelerationMagnitudeRange
Item.Desc: The variation in the acceleration's magnitude that is possible this frame, in pixels per second.

Item.Name: nDuration
Item.Desc: How long the floater should stay on screen, in seconds. This is only needed if arFrames was not used.

Item.Name: fDuration
Item.Desc: How long the floater should stay on screen, in seconds. This is only needed if arFrames was not used.

Item.Name: nFadeInDuration
Item.Desc: How long the floater should take to fade in, in seconds. This is only needed if arFrames was not used.

Item.Name: fFadeInDuration
Item.Desc: How long the floater should take to fade in, in seconds. This is only needed if arFrames was not used.

Item.Name: nFadeOutDuration
Item.Desc: How long the floater should take to fade out, in seconds. This is only needed if arFrames was not used.

Item.Name: fFadeOutDuration
Item.Desc: How long the floater should take to fade out, in seconds. This is only needed if arFrames was not used.

Item.Name: nEndHoldDuration
Item.Desc: How long the floater will hold its position before despawning, in seconds. This is only needed if arFrames was not used.

Item.Name: fEndHoldDuration
Item.Desc: How long the floater will hold its position before despawning, in seconds. This is only needed if arFrames was not used.

Item.Name: strFontFace
Item.Desc: The name of the font face that the floater should use.

Item.Name: fSpinAroundRadius
Item.Desc: How many degrees the text will spin every second.

Item.Name: fVibrate
Item.Desc: The range that the floater will vibrate between in the X and Y directions.

Item.Name: eCollisionMode
Item.Desc: The type of collision that the floater will use. This prevents collistion with other floaters.

Item.Name: fExpandCollisionBoxWidth
Item.Desc: The amount that is added to the floater's width when calculating collisions, in pixels.

Item.Name: fExpandCollisionBoxHeight
Item.Desc: The amount that is added to the floater's height when calculating collisions, in pixels.

Item.Name: eLocation
Item.Desc: The location on the unit that the floater will spawn from.

Item.Name: fOffsetDirection
Item.Desc: The direction that the floater will be offset from its spawn location, in degrees.

Item.Name: fOffset
Item.Desc: The amount that the floater will be offset from its spawn location, in pixels.

Item.Name: iUseDigitSpriteSet
Item.Desc: The id number of the sprite set of digits that the text floater should use.

Item.Name: nDigitSpriteSpacing
Item.Desc: The amount of space between each sprite from the sprite set.

Item.Name: iUseBGSprite
Item.Desc: The id of the BG Sprite that the float text should use.

Item.Name: nBGSpriteMargin
Item.Desc: The margin between the edges of the floater and the BG Sprite, in pixels.

Item.Name: nBGSpriteColor
Item.Desc: A hex value that contains the RGB values that will be applied to the BGSprite.

Item.Name: fBGSpriteAlpha
Item.Desc: The alpha that is applied to the floater's BGSprite.

Item.Name: bUseScreenPos
Item.Desc: Whether the floater should use screen position instead of a location on a unit to determine its position.

Item.Name: bShowOnTop
Item.Desc: Whether the floater will draw over the top of other combat floaters and windows.

Item.Name: nDelay
Item.Desc: The delay between the floater's start time and when it actually spawns.

Item.Name: bReposition
Item.Desc: Whether the floater can be moved or not.

Function.Name: HideTextFloater
Function.Desc: Hides the CombatFloater from the screen.

Param.Name: pTextFloater
Param.Desc: converted to a CTextFloater

Function.Name: ShowParticleEffect
Function.InternalNotes: Either this does not work or I'm doing it wrong. I'm leaning towards doing it wrong.
Function.Desc: Displays a particle effect.

Param.Name: unitSource
Param.Desc: The unit that the floater is attached to.

Param.Name: tSettings
Param.Desc: A table that contains the various options that should be set for the particle effect.

Item.Name: eEffect
Item.Desc: The type of particle effect that should be shown.

Item.Name: nDuration
Item.Desc: How long the particle effect should last for, in seconds.

Item.Name: fDuration
Item.Desc: How long the particle effect should last, in seconds.

Item.Name: eLocation
Item.Desc: The location on the unit that the effect should start from.

Function.Name: AddDigitSpriteSet
Function.Desc: Registers a sprite set that contains digits with the combat floater system.

Param.Name: strSpriteSetName
Param.Desc: The path and file name of the sprite set that was registered with the system.

ReturnValue.Desc: The index that is assigned to the sprite set that was added to the system.

Function.Name: AddTextBGSprite
Function.Desc: Registers a background sprite with the float text system.

Param.Name: strSpriteName
Param.Desc: The path and file name of the sprite that should be registered with the system.

ReturnValue.Desc: The index that was assigned to the sprite after it was registered.

Function.Name: TestTextFloater
Function.Desc: Passes the information given to the function back to the game in the form of a DamageOrHealingDone event.
Function.Remarks: This function is primarily used to test out new floaters.

Param.Name: eDamageType
Param.Desc: The type of damage that should be sent with the DamageOrHealingDone event.

Param.Name: nHealthChange
Param.Desc: The amount that the player's health changed by (according to the test floater).

Param.Name: nShieldAbsorbAmount
Param.Desc: The amount of damage that the unit's shield absorbed (according to the floater)

Param.Name: bCritical
Param.Desc: Whether the test floater should show a critical hit or not.

Function.Name: SetMaxFloaterCount
Function.Desc: Sets the maximum number of floaters that can be on the screen at any one time.

Param.Name: nMaxFloaterCount
Param.Desc: The new maximum number of floaters.

Function.Name: SetMaxFloaterPerUnitCount
Function.Desc: Sets the maximum number of floating text messages that will be shown for any single unit at the same time.

Param.Name: nNewMaxFloaterCount
Param.Desc: The new maximum number of floaters per unit.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumFloaterLocation
EnumSet.Desc: The location on a unit that the floating text would spawn from.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumFloaterCollisionMode
EnumSet.Desc: The collision modes that floating combat text can be set to.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumFloaterEffect
EnumSet.Desc: A list of particle effects that can be added to floating combat text

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumExpReason
EnumSet.Desc: The possible sources that a player can gain experience from.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumCombatMomentum
EnumSet.Desc: The different types of Combat Momentum bonuses that a player can earn.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumCCStateApplyRulesResult
EnumSet.Desc: The possible results when something attempts to apply a Crowd Control state to a unit.

Event.Name: DamageOrHealingDone
Event.Desc: Fires whenever damage or healing is done to a unit within the player's area of interest.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that used the ability that caused the damage or healing.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that received the damage or healing.

Param.Name: eDamageType
Param.Desc: The type of damage that was done to the target.

Param.Name: nHealthChange
Param.Desc: The amount that the target's health was changed by.

Param.Name: nShieldAbsorbAmount
Param.Desc: The amount of damage that was absorbed by the unit's shields.

Param.Name: nAbsorbedAmount
Param.Desc: The amount of damage that was absorbed by the unit's absorption shield.

Param.Name: bIsCritical
Param.Desc: Whether the damage or healing effect was a critical hit.

Param.Name: strSpellName
Param.Desc: The name of the ability that caused the damage or healing.

Library.Name: CommunicatorLib
Library.Desc: A library that provides addons a way to manipulate communicator messages sent by NPCs.

Event.Name: Communicator_ShowSpamMsg
Event.InternalNotes: Does not seem to be handled by the UI. Will it ever be fired?
Event.Desc: Fires if a communicator message is sent to the player but does not have a valid Quest tied to it.

Param.Name: idMsg
Param.Desc: The id number of the communicator message.

Param.Name: idCreature
Param.Desc: The id number of the creature that sent the message.

Param.Name: strText
Param.Desc: The text that should be shown in the message.

Param.Name: bPriorty
Param.Desc: Whether the message should have priority over other messages.

Param.Name: idMsg
Param.Desc: The id number for the message.

Param.Name: idCreature
Param.Desc: The id number for the NPC that sent the communicator message.

Param.Name: queShown
Param.Desc: The quest that the message will offer the player.

Param.Name: strText
Param.Desc: The quest text that the message will show.

Event.Name: Communicator_EndIncoming
Event.Desc: Fires when an incoming communicator times out and becomes a "missed call"

Event.Name: Communicator_UpdateCallback
Event.Desc: Fires whenever a communicator message gets updated in response to a player abandoning, botching, or completing a quest.

Param.Name: bHasCallback
Param.Desc: Whether the player gets an immediate communicator message or not.

Param.Name: bRedeemsQuest
Param.Desc: Whether the callback allows the player to turn in a quest or not.

Event.Name: Communicator_SpamVOEnded
Event.Desc: Fires when a communicator's voice over ends.
Event.InternalNotes: Like ShowSpamMsg, idk that this is actually used anymore.

Function.Name: GetMessageLayoutForQuest
Function.Desc: Gets information regarding the layout of the portrait portion of a communicator message that is tied to a quest.
Function.InternalNotes: Lots of constants being used here.

Item.Name: ePortraitPlacement
Item.Desc: The location on the window that the portrait is assigned to. This value lines up with the CommunicatorLib.CommunicatorPortraitPlacement set of constants.

Item.Name: eOverlay
Item.Desc: The static overlay that should be placed over the portrait. This lines up with the CommunicatorLib.CommunicatorOverlay set of constants.

Item.Name: eBackground
Item.Desc: The background that should be used with the portrait. This value lines up with the CommunicatorLib.CommunicatorBackground set of constants.

Param.Name: queSource
Param.Desc: The quest that the communicator message is tied to.

Function.Name: GetMessageLayoutForSpam
Function.Desc: Gets information regarding how the background on a spam message should be layed out.
Function.InternalNotes: Lots of constants to convert to enums.

Item.Name: fDuration
Item.Desc: How long the message will remain on the screen, in seconds.

Item.Name: ePortraitPlacement
Item.Desc: Where the character portrait should appear on the communicator window. This value corresponds with the CommunicatorLib.CommunicatorPortraitPlacement set of constants.

Item.Name: eOverlay
Item.Desc: Indicated which overlay should be drawn over the portrait. This value corresponds with the CommunicatorLib.CommunicatorOverlay set of constants.

Item.Name: eBackground
Item.Desc: Indicated which background should be used with the portrait. This value corresponds with the CommunicatorLib.CommunicatorBackground set of constants.

Param.Name: idMessage
Param.Desc: The id number for the spam message being queried.

Function.Name: PlaySpamVo

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether there was actually a voice over to play or not.

Object.Name: DialogResponse
Object.Desc: DialogResponses are the various options that the player can select when conversing with NPCs and turning in quests.

Method.Name: GetText
Method.Desc: Gets the text for this DialogResponse.

ReturnValue.Desc: The DialogResponse's text.

Method.Name: GetType
Method.Desc: Gets the DialogResponse's type.

ReturnValue.Desc: The response's type. This value corresponds with the DialogResponse.DialogResponseType enum.

Method.Name: GetUniqueId
Method.Desc: Gets the dialog's unique id number.

ReturnValue.Desc: The dialog's unique id number.

Method.Name: GetQuestId
Method.Desc: Gets the id of the quest associated with this dialog.

ReturnValue.Desc: The id number of the quest associated with this dialog response.

Method.Name: GetRewardId
Method.Desc: Gets the id of the reward associated with this dialog response.

ReturnValue.Desc: The id number of the reward associated with this response.

Method.Name: Select
Method.Desc: Tells the client that the player has chosen this DialogResponse

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Determines whether a variable is a DialogResponse or not.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The object that the function will check.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the object is a dialog response or not.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: Forces the garbage collector to be called on this variable.

Object.Name: Episode
Object.Desc: Episodes are a set of quests that are linked by a storyline or area.

Method.Name: GetId
Method.Desc: Gets the Episode's id.

ReturnValue.Desc: The Episode's id.

Method.Name: GetState
Method.Desc: Gets the Episode's current state.
Method.InternalNotes: Episode.EpisodeState constants should be enums

ReturnValue.Desc: The Episode's current state. This value corresponds with the Episode.EpisodeState set of constants.

Method.Name: GetTitle
Method.Desc: Gets the Episode's title.

ReturnValue.Desc: The Episode's title.

Method.Name: GetDesc
Method.Desc: Gets the description that should be shown for the Episode when it is incomplete.

ReturnValue.Desc: The string that should be used as the Episode's description while it is incomplete.

Method.Name: GetSummary
Method.Desc: Gets the description that should be shown for the Episode once it's complete.

ReturnValue.Desc: The string that should be shown for the Episode's description once it's in the Completed state.

Method.Name: GetConLevel
Method.Desc: Gets the level that the player is expected to be in order to complete the Episode.
Method.InternalNotes: This doesn't seem to be used anymore. Maybe it's depricated?

ReturnValue.Desc: The level that the player is expected to be to complete the Episode.

Method.Name: IsTaskOnly
Method.Desc: Determines if the Episode only has Tasks. Tasks are Quests that are not part of any larger chain.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the Episode's Quests are all Tasks or not.

Method.Name: GetZoneId
Method.Desc: Gets the id number of the zone that the Episode takes place in.

ReturnValue.Desc: The id number of the zone that the Episode is in.

Method.Name: GetZoneName
Method.Desc: Gets the name of the zone that the Episode is found in.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the zone that the episode is in.

Method.Name: GetVisibleQuests
Method.Desc: Gets a list of Quests that are part of the Episode and match the filters that are flagged with the variables that are passed in

Param.Name: bShowCompleted
Param.Desc: Whether completed quests should be added to the list or not.

Param.Name: bShowOutLeveled
Param.Desc: Whether Quests whose con level are 10 below the player's effective level should be added to the list or not.

Param.Name: bSortByName
Param.Desc: Whether the list should be sorted alphabetically by name or not.

Param.Name: idQuestCategory
Param.Desc: The Quests that are returned will be filtered by this QuestCategory id.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of Quests that has been filtered and possibly sorted by the variables that were passed into the function.

Method.Name: GetTrackedQuests
Method.Desc: Gets a list of tracked quests that have the specified QuestCategory and are part of the Episode.

Param.Name: idQuestCategory
Param.Desc: The id of the QuestCategory that the function will use to filter the results.

Param.Name: bSortByDistance
Param.Desc: Whether the function should sort the results by distance, with the closest quests coming first in the list.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of Quests that are part of the Episode and have a QuestCategory whose id matches the one passed in.

Method.Name: GetQuest
Method.Desc: Gets the Quest with the specified id if it is in this Episode.

Param.Name: idQuest
Param.Desc: The id of the Quest that the function will look for.

ReturnValue.Desc: The Quest whose id matches the one passed in.

Method.Name: GetProgress
Method.Desc: Gets information on the player's progress towards completing every quest of a specific category in this Episode.

Param.Name: idQuestCategory
Param.Desc: The function will get the Episode's progress for Quests whose category uses this id.

ReturnValue.Desc: A count of how many Quests the player has completed and how many the Episode has for the specified category.

Item.Name: nTotal
Item.Desc: The total number of Quests of the specified category that are in the Episode.

Item.Name: nCompleted
Item.Desc: The number of Quests of the specified category that the player has completed.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Checks whether the variable that is passed in is an Episode or not.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that the function will check. This variable can be of any type.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable that was passed in is an Episode or not.

Method.Name: GetCategories
Method.Desc: Gets a list of all of the QuestCategories that are used by quests in the Episode.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of QuestCategories that are used by quests in the Episode.

Method.Name: GetAllQuests
Method.Desc: Gets a list of all of the quests in the Episode that match the passed in category id and that have been unlocked by the player.

Param.Name: idQuestCategory
Param.Desc: The function will return all quests with this category.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of quests that have the same category as the one that was passed in and have been unlocked by the player.

Method.Name: IsWorldStory
Method.Desc: Determines if the Episode is a World Story or not. World Stories are quest chains that span multiple zones.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the Episode is a World Story or not.

Method.Name: IsZoneStory
Method.Desc: Determines if the Episode is a Zone Story or not. Zone Stories are Episodes that span an entire zone.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the Episode is a Zone Story or not.

Method.Name: IsRegionalStory
Method.Desc: Checks if the Episode is a Regional Story. Regional Stories are Episodes that take place in a specific region within a zone, but do not breadcrumb to other areas.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the Episode is a Regional Story or not.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: Manually calls the garbage collector on this Episode.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Determines if two Episodes are the same.

Param.Name: epiCompare
Param.Desc: The episode being compared to this Episode.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the two Episodes are the same or not.

Method.Name: GetEffectiveLevel
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushinteger of itemData's effective level, or niil if null.

Method.Name: GetBinding
Method.Desc: Does a localized lua_pushwstring of either Soulbound, Bind of Pickup, or Bind on Equip specified by itemData, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetGenericString
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of a formatted string (to '$1c $1n') with an actor corresponding to strName and fVal. uses as library

Method.Name: GetCompareString
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of a CompareString of strName, fBefore, and fAfter. uses as library

Method.Name: GetPropertiesSequential
Method.Desc: Does a lua_newtable with an index, id, and value of properties specified by itemData, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetPropertiesKeyed
Method.Desc: Does a lua_newtable with an index, id, and offset of properties specified by itemData, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetPropertyName
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of the localized property name specified by itemId, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetPropertyString
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of the localized property value specified by itemId, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetPropertyCompareString
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of the compare result of a property value specified by itemId, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetResistances
Method.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Method.Name: GetResistancesSequential
Method.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Method.Name: GetResistanceName
Method.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Method.Name: GetResistanceCategoryName
Method.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Method.Name: GetUniqueStatus
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of the localized Unique or Unique Equipped item status, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetQuestItem
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of 'Quest Item' if applicable to itemData, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetQuestDrop
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of 'Quest Drop' if applicable to itemData, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetConsumable
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of 'Consumable' if applicable to itemData, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetNoRequiredLevel
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of 'No required level' if applicable to itemData, or nil if null.

Method.Name: GetInnateHP
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushnumber of playerHealthBonus specified by itemData, or 0.0f if null.

Method.Name: GetSpecial
Method.Desc: Does a lua_newtable describing many (10+) fields relating to the item specified by itemData.

Method.Name: GetTrackerIndex
Method.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Method.Name: AcceptSubMission
Method.Desc: Runs AcceptMission with the quest id and pUnit's id.

Method.Name: IsSubMission
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushboolean of IsPathSubMission.

Method.Name: GetSubMissionType
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushinteger of PlayerPathTypeForceInt or SubMissionPathType if pLuaQuest is specified.

Method.Name: GetInstanceMaxCount
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushinteger of pSpell's maxSpellInstanceCount.

Function.Name: ShortcutCast
Function.Desc: Runs g_game's CastShortcutSpell with pSpell's id.

Object.Name: Unit
Object.Desc: Any character in game, including players, NPCs, Banks, summoned Pets and Mounts, Vendors, and Ability Vendors

Event.Name: UnitCreated
Event.Desc: An event that is fired whenever a unit is spawned or a player enters the world

Param.Name: unitSpawned
Param.Desc: The newly created unit

Event.Name: UnitDestroyed
Event.Desc: An event that gets fired whenever a unit is despawned or a player leaves the game world

Param.Name: unitDestroyed
Param.Desc: The unit that has left this world

Event.Name: UnitNameChanged
Event.Desc: An event that gets fired whenever the unit's name gets changed

Param.Name: unitChanged
Param.Desc: The unit whose name was changed

Param.Name: strNewName
Param.Desc: The unit's new name

Event.Name: UnitEnteredCombat
Event.Desc: An event that gets fired whenever a unit enters or leaves combat

Param.Name: unitInCombat
Param.Desc: The unit that just entered combat

Param.Name: bInCombat
Param.Desc: A boolean stating whether or not the unit has entered or left combat

Event.Name: UnitActivationTypeChanged
Event.Desc: An event that gets fired whenever the effect that happens when you interact with the object changes.
Event.Example: Examples of when this event is fired include: - When a friendly player dies and can be revived by right clicking the corpse - When an object becomes interactive due to a quest or some other prerequisite - When an NPC offers a quest when they did not have one previously.

Param.Name: unitChanged
Param.Desc: The unit who has a new activation type

Event.Name: UnitMiniMapMarkerChanged
Event.Desc: An event that is fired whenever a player whose location shows on the map/minimap moves

Param.Name: unitMoving
Param.Desc: The unit who has changed position

Event.Name: TargetUnitChanged
Event.Desc: An event that is fired whenever the player changes their target

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit's new target

Event.Name: InteractiveUnitChanged
Event.Desc: This event is fired when the player targets an interactive unit, such as vendors, quest givers, and quest objective NPCs/props.

Param.Name: unitNewTarget
Param.Desc: The interactive unit that the player is now targeting

Param.Name: strContext
Param.Desc: A brief description of how the player can interact with the unit

Event.Name: Mount
Event.Desc: An event that gets fired when the player mounts or dismounts

Param.Name: bMounted
Param.Desc: A boolean that states whether the player is mounting or dismounting

Event.Name: LootedItem
Event.Desc: This event is fired when the player loots an item that was dropped by an NPC

Param.Name: itemLoot
Param.Desc: The item that was looted

Param.Name: nCount
Param.Desc: The number of items in the stack that was looted

Event.Name: LootedMoney
Event.Desc: This event is fired when the player loots currency that was dropped by an NPC

Param.Name: monLoot
Param.Desc: The currency that the player looted

Event.Name: SpellCastFailed
Event.Desc: An event that fires whenever a spell is canceled by any means
Event.InternalNotes: Need to give Lua access to ECombatMessageType and ESpell4CastResul

Param.Name: eMessageType
Param.Desc: An enum representing how long it will be before the unit can cast again. This value is currently set to ECombatMessageType, which is not available to the Lua API at the moment.

Param.Name: eCastResult
Param.Desc: An enum representing why the cast failed. This value uses the ESpell4CastResult enum, which is not available to players at the moment.

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The target of the failed spell

Param.Name: unitSource
Param.Desc: The caster of the failed spell

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: A string describing why the spell failed

Param.Name: strSpellName
Param.Desc: The name of the spell that failed

Event.Name: DamageOrHealingDone
Event.Desc: An event that gets fired whenever a unit takes damage or gets healed.

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit who used the spell that caused the damage/healing

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that received the damage/healing

Param.Name: eDamageType
Param.Desc: The type of damage done to the unit. This enum corresponds with GameLib.CodeEnumDamageType

Param.Name: nHealth
Param.Desc: The amount of damage or healing done to the target's health

Param.Name: nShields
Param.Desc: The amount of damage or healing done to the target's shields

Param.Name: nAbsorb
Param.Desc: The amount of damage or healing done to the target's absorption

Param.Name: bIsCritical
Param.Desc: Whether or not the attack was a critical hit

Param.Name: splUsed
Param.Desc: The spell that did the damage / healing to the target

Event.Name: AttackMissed
Event.Desc: An event that is fired when a unit dodges an attack from another unit

Param.Name: unitCaster
Param.Desc: The unit that performed the attack

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that was the target of the attack

Param.Name: eMissType
Param.Desc: An enum that describes why the attack missed. Uses the GameLib.CodeEnumMissType enum list

Event.Name: ExperienceGained
Event.Desc: An event fired when a unit gains experience

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that gained the experience

Param.Name: strText
Param.Desc: A localized string containing the amount of XP gained and any relevant notes on why the unit gained the XP. Current modiefiers include "Bonus XP" for killing clusters of NPCs, "Explorer's XP" for discovering new areas for the first time, and Rested XP for XP gained while the user had the Rested bonus.

Param.Name: nDelay
Param.Desc: The delay before the unit gains XP from the event. This is usually set for some time during an NPC's death animation.

Method.Name: GetId
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's ID

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's ID

Method.Name: IsValid
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is valid. Invalid units do not exist in the world.

Method.Name: GetType
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's type
Method.Remarks: There are several possible values that can be returned here, such as "NonPlayer", "Chest", "Destructible", "Vehicle", "Door", "Harvest", "Corpse", "Mount", "Collectible", "Taxi", "Simple", "Platform", "Mailbox", "Turret", "InstancePortal", "Plug", "Residence", "StructuredPlug", "PinataLoot", "BindPoint", "Player", "HiddenSpell", "Trigger", "Ghost", "Pet", "Esper Pet", "World object", "Scanner", "Camera", "Trap", "DestructibleDoor", "Pickup", "SimpleCollidable", "HousingMannequin", and "Unknown"

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's type

Method.Name: GetRaceId
Method.Desc: Returns a number representing the unit's race
Method.InternalNotes: Why do we have a GetRaceID and GetUnitRaceId?

ReturnValue.Desc: A number representing the unit's race. This value corresponds with the GameLib.CodeEnumRace enum

Method.Name: GetClassId
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's class ID

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's class ID. This value corresponds with the GameLib.CodeEnumClass enum.

Method.Name: GetSpellMechanicId
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's spell mechanic ID number

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's spell mechanic ID number

Method.Name: GetHealth
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's current HP

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's current HP

Method.Name: GetMaxHealth
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's maximum health

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's maximum health

Method.Name: GetMana
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's current amount of mana

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's current amount of mana

Method.Name: GetMaxMana
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's maximum Focus

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's maximum Focus

Method.Name: GetShieldCapacity
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's current shield value

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's current shield value

Method.Name: GetShieldCapacityMax
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's maximum shield value

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's maximum shield value

Method.Name: GetResource
Method.Desc: Returns the amount of the specified resource that the unit has
Method.Remarks:
Resource0 = Endurance. Endurance is the resource used while sprinting.
Resource1 = Kinetic Energy (Warriors), Volatility (Engineers), Psi Points (Esper), Power Cores (Medic), and is not used for stalkers
Resource2 - 3 = Unused Resource4 = Suit Power (stalkers) Resource5-7 = Unused

Param.Name: nResource
Param.Desc: The Resource number that the player is polling

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of the given resource that the unit has

Method.Name: GetSpellMechanicPercentage
Method.Desc: Returns the percentage of the given resource the unit has.
Method.Remarks:
Resource0 = Endurance. Endurance is the resource used while sprinting.
Resource1 = Kinetic Energy (Warriors), Volatility (Engineers), Psi Points (Esper), Power Cores (Medic), and is not used for stalkers
Resource2 - 3 = Unused Resource4 = Suit Power (stalkers) Resource5-7 = Unused

Param.Name: nResource
Param.Desc: The resource that is being polled

ReturnValue.Desc: The percentage of the given resource the unit has

Method.Name: GetResourceIcon
Method.Desc: Returns the name of a resource's icon
Method.InternalNotes: Not currently used in UI
Method.Remarks:
Resource0 = Endurance. Endurance is the resource used while sprinting.
Resource1 = Kinetic Energy (Warriors), Volatility (Engineers), Psi Points (Esper), Power Cores (Medic), and is not used for stalkers
Resource2 - 3 = Unused Resource4 = Suit Power (stalkers) Resource5-7 = Unused

Param.Name: nResource
Param.Desc: The Resource being polled.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the given resource's icon.

Method.Name: GetResourceTooltip
Method.Desc: Returns the tooltip string for the given resource
Method.Remarks:
Resource0 = Endurance. Endurance is the resource used while sprinting.
Resource1 = Kinetic Energy (Warriors), Volatility (Engineers), Psi Points (Esper), Power Cores (Medic), and is not used for stalkers
Resource2 - 3 = Unused Resource4 = Suit Power (stalkers) Resource5-7 = Unused
Method.InternalNotes: Not called by UI

Param.Name: nResource
Param.Desc: The resource being polled for its tooltip

ReturnValue.Desc: The tooltip string for the given resource

Method.Name: GetMaxResource
Method.Desc: The maximum value for the specified resource

Param.Name: iResource
Param.Desc:
An integer representing the various resources.
0 = Endurance. Endurance is the resource used while sprinting.
1 = Kinetic Energy (Warriors), Volatility (Engineers), Psi Points (Esper), Power Cores (Medic), and is not used for stalkers
2 - 3 = Unused
4 = Suit Power (stalkers) 5-7 = Unused

ReturnValue.Desc: The maximum value for the specified resource

Method.Name: GetMinResource
Method.Desc: Returns the minimum amount of the given resource that the unit can have

Param.Name: iResource
Param.Desc:
An integer representing the various resources.
0 = Endurance. Endurance is the resource used while sprinting.
1 = Kinetic Energy (Warriors), Volatility (Engineers), Psi Points (Esper), Power Cores (Medic), and is not used for stalkers
2 - 3 = Unused
4 = Suit Power (stalkers) 5-7 = Unused

ReturnValue.Desc: The minimum amount of a given resource that the unit can have

Method.Name: GetBasicStats
Method.Desc: Returns a table containing a unit's most basic information
Method.Remarks:
Resource0 = Endurance. Endurance is the resource used while sprinting.
Resource1 = Kinetic Energy (Warriors), Volatility (Engineers), Psi Points (Esper), Power Cores (Medic), and is not used for stalkers
Resource2 - 3 = Unused Resource4 = Suit Power (stalkers) Resource5-7 = Unused

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The unit's name

Item.Name: nLevel
Item.Desc: The unit's true level. This value may be nil for some units

Item.Name: nEffectiveLevel
Item.Desc: The unit's effective level. Effective level is only used when being leveled down (mentoring) or leveled up (rallying). This value will be nil for units without a modified level.

Item.Name: nHealth
Item.Desc: The unit's current health. This value is nil for simple units.

Item.Name: nMaxHealth
Item.Desc: The unit's max health. This value is nil for simple units.

Item.Name: bShouldShowDeathPenalty

Item.Name: nPercentageOfDeathPenaltyTimer
Item.Desc: The percent of the death penalty timer that is remaining for the unit

Item.Name: nDeathPenaltyMinutes
Item.Desc: The minute value of the unit's remaining death penalty timer

Item.Name: nDeathPenaltySeconds
Item.Desc: The seconds value of the unit's remaining death penalty timer. This value only counts the seconds and only goes from 0-59

Item.Name: nResource0
Item.Desc: The unit's current amount of Resource0

Item.Name: nResource0min
Item.Desc: The minimum amount of Resource0 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource0max
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of Resource0 a unit can have

Item.Desc: The maximum amount of Resource1 a unit can have

Item.Desc: The minimum amount of Resource2 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource2max
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of Resource2 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource3
Item.Desc: The unit's current amount of Resource3

Item.Name: nResource3min
Item.Desc: The minimum amount of Resource3 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource3max
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of Resource3 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource4
Item.Desc: The unit's current amount of Resource4

Item.Name: nResource4min
Item.Desc: The minimum amount of Resource4 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource4max
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of Resource4 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource5
Item.Desc: The unit's current amount of Resource5

Item.Name: nResource5min
Item.Desc: The minimum amount of Resource5 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource5max
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of Resource5 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource6
Item.Desc: The unit's current amount of Resource6

Item.Name: nResource6min
Item.Desc: The minimum amount of Resource6 a unit can have

Item.Name: nResource6max
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of Resource6 a unit can have
