Item.Name: nResource7max
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of Resource7 a unit can have

Method.Name: GetUnitProperty
Method.Desc: Returns information on the specified property for the unit

Param.Name: eProperty
Param.Desc: This value corresponds with the Unit.CodeEnumProperties table

Item.Name: idProperty
Item.Desc: The ID number of the property

Item.Name: fValue
Item.Desc: The unit's current value for the property

Item.Name: fBase
Item.Desc: The unit's base value for the property

Item.Name: strDisplayName
Item.Desc: The name of the property

Item.Name: nTooltipDisplayOrder
Item.Desc: Where this should be displayed on item tooltips. Lower values should be shown towards the top

Method.Name: GetUnitProperties
Method.Desc: Returns a table with information on each of the unit's properties

Item.Name: idProperty
Item.Desc: The id number for the property

Item.Name: fValue
Item.Desc: The value of the property for the unit

Item.Name: fBase
Item.Desc: The unit's base value for the property

Item.Name: strDisplayName
Item.Desc: The name of the property

Item.Name: nTooltipDisplayOrder
Item.Desc: Where this property should be displayed in item tooltips, with lower numbers being towards the top of the tooltip

Method.Name: GetName
Method.Desc: Returns the name of the unit

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's name

Method.Name: GetPosition
Method.Desc: Returns a table with the unit's position in x, y, and z coordinates

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's position in x, y, and z coordinates

Method.Name: GetAffiliationName
Method.Desc: Returns the name of the faction that the character is affiliated with

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the faction that the unit is affiliated with

Method.Name: HasTitle
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is displaying a title

Method.Name: GetTitle
Method.Desc: Returns the title that the unit is displaying

ReturnValue.Desc: The title that the unit is displaying

Method.Name: GetLevel
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's level

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's level

Method.Name: GetLevelString
Method.Desc: Returns a localized string that includes a label and the unit's effective level

ReturnValue.Desc: A string containing a label ("Level: " in English) and the unit's effective level

Method.Name: GetFaction
Method.Desc: Gets the ID for the faction that the unit belongs to
Method.Example: It's worth noting that the player's faction changes in certain PvP match types, such as Arenas and Hold the Line.

ReturnValue.Desc: The ID for the faction that the unit belongs to

Method.Name: GetTarget
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's current target

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's current target

Method.Name: GetClusterUnits
Method.Desc: Returns a list of units in the unit's cluster

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of the units in the cluster

Method.Name: GetClusterInformation
Method.Desc: Returns information on the cluster that the unit belongs to
Method.InternalNotes: This function needs an enum for cluster difficulty

Item.Name: eDifficulty
Item.Desc: The cluster's difficulty. This corresponds with the XXX enum

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of units in the cluster

Item.Name: nIconCount
Item.Desc: The number of enemies in the cluster

Item.Name: tUnits
Item.Desc: The units in the cluster

Method.Name: GetArchetype
Method.Desc: Returns an NPC's archetype
Method.InternalNotes: This needs TCreature2ArcheTypeId to be accessible by Lua

Item.Name: idArchetype
Item.Desc: An enum representing the NPC's archetype

Item.Name: strIcon
Item.Desc: The name of the icon that corresponds with a particular archetype

Method.Name: GetEliteness
Method.Desc: Returns an enum representing the unit's eliteness level

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's eliteness level. This number corresponds with CodeEnumEliteness

Method.Name: GetRank
Method.Desc: Returns an integer representing the unit's difficulty rank

ReturnValue.Desc: An integer representing the unit's difficulty rank. This value corresponds with the Unit.CodeEnumRank enum

Method.Name: GetActivationState
Method.Desc: Passes a table with information on whether a unit can be interacted with, as well as who can interact with them.
Method.InternalNotes: Not all elements in the return table have descriptions at the moment

ReturnValue.Desc: This table is indexed by CUnit's s_ActivationInfo array

Item.Name: bCanInteract
Item.Desc: Whether or not the player can interact with the unit

Item.Name: bUseableWhenDead
Item.Desc: Whether or not the unit can be interacted with when dead. This includes dead players that can be revived

Item.Name: bUseableWhenHostile
Item.Desc: Pretty self explanitory, really

Item.Name: bShowCallout
Item.Desc: Whether the HUDAlert should be shown for the unit's interaction

Item.Name: bUsePlayerPath
Item.Desc: The unit can only be interacted with by players with the appropriate path if this is set to true

Method.Name: GetMiniMapMarker
Method.Desc: Returns the name for the character's marker on the minimap
Method.InternalNotes: Is this even being used correctly?

ReturnValue.Desc: A string representing the character's position on the minimap

Method.Name: IsDead
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is dead or not

Method.Name: IsCasting
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is casting

Method.Name: IsThePlayer
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the targeted unit is the player

Method.Name: IsACharacter
Method.Desc: Determines whether the unit is a player or not.

Method.Name: IsElite
Method.Desc: Not currently returning anything
Method.InternalNotes: Does this have a use anymore?

Method.Name: IsInCCState
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is being affected by crowd control

Method.Name: GetCastName
Method.Desc: Returns the name of the spell that the unit is currently casting. Returns an empty string if the character is not casting.

ReturnValue.Desc: Returns the name of the spell that the unit is casting.

Method.Name: GetCastDuration
Method.Desc: Returns the cast time of the spell that the unit is currently attempting to cast. If no spell is being cast, this returns 0.

ReturnValue.Desc: The cast time of the spell that the unit is currently attempting to cast (in milliseconds)

Method.Name: GetCastElapsed
Method.Desc: Returns the amount of time since the unit began to cast an ability. If the unit is not currently casting an ability, this returns 0.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of time since the the unit began to cast the ability (in milliseconds)

Method.Name: GetCastTotalPercent
Method.Desc: Returns the percentage of the cast time that has elapsed for the spell that the unit is casting

ReturnValue.Desc: The percentage of the cast time that is completed

Method.Name: GetCastBarType
Method.Desc: Returns the player's current cast bar type from the Unit.CodeEnumCastBarType table

ReturnValue.Desc: The type of cast bar that should be displayed when the unit uses an ability

Method.Name: GetMouseOverType
Method.Desc: Returns a string describing the unit's target frame type

ReturnValue.Desc: Returns "Simple" for units that have no HP and cannot be attacked or "Normal" for the rest

Method.Name: GetStandState
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's stand state
Method.Remarks: The states this function can return are "Stand", "Sit", "LyingDown", "State0", "State1", "State2", "Looting", "Emote", "StillPose", "DeathPose", "Burrowed", "State3", "Chair", "Mannequin"

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's stand state.

Method.Name: GetNameplateColor
Method.Desc: Returns an ApolloColor for the unit's nameplate

ReturnValue.Desc: The current color of the unit's nameplate

Method.Name: ShouldShowCastBar
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit's cast bar should be shown.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether or not the unit's cast bar should be shown.

Method.Name: ShouldShowBreathBar
Method.Desc: Determines whether the player's breath bar should be shown. This function will return false if it is called for any unit other than the current player.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether or not the player's breath bar should be shown.

Method.Name: ShouldShowCraftingBar
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit's crafting progress bar should be shown. This function returns false if called for any unit other than the current player.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether or not the unit's crafting progress bar should be shown

Method.Name: Resurrect
Method.Desc: Resurrect's the player based on the parameters passed
Method.InternalNotes: Need enum for RezType. Currently hardcoded in Death.lua. Need explanation for RezData.

Param.Name: nRezTypeChoice
Param.Desc: Where the player should be resurrected

Method.Name: FloatLootText
Method.Desc: Spawns a floating display for the items the character loots

Param.Name: itemLooted
Param.Desc: The item that was looted

Param.Name: nCount
Param.Desc: The number of items in the stack that was looted

Method.Name: GetOverheadAnchor
Method.Desc: Returns a table with the x, y, and z positions for the unit's nameplate (in relation to the model)

ReturnValue.Desc: A table containing the x, y, and z positions for the unit's nameplate

Method.Name: GetVendorItems
Method.Desc: Returns an array containing information on each item the vendor sells

Item.Name: idUnique
Item.Desc: The unique ID for the item

Item.Name: idItem
Item.Desc: The static ID number for the item

Item.Name: eType
Item.Desc: The type of thing being purchased. This value corresponds with the CodeEnumLootItemType enum.

Item.Name: nStackSize
Item.Desc: The number of items that are purchased at once

Item.Name: nStockCount
Item.Desc: The number of the item that the vendor has in stock.

Item.Name: bMeetsPrereq
Item.Desc: Whether or not the player meets the prerequisites to use the item

Item.Name: idPrereq
Item.Desc: An id representing the set of prerequisites needed to use the item

Item.Name: idGroup
Item.Desc: The ID number of the group that the item belongs to. This value lines up with one of the groups from the GetVendorGroups function

Item.Name: bIsSpecial
Item.Desc: Whether or not there is a special price for the item at the moment

Item.Name: bFutureStock
Item.Desc: Whether or not the unit will have more of the item in stock in the future.

Item.Name: nAmount1
Item.Desc: The amount that the item costs

Item.Name: eCurrencyType1
Item.Desc: The primary currency type used to purchase the item

Item.Name: eAltType1
Item.Desc: The alternate type of currency used to purchase the item

Item.Name: nAmount2
Item.Desc: The amount the item costs of the secondary currency

Item.Name: eCurrencyType2
Item.Desc: The secondary currency used to purchase the item

Item.Name: eAltType2
Item.Desc: The secondary alternate type of currency used to purchase the item

Item.Name: itemData
Item.Desc: The item being purchased

Item.Name: splData
Item.Desc: A spell effect being purchased.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the item

Method.Name: GetBuybackItems
Method.Desc: Returns a list with info on the items that the players can buy back from a vendor

Item.Name: idUnique
Item.Desc: The unique ID of the item. This ID belongs to this one instance of the item.

Item.Name: idItem
Item.Desc: The ID number of the item. Every copy of this item has the same ID for this value.

Item.Name: nStackSize
Item.Desc: The number of instances of the item that can be bought back

Item.Name: nStockCount
Item.Desc: The number of an item that the vendor has on them

Item.Name: bMeetsPrereq
Item.Desc: Whether or not the character can use the item

Item.Name: nAmount1
Item.Desc: The amount of the primary currency used to buy back the item

Item.Name: eCurrencyType1
Item.Desc: The type of the primary currency used to purchase an item

Item.Name: eAltType1
Item.Desc: The secondary type of currency that can be used to purchase the item

Item.Name: nAmount2
Item.Desc: The amount of the second type of currency used to purchase an item

Item.Name: eCurrencyType2
Item.Desc: The second type of currency used to purchase the item

Item.Name: eAltType2
Item.Desc: The alternat form of currency that can be used for the secondary cost of the item

Item.Name: itemData
Item.Desc: The item that the player can buy back

Item.Name: arGlyphIds
Item.Desc: An array of ID numbers for the glyphs on the item (if there are any)

Item.Name: itemGlyphData
Item.Desc: The glyph slots on the item, if any

Item.Name: itemModData
Item.Desc: Modifications to the item (if any)

Item.Name: strIcon
Item.Desc: The string containing the icon name

Item.Name: strMaker
Item.Desc: The name of the player that made the item

Method.Name: GetRepairableItems
Method.Desc: Returns a list with information on the items that the unit owns that can be repaired

Item.Name: idLocation
Item.Desc: The item's location in the character's inventory or equipment

Item.Name: idItem
Item.Desc: The item's id number

Item.Name: nStackSize
Item.Desc: The number of items in the stack

Item.Name: nStockCount
Item.Desc: The number of the item the vendor has in stock

Item.Name: bMeetsPrereq
Item.Desc: Whether or not the unit meets the prerequisites to equip the item. For the sake of this function, this value will always be true.

Item.Name: tPriceInfo
Item.Desc: The cost of repairing the item

Item.Name: nAmount1
Item.Desc: The primary cost of repairing the item

Item.Name: eCurrencyType1
Item.Desc: The primary type of currency used to repair the item. This value corresponds with the Money.CodeEnumCurrencyType enum

Item.Name: eAltType1
Item.Desc: The primary alternate form of currency used for repairing the item. This value corresponds with the Money.CodeEnumCurrencyType enum

Item.Name: nAmount2
Item.Desc: The secondary cost of repairing the item

Item.Name: eCurrencyType2
Item.Desc: The secondary type of currency used to repair the item

Item.Name: eAltType2
Item.Desc: The secondary alternate form of currency used to repair the item. This value corresponds with the Money.CodeEnumCurrencyType enum

Item.Name: itemData
Item.Desc: The item needing repairs

Item.Name: strIcon
Item.Desc: The name of the item's icon

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The item's name

Method.Name: GetConColor
Method.Desc: Returns a color that corresponds with the unit's difficulty in relation to the player's.
Method.InternalNotes: This needs to be changed to ApolloColor

ReturnValue.Desc: The color value representing the level difference between the player and the unit.

Method.Name: GetDifficulty
Method.Desc: Returns the difficulty of the cluster
Method.InternalNotes: This should be depricated. We get the same info (and more) in GetClusterInformation

ReturnValue.Desc: The cluster's difficulty.

Method.Name: GetRewardInfo
Method.Desc: Returns a table containing information on all of the active quests, missions, challenges, and public events that this unit is the target of

ReturnValue.Desc: An array containing information on each thing that the unit is the objective of. Each type has its own variables.

Item.Desc: If the unit is part of a mission objective, this table will be one of the ones returned

Item.Name: strType
Item.Desc: The type of objective contained in this table

Item.Name: idQuest
Item.Desc: The ID number of the quest that the unit is a target of

Item.Name: strTitle
Item.Desc: The name of the quest that the unit is a target of

Item.Name: nCompleted
Item.Desc: The number of the unit that has been killed for the quest or the percentage of completion that the player has reached

Item.Name: nNeeded
Item.Desc: The number of the unit that the player needs to interact with for the quest. If nCompleted is a percent, then this value is 100.

Item.Name: splAbility
Item.Desc: A spell granted for use in the quest

Item.Name: splObjective
Item.Desc: A spell that needs to be used as one of the objectives of the quest

Item.Name: bShowCount
Item.Desc: Whether or not the number interacted with and required should be shown
If the unit is part of a challenge, then the table will use these values

Item.Name: strType
Item.Desc: The type of objective. In this case, the value is "Challenge"

Item.Name: idChallenge
Item.Desc: The ID number of the challenge that the unit is the target of

Item.Name: strTitle
Item.Desc: The name of the challenge targeting the unit

Item.Name: nCompleted
Item.Desc: The number of the unit that has been interacted with for the challenge

Item.Name: nNeeded
Item.Desc: The number of the unit that the player must interact with for the challenge
If the unit is the target of a public event, the table will look like this

Item.Name: strType
Item.Desc: The type of objective that the unit is a part of. In this case, the value is "PublicEvent"

Item.Name: peoObjective
Item.Desc: The specific Public Event Objective that the unit is the target of
If the unit is the target of a path mission, the table will look like this

Item.Name: strType
Item.Desc: The type of mission that the unit is the target of. This may be either "Scientist", "Soldier", or "Explorer" in this case

Item.Name: pmMission
Item.Desc: The PathMission that the unit is the target of

Item.Name: splReward
Item.Desc: Any spell tied to interacting with the unit, such as drops from scanning the unit with a Scientist or items tied to the mission that the player needs to use on the unit

Item.Name: bIsActivated
Item.Desc: Whether or not the player has interacted with the object that starts the mission. This value only exists for Soldier missions

Method.Name: GetDispositionTo
Method.Desc: Returns a unit's disposition to another unit

Param.Desc: The unit that the calling unit is being compared to

ReturnValue.Desc: A number representing the calling unit's disposition to another unit. This number correlates to CodeEnumDisposition.

Method.Name: InviteToGroup
Method.Desc: Sends a group invitation request to the target player

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumCCState
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing the various crowd control effects, including Taunt

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumEliteness
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing the estimated group size needed to kill the NPC.
EnumSet.InternalNotes: What's the difference between this and the Rank enum?

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumRank
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing the difficulty of an NPC in relation to other NPCs of the same level
EnumSet.InternalNotes: What's the difference between this and the "Eliteness" enum?

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumProperties
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing various unit properties. These properties are generally seen on the Character and Inspect screens in the default UI
EnumSet.InternalNotes: Are we even using all of these anymore? We should look into removing depricated values.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumResourceConversionType
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing the various types of resource conversion. Item2Item: One type of item for another type Item2Rep: One type of item for reputation with a faction Prereq2Rep: ???

Method.Name: GetTitleOrName
Method.Desc: If the unit has a title set, this returns it. If it doesn't, this returns the name of the unit

ReturnValue.Desc: The title of the unit if it has one set. The name of the unit if it doesn't.

Method.Name: GetPlayerPathType
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's path. If the unit is not a player, returns nil.

ReturnValue.Desc: A number representing the unit's path. This value corresponds with the PlayerPathLib.PlayerPathType int constants.

Method.Name: IsCurrentBindPoint
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the specified bind point is the user's current bind point.

Method.Name: GetBindPointString
Method.Desc: Returns the name of the last place the character set their bind point.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the character's current bind point

Method.Name: GetEquippedItems
Method.Desc: Returns an array containing all of the unit's equipped items.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of all of the items the unit has equipped

Method.Name: GetResourceConversions
Method.Desc: Returns a list of resource conversions that the unit is able to perform. If the unit is not able to perform resource conversions, this returns nil.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array containing each of the conversions available through the NPC

Item.Name: idConversion
Item.Desc: The ID number for this conversion type

Item.Name: itemSource
Item.Desc: The item the player needs to trade in this conversion. This value does not exist for conversions that do not require items

Item.Name: idSource
Item.Desc: The ID number for the object that can be converted into reputation. This value does not exist if the conversion requires items

Item.Name: nSourceCount
Item.Desc: The number of the object required for the conversion

Item.Name: nAvailableCount
Item.Desc: The number of the object required for the conversion that are in the player's inventory

Item.Name: eType
Item.Desc: The type of conversion. This value corresponds with the Unit.CodeEnumResourceConversionType enum

Item.Name: itemTarget
Item.Desc: The item that is given to the player by the conversion. This variable only exists if the conversion gives items

Item.Name: idTarget
Item.Desc: The ID number of the faction who the player gains reputation with through this conversion. This value does not exist if the conversion does not grant reputation

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the faction that the player gains reputation with through the conversion. This variable does not exist if the conversion does not grant reputation

Item.Name: nTargetCount
Item.Desc: The amount of the reward that is granted to the player through this conversion

Method.Name: ConvertResource
Method.Desc: Perform this unit's resource conversion operation if it has one

Param.Name: idConversion
Param.Desc: The id number for the resource conversion. This value will generally come from unit:GetResourceConversions()

Function.Name: GetVitalTable
Function.Desc: A function that returns a list of several of the character's vital statistics. This table is indexed by the CodeEnumVital enum.

Param.Desc: A table containing a list of the character's vitals, sorted by index, using the values from CodeEnumVitals as indexes

Item.Desc: Some of the values are integers
Others are strings
And others are floats

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumFlightPathType
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing different types of flight paths Local: Traveling from one place to another within the same worldId Transfer: Traveling from one worldId to another

Method.Name: GetAttachmentPosition
Method.Desc: Gets the position of the selected attachment

Item.Name: bFound
Item.Desc: Whether any attachment was found on the unit

Item.Name: tLocation
Item.Desc: The location of the attachment in x, y, z coordinates

Param.Name: nAttachmentIdx
Param.Desc: The attachment you want to find the position for

Method.Name: GetFlightPaths
Method.Desc: Returns a list of flight paths that are available from a Taxi NPC. Returns nil if the unit isn't a Taxi NPC

ReturnValue.Desc: An array containing information for each of the Taxi's connections.

Item.Name: idNode
Item.Desc: The ID number for this flight path

Item.Name: eType
Item.Desc: The flight path's type. This corresponds with the CodeEnumFlightPathType enum

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the flight path

Item.Name: tLocation
Item.Desc: The destination's x, y, and z coordinates

Method.Name: GetFlightPathToPoint
Method.Desc: Returns a table containing the price of the flight and each node that the path passes through

Item.Name: tPriceInfo
Item.Desc: A table containing price information for the flight path

Item.Name: nAmount1
Item.Desc: The cost of the flight path

Item.Name: eCurrencyType1
Item.Desc: The primary currency type used to purchase the flight path. This value corresponds with Money.CodeEnumCurrencyType enum

Item.Name: eAltType1
Item.Desc: The alternate type of currency used to purchase the flight path. This value corresponds with the Money.CodeEnumCurrencyType enum

Item.Name: nAmount2
Item.Desc: The amount of alternate currency used to activate the flight path

Item.Name: eCurrencyType2
Item.Desc: The type of currency used as an alternate way to activate the flight path. This value corresponds with the Money.CodeEnumCurrencyType enum

Item.Name: eAltType2
Item.Desc: The alternate type of currency used for the alternate purchase cost for the flight path. This corresponds with the Money.CodeEnumCurrencyType enum

Item.Name: tRoute
Item.Desc: An array of node IDs that are accessible from the taxi

Item.Name: idNode
Item.Desc: The ID number of the flight path

Method.Name: PurchaseFlightPath
Method.Desc: Purchases the flight path to the specified destination

Param.Name: idDestination
Param.Desc: The ID number of the flight path's destination.

Method.Name: TakeShuttle
Method.Desc: When called from a taxi NPC, this will summon the taxi for the player.

Method.Name: GetTransferDestination
Method.Desc: Returns the destination of a taxi route that transfers the player to another zone

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the destination

Method.Name: GetPrereqInfo
Method.Desc: Validates that the player meets the prerequisites for an item and returns a table with the results

Param.Name: idPrereq
Param.Desc: The ID number for the item whose prerequisites are being checked

Item.Name: bIsMet
Item.Desc: Whether or not the unit meets the prerequisites

Item.Name: strText
Item.Desc: A string containing the prerequisite for the item

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumGender
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing a unit's gender. For the sake of this enum, Chua are male.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumSpellMechanic
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing the spell mechanics of each class
EnumSet.InternalNotes: Do we still care about Empathy? (pun very much intended)

Method.Name: GetGender
Method.Desc: Returns an integer representing the unit's gender.

ReturnValue.Desc: Returns an integer representing the unit's gender. This corresponds with the CodeEnumGender enum

Method.Name: GetManaRegenInCombat
Method.Desc: Returns the amount of Focus the unit regens during combat

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of Focus the unit regens in combat

Method.Name: GetManaRegenNonCombat
Method.Desc: The amount of Focus the unit regens outside of combat

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of Focus the unit regens outside of combat

Method.Name: GetAbsorptionValue
Method.Desc: Returns the character's current absorption value. If the unit loses whatever effect gave them absorption, this will return any unused absorption even though the max absorption value is 0.

ReturnValue.Desc: The character's current absorption value.

Method.Name: GetAbsorptionMax
Method.Desc: Returns the current maximum absorption amount for the character. If the character has nothing giving them absorption, this returns 0. If the unit has no health bar, this returns nil.

ReturnValue.Desc: The character's maximum absorption amount

Method.Name: GetGroupValue
Method.InternalNotes: How is this different from the cluster's difficulty? What does the return value correspond with?
Method.Desc: Returns the cluster's difficulty value

Method.Name: GetClusterContributionValue
Method.InternalNotes: Unknown. Will have to speak with designers on this one

Method.Name: GetAchievementPoints
Method.Desc: Returns the character's achievement points.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of achievement points the character has earned.

Method.Name: HasTextBubble
Method.Desc: A function that determines whether or not the unit has a text bubble over their head

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether or not the unit has a text bubble over their head

Method.Name: AddTextBubble
Method.Desc: Adds a text bubble above the unit with the specified text

Param.Desc: The text to put in the text bubble

Method.Name: IsOccluded
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is currently hidden behind an object or terrain

Method.Name: GetCCStateTimeRemaining
Method.Desc: Returns the remaining time that the unit is under crowd control effects

ReturnValue.Desc: The remaining time the unit has to spend in a crowd control state (in milliseconds)

Method.Name: GetBuffs
Method.Desc: Returns a table containing all of the positive and negative buffs on the unit

ReturnValue.Desc: A table containing information on all of the positive and negative buffs on the unit

Item.Name: arHarmful
Item.Desc: An array containing info on all of the debuffs on the unit

Item.Name: idBuff
Item.Desc: The id number for the buff itself. This is not to be confused with the id number of the spell containing the buff's effect

Item.Name: splEffect
Item.Desc: The spell containing the buff's effect.

Item.Name: fTimeRemaining
Item.Desc: The amount of time (in milliseconds) left before the buff ends

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of stacks of the buff on the player

Item.Name: arBeneficial
Item.Desc: An array containing info on all of the beneficial buffs on the unit

Item.Name: idBuff
Item.Desc: The id number for the buff. This is not to be confused with the id number for the spell containing the buff's effect

Item.Name: splEffect
Item.Desc: The spell containing the buff's effect

Item.Name: fTimeRemaining
Item.Desc: The time remaining before the buff ends in milliseconds

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of stacks of a buff that are on the unit

Method.Name: GetInterruptArmorValue
Method.Desc: The amount of interrupt armor currently on the unit

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of interrupt armor currently on the unit

Method.Name: GetInterruptArmorMax
Method.Desc: Returns the maximum amount of interrupt armor the unit can have

ReturnValue.Desc: The maximum amount of interrupt armor for the unit

Method.Name: ShouldShowNamePlate
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit's nameplate should be shown.

ReturnValue.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit's nameplate should be shown

Method.Name: GetVendorGroups
Method.Desc: Returns a table with item categories for a vendor. If this unit is not a vendor, this table is empty

Item.Name: idGroup
Item.Desc: The group's ID number

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The group's name

Method.Name: GetRepTurninItems
Method.Desc: Returns information on what items the player is carrying that can count as reputation for the given unit's faction
Method.InternalNotes: Not currently used in UI

ReturnValue.Desc: An array containing information on each of the items that the player is holding that can be turned in for reputation

Item.Name: idRep
Item.Desc: The faction the player would gain reputation with

Item.Name: nRepAmount
Item.Desc: The amount of reputation the item is worth

Item.Name: itemRequired
Item.Desc: The item that can be turned in for reputation

Method.Name: GetTrainerTradeskills
Method.Desc: Returns a list of tradeskills available at the trainer. If the unit is not a tradeskill trainer, this returns nil.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name and ID of each tradeskill available

Item.Name: eTradeskillId
Item.Desc: The ID number of the tradeskill. This number corresponds with the CraftingLib.CodeEnumTradeskill

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the tradeskill

Method.Name: GetCraftingStationTradeskills
Method.Desc: Returns a list of tradeskills that can be used at this crafting station. Returns nil if the unit is not a crafting station

ReturnValue.Desc: This array will contain info on every tradeskill that can be used at this station

Item.Name: eTradeskillId
Item.Desc: The ID number of the tradeskill. This value corresponds with the CraftingLib.CodeEnumTradeskill enum

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the tradeskill

Method.Name: GetLevelDifferential
Method.Desc: Returns an integer representing the unit's level differential with the specified unit

Param.Name: unitTarget
Param.Desc: The unit that the source unit is being compared to

ReturnValue.Desc: An integer representing the level differential between the source unit and the target. This value corresponds with the CodeEnumLevelDifferential enum

Method.Name: GetConValue
Method.Desc: Returns the integer representing the level difference between the player and the unit

ReturnValue.Desc: The integer representing the level difference between the player and the unit. This value corresponds with the CodeEnumLevelDifferentialAttribute enum

Method.Name: GetInventoryItems
Method.Desc: Returns a list of the player's inventory items. Calling this on anyone but the current player returns an empty table.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array containing player's items and the corresponding bag slot that they are found in

Item.Name: nBagSlot
Item.Desc: The bag slot where the item is found

Item.Name: itemInBag
Item.Desc: The item in the player's inventory

Method.Name: LockInventorySlot
Method.Desc: Locks the specified inventory slot for the current player

Param.Name: nLocation
Param.Desc: The inventory slot that should be locked

Method.Name: UnlockInventorySlot
Method.Desc: Unlocks the specified inventory slot for the player.

Param.Name: nInventoryLocation
Param.Desc: The inventory slot number that should be unlocked

Method.Name: IsInventorySlotLocked
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the specified inventory slot is locked

Param.Name: nLocation
Param.Desc: The inventory location of the item

Method.Name: UnlockAllInventorySlots
Method.Desc: Removes the locked state from all of the player's inventory slots.

Method.Name: GetSupplySatchelItems
Method.Desc: Returns a list of items and information on the contents of the player's Supply Satchel. Note, this returns an empty table if this is called on someone other than the player

Item.Name: idLocation
Item.Desc: The item's location in the Supply Satchel

Item.Name: itemMaterial
Item.Desc: The item itself

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The amount of the item that the player owns

Method.Name: ShowHintArrow
Method.Desc: Places a guide arrow above the player's head that points them in the direction of the unit that called the function.

Method.Name: IsPublicEventHub

Method.Name: GetGuildName
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's guild's name. Note that this will specifically get the guild and not other guild types such as warparties, circles, or arena teams.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the player's guild

Method.Name: GetGuildType
Method.InternalNotes: What should this return? The type of the guild that's on their nameplate?
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's guild type

Method.Name: IsInYourGroup
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the given unit is in the player's group

Method.Name: IsPvpFlagged
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is flagged for PvP

Method.Name: IsTagged

Method.Name: IsTaggedByMe
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the current unit was tagged by the player

Method.Name: IsSoftKill
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is eligible for open tagging.

Method.Name: GetUnitRaceId

Method.InternalNotes: Why do we have a GetRaceID and GetUnitRaceId?
