Method.Desc: Returns the percent of the unit's maximum shields that are regenerated each tic

ReturnValue.Desc: The percent of the unit's maximum shields that are regenerated each tic

Method.Name: GetShieldRebootTime
Method.Desc: Returns the amount of time the unit needs to go without taking damage before their shields start to regenerate

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of time between shield regen tics

Method.Name: GetShieldTickTime
Method.Desc: Returns the intervals at which the unit's shields regenerate, in seconds

ReturnValue.Desc: The intervals at which the unit's shields regenerate, in seconds.

Method.Name: GetCCDurationModifier
Method.Desc: Returns any modifiers to Crowd Control duration on the player.

ReturnValue.Desc: The crowd control duration modifier on the player

Method.Name: IsVisibleInstancePortal
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is an instance portal and if it is visible

Method.Name: GetInstancePortalLevelRange
Method.Desc: Returns the level range for an instance inside an instance portal. Returns nil if the unit is not an instance portal.

Item.Name: nMinLevel
Item.Desc: The minimum level for the instance

Item.Name: nMaxLevel
Item.Desc: The maximum level for the instance. Players above this level will be scaled to this level inside the instance

Method.Name: GetInstancePortalCompletionTime
Method.Desc: Returns the expected completion time of the instance inside an instance portal

ReturnValue.Desc: The expected completion time of the instance, in minutes

Method.Name: GetInstancePortalRemainingTime
Method.Desc: The group's remaining time to finish an instance.

ReturnValue.Desc: The group's remaining time to finish an instance, in seconds

Method.Name: IsShieldOverloaded
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit's shields are overloaded

Method.Name: IsMentoring
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the selected unit is mentoring another player

Method.Name: IsRallied
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit's level has been fixed due to rallying

Method.Name: GetLoot
Method.Desc: Returns a list of dropped loot that belongs to the player

ReturnValue.Desc: There are multiple combinations of variables found in the table. Each combination is dependant on which type

Item.Desc: This contains all of the variables for items that can be looted

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The amount of items looted in this indivudal drop

Item.Name: itemLoot
Item.Desc: The item that was dropped

Item.Name: itemModData
Item.Desc: The mod data for the item that was dropped. Note that not every item will have this variable

Item.Name: itemSigilData
Item.Desc: The sigil data for the item that was dropped. Note that not every item will have sigil data.
This table contains all the variables for money loot drops

Item.Name: monCurrency
Item.Desc: Currency that was dropped.
This table contains all the variables for virtual items that are looted

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the virtual item

Item.Name: strFlavor
Item.Desc: The flavor text for the virtual item

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of the virtual item that will be picked up in this individual drop

Item.Name: strIcon
Item.Desc: The string name for the icon used for the virtual item

Item.Name: eType
Item.Desc: The virtual item's type. This value corresponds with the >>>> enum
This table contains all the variables for spell effects that are dropped, such as from Scientist scans.

Item.Name: tAbility
Item.Desc: Information on the skill that is picked up.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the spell

Item.Name: strDescription
Item.Desc: The description of the spell

Item.Name: strButtonIcon
Item.Desc: The string for the spell's icon

Method.Name: CanBeHarvestedBy
Method.Desc: Returns whether or not the player can harvest the selected unit. Returns false if the unit is not a harvestable unit.

Param.Name: unitPlayer
Param.Desc: The function checks against this unit's tradeskills to see if the calling unit is harvestable

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether or not the unit can be harvested by the unit that was passed in

Method.Name: GetHarvestRequiredTradeskillName
Method.Desc: Returns the name of the tradeskill required to harvest a node. Note, some units are labeled as "Harvestable", but do not require a tradeskill and generally do not provide materials.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the tradeskill required to harvest the node.

Method.Name: GetHarvestRequiredTradeskillTier
Method.Desc: Returns the tier of the tradeskill required to harvest a node. Note that there are some nodes that are labeled as "Harvest", but do not require a tradeskill. These nodes do not provide mats.

ReturnValue.Desc: The tradeskill tier required to harvest the node

Method.Name: IsSettlerImprovement
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is a settler improvement

Method.Name: IsSettlerReward
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the unit is a settler improvement with a reward

Method.Name: GetSettlerRewardName
Method.InternalNotes: Unknown. It's used in tooltips, but I can't seem to find anything that is one.

Method.Name: GetSettlerImprovementInfo
Method.Desc: Returns information on Settler Improvements. Returns an empty table if the unit is not a Settler Improvment

Item.Name: arOwnerNames
Item.Desc: A list of the people who help build and maintain this improvement

Item.Name: bIsInfiniteDuration
Item.Desc: Whether or not the improvement lasts forever

Item.Name: nRemainingTime
Item.Desc: Returns the remaining duration on the improvement in seconds

Item.Name: arTiers
Item.Desc: A list of the various tiers of the improvement

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of this tier of the improvement

Item.Name: nTier
Item.Desc: The tier number

Method.Name: IsFriendlyWarplotStructure
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the selected unit is both a warplot plug and if it's friendly

ReturnValue.Desc: Returns true if both the unit is a plug and if it is friendly

Method.Name: GetCurrentWarplotTier
Method.Desc: Returns the tier of a Warplot plug. If this is called for any unit other than a Warplot plug, this returns nil.

ReturnValue.Desc: The current tier of a Warplot plug

Method.Name: CanUpgradeWarplotStructure
Method.Desc: Returns whether or not a character has permissions to upgrade a warplot structure during a match

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether or not the player has permissions to upgrade structures

Method.Name: GetCurrentWarplotUpgradeCost
Method.Desc: Returns the number of Nanopacks needed to upgrade the selected Warplot plug. This returns nil if called from any unit that is not a Warplot plug.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of Nanopacks needed to upgrade the selected Warplot plug.

Method.Name: IsAccountFriend
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the specified unit is an Account Friend

Method.Name: GetUnitMount
Method.Desc: Returns the unit's mount

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's current mount

Method.Name: Inspect
Method.Desc: Performs the Inspect action on the given unit. This will cause the Inspect event to be fired

Method.Name: GetUnitOwner
Method.Desc: Returns the owner of a pet.

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit who owns the pet

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumDisposition
EnumSet.Desc: An NPC's disposition towards the player. Hostile: Attacks when their target is within agro range Neutral: Will only attack if they are attacked first Friendly: The unit cannot attack or be attacked by the target

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumLootItemType
EnumSet.Desc: An enum representing the different types of loot that can drop off an NPC. StaticItem: Your typical item loot. Cash: Make money money... Virtual Item: Virtual items used for specific quests / challenges / dungeons / adventures AdventureSpell: Drops that have an immediate effect on the player that picks them up

Method.Name: GetVehicle
Method.Desc: Returns the vehicle the unit is currently riding

ReturnValue.Desc: The vehicle that the unit is riding

Event.Name: UnitCCStateChanged
Event.Desc: Updates the target frame if the targetted unit becomes vulnerable by displaying vulnerability indicators

Method.Name: GetOffensiveStats
Method.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Method.Name: GetDefensiveStats
Method.Desc: Currently has no implementation

Method.Name: GetAbilityPower
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushnumber of the unit's ability power.

Method.Name: GetDuelState
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushnumber of 1 for HasPendingDuelRequest, 2 for IsDueling, else 3.

Method.Name: ShouldShowHealthBar
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushboolean whether the unit's health bar should be shown.

Method.Name: ShouldShowShieldCapacityBar
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushboolean whether the unit's shield bar should be shown.

Method.Name: GetRechargeableItems
Method.Desc: Does a lua_newtable of many (10+) fields describing the rechargeable items.

Method.Name: GetDifficultyString
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring of pUnit's localized difficulty string corresponding to its difficulty color.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumVital
EnumSet.Desc: Represents the basic stats of HP, Mana, and Class Resources

Method.Name: GetCooldownPercent
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushnumber of the caller's cooldown percent as a float.

Method.Name: SetCooldownPercent
Method.Desc: Sets the caller's cooldown percent to fCooldownPercent.

Method.Name: GetItemData
Method.Desc: Does a lua_rawgeti on m_iLuaDataRefId of the caller's cell at iRow and iCol as a LuaData.

Method.Name: GetItemText
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushwstring on m_strText of the caller's cell at iRow and iCol as a String.

Method.Name: InsertRow
Method.Desc: Currently commented out. Not implemented

Method.Name: SetCellBGNormal
Method.Desc: Sets the Sprite m_sprCellBGNormal's Info to sText and the CColor m_crCellBGNormal to color.

Method.Name: SetCellBGNormalFocus
Method.Desc: Sets the Sprite m_sprCellBGNormalFocus's Info to sText and the CColor m_crCellBGNormalFocus to color.

Method.Name: SetCellBGSelected
Method.Desc: Sets the Sprite m_sprCellBGSelected's Info to sText and the CColor m_crCellBGSelected to color.

Method.Name: SetCellBGSelectedFocus
Method.Desc: Sets the Sprite m_sprCellBGSelectedFocus's Info to sText and the CColor m_crCellBGSelectedFocus to color.

Method.Name: AddPixie
Method.InternalNotes: Desperately needs coding standard fix

Param.Name: iLayer
Param.Desc: The pixie layer that the picie should be created at

Param.Name: bLine
Param.Desc: Draws the pixie as a line

Param.Name: strText
Param.Desc: The text to add to the pixie

Param.Name: strFont
Param.Desc: The font to use for the pixie

Param.Name: flagsText
Param.Desc: The flags for the the text

Param.Name: fWidth
Param.Desc: The width of the pixie. This is only used if the pixie is drawn as a line.

Param.Name: strSprite
Param.Desc: The name of the sprite used for the pixie. This is only used for pixies that aren't drawn as a line.

Param.Name: fRotation
Param.Desc: The number of degrees the pixie is rotated. This is only used for pixies that are not drawn as a line.

Param.Name: loc
Param.Desc: The boundaries of the pixie. This table contains the offsets and points for the boundary.

Item.Name: fPoints
Item.Desc: The points at the edges of the pixie. Values are ordered as Left, Top, Right, Bottom.

Item.Name: nOffsets
Item.Desc: The offsets for the pixie. These are ordered as Left, Top, Right, Bottom.

Param.Name: cr
Param.Desc: The color of the pixie

Param.Name: crText
Param.Desc: The color of the text in the pixie

ReturnValue.Desc: The pixie's ID number

Event.Name: WindowGainedFocus
Event.Desc: Fires when a window gains focus

Event.Name: WindowLostFocus
Event.Desc: Fires when a window lost focus

Method.Name: GetMaxAbilityId
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushinteger of the ability's Id, or 0 if the ability is not found.

Param.Name: eMouseButton
Param.Desc: The mouse button being clicked.

Param.Name: itemClicked
Param.Desc: Item that was clicked

Method.Name: ClearQuestIndicators
Method.Desc: Runs the caller's RemoveObjectsByType method on MiniMapObjectType_QuestObjective.

Method.Name: ClearPathIndicators
Method.Desc: Runs the caller's RemoveObjectsByType method on MiniMapObjectType_PathObjective.

Method.Name: GetZoneCount
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushinteger of the caller's zone count.

Method.Name: GetCurrentZoneIndex
Method.Desc: Does a lua_pushinteger of the current zone Id.

Method.Name: RevealLocation
Method.Desc: Runs the caller's RevealLocation with nPos.

Method.Name: ClearAllIndyDots
Method.Desc: Runs the caller's m_listDots.Clear method.

Method.Name: AddIndyDot
Method.Desc: Runs the caller's add method to m_listDots with nPos.

Method.Name: ClearQuestIndicators
Method.Desc: Runs the caller's RemoveAllRegionsByType method on MapOverlay_Quest.

Method.Name: ClearPathIndicators
Method.Desc: Runs the caller's RemoveAllRegionsByType method on MapOverlay_Path.

Method.Name: GetZoneAtPoint
Method.Desc: return the table with information about the zone currently located at that point(x, y) in the window

Method.Name: SetHexOverlaySprite
Method.Desc: Sets the sprite used to overlay sprites that are "lit up"

Method.Name: SetIndyDotSprite
Method.Desc: Sets the sprite used to draw indy dots

Library.Name: CraftingLib
Library.Desc: This library is the primary way that the UI interacts with various tradeskills and schematics. This includes tradeskills that the player has chosen, as well as ones that they are automatically granted such as cooking and runecrafting.

Function.Name: GetSchematicList
Function.InternalNotes: We could really use an enum for item categories.
Function.Desc: Gets a list of schematics that meet the requirements that are passed into this function.

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The function will return the schematics that the player knows for this tradeskill.

Param.Name: nItemCategory
Param.Desc: The function will only return schematics that create items that fall under this category.

Param.Name: eTier
Param.Desc: The function will return schematics that belong to this tradeskill tier.

Param.Name: bShowUnknown
Param.Desc: Whether the function should return schematics that the player has not unlocked or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array that contains info on each of the schematics that meet the requirements passed into the function.

Item.Name: nSchematicId
Item.Desc: The schematic's id number.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the schematic.

Item.Name: eItemType
Item.Desc: The type of the item that is created by the schematic.

Item.Name: eTier
Item.Desc: The tradeskill tier that the schematic belongs to.

Item.Name: bIsKnown
Item.Desc: Whether the player has learned the schematic or not.

Item.Name: bIsOneUse
Item.Desc: Whether the schematic can only be used once or not.

Item.Name: strItemTypeName
Item.Desc: The item's type, in string form.

Item.Name: tSubRecipes
Item.Desc: An array that contains info on this schematic's sub-schematics.

Item.Name: nSchematicId
Item.Desc: The id number for the sub-schematic.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the schematic.

Item.Name: bIsKnown
Item.Desc: Whether the player has learned the sub-schematic or not.

Function.Name: CraftItem
Function.Desc: Begins a crafting attempt for the specified schematic.
Function.Example: If the crafting attempt is successfully started, then the CraftingUpdateCurrent event will fire and the materials for the schematic will be consumed.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The schematic that the player is trying to craft.

Function.Name: GetKnownTradeskills
Function.Desc: Gets the id numbers and names of the tradeskills known by the character.

ReturnValue.Desc: The names and id numbers of tradeskills that are active for the character.

Item.Name: eId
Item.Desc: The tradeskill's id.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the tradeskill.

Function.Name: GetTradeskillInfo
Function.Desc: Returns a table with info about the chosen tradeskill
Function.InternalNotes: tTalentTiers needs some format work.

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The id for the tradeskill that the function will return info on.

ReturnValue.Desc: Detailed information on the tradeskill, including its description, XP requirements, requirements to relearn, and talents.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The tradeskill's name.

Item.Name: strDescription
Item.Desc: A description of the tradeskill.

Item.Name: nXpMax
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of XP the player can earn for this tradeskill.

Item.Name: nTierMax
Item.Desc: The number of tiers the tradeskill has.

Item.Name: bIsHobby
Item.Desc: Whether the tradeskill is a hobby or not. The only hobby currently in game is Cooking.

Item.Name: bIsAutoLearn
Item.Desc: Whether the tradeskill is automatically learned by the player at a certain level or not.

Item.Name: bIsHarvesting
Item.Desc: Whether the tradeskill is a harvesting tradeskill or not.

Item.Name: bIsCircuitBoardCrafting
Item.Desc: Whether the tradeskill's schematics use Circuit Board Crafting or not.

Item.Name: bIsCoordinateCrafting
Item.Desc: Whether the tradeskill's schematics use Coordinate Crafting or not.

Item.Name: tXpTiers
Item.Desc: An array that contains the amount of XP required to reach each tier of the tradeskill.

Item.Name: tAxisNames
Item.Desc: The names of the directions in the coordinate crafting grid for this tradeskill.

Item.Name: bIsActive
Item.Desc: Whether the player currently knows the tradeskill or not.

Item.Name: nXP
Item.Desc: The amount of XP the player has earned for this tradeskill.

Item.Name: eTier
Item.Desc: The tier that the player has reached in the tradeskill.

Item.Name: nXpForTier
Item.Desc: The amount of XP the player has earned while in the current tier.

Item.Name: nXpForNextTier
Item.Desc: The amount of XP the player needs to reach their next tradeskill tier.

Item.Name: nTalentPoints
Item.Desc: The number of talent points the player has unlocked.

Item.Name: monRelearnCost
Item.Desc: The amount and type of currency needed to relearn this tradeskill

Item.Name: nRelearnCooldownDays
Item.Desc: The number of days until the player can relearn this tradeskill.

Item.Name: tTalentTiers
Item.Desc: Information on each tier of talents for this tradeskill.
These tables have no name. They are indexed by sequential numbers, starting at 1.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The id number of the talent.

Item.Name: bIsActive
Item.Desc: Whether the player has activated this talent or not.

Item.Name: nId
Item.Desc: The talent tier's id.

Item.Name: nPointsNeeded
Item.Desc: The number of talent points that are needed to unlock this tier of talents.

Function.Name: GetSchematicInfo
Function.Desc: Gets information on a specific schematic.
Function.InternalNotes: A few depricated variables.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The id number of the schematic that the function will look at.

Param.Name: nMicrochipSockets
Param.Desc: The number of sockets that the function should return information for. This value defaults to 0.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table containing detailed information on the specified schematic, including information on any sub-schematics the schematic may have.

Item.Name: nSchematicId
Item.Desc: The schematic's id number.

Item.Name: eTradeskillId
Item.Desc: The id number of the tradeskill that uses the schematic.

Item.Name: eTier
Item.Desc: The tradeskill tier that the schematic belongs to.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the item created by the schematic.

Item.Name: fVectorX
Item.Desc: The x distance from the center of the coordinate crafting map that this schematic can be found. This is only useful for sub-schematics.

Item.Name: fVectorY
Item.Desc: The y distance from the center of the coordinate crafting map that this schematic can be found. This is only useful for sub-schematics.

Item.Name: fRadius
Item.Desc: The radius of the schematic on the coordinate crafting grid. This is only useful for sub-schematics.

Item.Name: fCritRadius
Item.Desc: This variable is likely depricated.

Item.Name: nParentSchematicId
Item.Desc: The id number for this schematic's parent schematic. This is only useful for sub-schematics.

Item.Name: itemOutput
Item.Desc: The item that is made if this schematic is successfully crafted.

Item.Name: achSource
Item.Desc: The achievement (read Tech Tree node) that unlocks this schematic.

Item.Name: achTier
Item.Desc: If the schematic is automatically learned, this variable contains the achievement for the tradeskill tier that the schematic belongs to.

Item.Name: nCraftXp
Item.Desc: The amount of tradeskill XP the player gains when they successfully craft this schematic.

Item.Name: nFailXp
Item.Desc: The amount of XP the player gains if their crafting attempt fails.

Item.Name: bIsKnown
Item.Desc: Whether the player already knows the schematic or not.

Item.Name: bIsOneUse
Item.Desc: Whether the schematic is a one-time use schematic or not.

Item.Name: bIsAutoCraft
Item.Desc: Whether the schematic can be automatically crafted without doing coordinate / circuit board crafting.

Item.Name: bIsAutoLearn
Item.Desc: Whether the player automatically learns the schematic upon reaching the appropriate tradeskill tier or not.

Item.Name: nCraftAtOnceMax
Item.Desc: The number of times the player can craft the schematic in one attempt. This variable is depricated.

Item.Name: tSockets
Item.Desc: Information on each of the item's microchip sockets.

Item.Name: eSocketType
Item.Desc: The type of item that can be placed in this socket.

Item.Name: nParent
Item.Desc: The socket index of this socket's parent.

Item.Name: fRatio
Item.Desc: The power/waste ratio applied to microchips in this socket.

Item.Name: itemDefaultChip
Item.Desc: The default microchip that is placed in this socket.

Item.Name: bIsChangeable
Item.Desc: Whether the microchip in this socket can be changed out for another one.

Item.Name: tMaterials
Item.Desc: Information on the materials needed to craft this schematic.

Item.Name: nAmount
Item.Desc: The number of this particular item needed to craft this schematic.

Item.Name: itemMaterial
Item.Desc: An item needed to craft this schematic.

Item.Name: nCreateCount
Item.Desc: The number of items created when the player crafts the schematic.

Item.Name: itemCritResult
Item.Desc: This variable is depricated.

Item.Name: nCritCount
Item.Desc: This variable is depricated.

Item.Name: nMaxAdditives
Item.Desc: The number of additives that can be applied to the schematic per crafting attempt.

Item.Name: tSubRecipes
Item.Desc: An array that contains info on each of the sub-schematics associated with this schematic.

Item.Name: nSchematicId
Item.Desc: The id number of the sub-schematic.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of this sub-schematic.

Item.Name: bIsKnown
Item.Desc: Whether the player has learned this sub-schematic or not.

Item.Name: fDiscoveryAngle
Item.Desc: The angle of the starting edge of a discoverable area, in degrees.

Item.Name: fDiscoveryDistanceMin
Item.Desc: The distance from the center of the coordinate crafting grid to the closest point in the discoverable area.

Item.Name: fDiscoveryDistanceMax
Item.Desc: The distance from the center of the coordinate crafting grid to the furthest point in a discoverable area.

Item.Name: bIsUndiscovered
Item.Desc: If the player has not discovered the sub-schematic, this will be true. Otherwise, it will be false.

Item.Name: fVectorX
Item.Desc: The sub-schematic's X position on the coordinate crafting grid.

Item.Name: fVectorY
Item.Desc: The sub-schematic's Y position on the coordinate crafting grid.

Item.Name: fRadius
Item.Desc: The radius of the sub schematic on the coordinate crafting grid.

Item.Name: fCritRadius
Item.Desc: This value is depricated and no longer used.

Item.Name: itemOutput
Item.Desc: The item created by the sub-schematic.

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of items created by this sub schematic.

Item.Name: itemCritResult
Item.Desc: This variable is depricated and is no longer used.

Item.Name: nCritCount
Item.Desc: This variable is depricated. It currently matches the nCount variable.

Function.Name: GetModSchematicInfo
Function.InternalNotes: Pretty sure this is depricated...
Function.Desc: Gets information on the item's schematic and microchip sockets.

Item.Name: nSchematicId
Item.Desc: The schematic's id number.

Item.Name: eTradeskillId
Item.Desc: The id number of the tradeskill that can make this schematic.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the item made by this schematic.

Item.Name: tSockets
Item.Desc: Information on each of the sockets in the schematic.

Item.Name: eType
Item.Desc: The type of microchip that can be slotted in this socket.

Item.Name: nParent
Item.Desc: The index of the socket that must be set before this one.

Item.Name: fRatio
Item.Desc: The modifier applied to the value of the microchip in this slot.

Item.Name: itemDefaultChip
Item.Desc: The microchip that was set in this slot by the game.

Item.Name: itemCurrentChip
Item.Desc: The microchip currently in this slot.

Item.Name: bIsChangeable
Item.Desc: Whether the microchip set in this slot is locked or not.

Item.Name: nThreshold
Item.Desc: The threshold value for this microchip slot.

Item.Name: itemOutput
Item.Desc: The item that will be created by this schematic.

Param.Name: itemCrafting
Param.Desc: The item that the player is trying to craft.

Function.Name: ValidateSocketItem
Function.InternalNotes: Probably depricated. We aren't using it anywhere. I also don't think this is returning anything.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The id for the schematic that the socket belongs to.

Param.Name: nSocketIdx
Param.Desc: The index of the socket that the function will validate.

Param.Name: idInventory
Param.Desc: The id number for the inventory slot that this item is in.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumTradeskill
EnumSet.Desc: A list of the different tradeskills available to the player. Augmentor, Farmer, and Fishing are not currently used.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumTradeskillTier
EnumSet.Desc: These values represent the various tradeskill tiers.

Function.Name: LearnTradeskill
Function.Desc: Grants the character the chosen tradeskill. If the character is already at the maximum number of tradeskills allowed, this function also drops a chosen tradeskill.
Function.Example: Fires the Tradeskills_Learned event when successful.

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The id of the Tradeskill that the player will learn.

Param.Name: eDroppedTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The id of the tradeskill that the player wants to drop in order to learn the new one.

ReturnValue.Desc: Returns 0 if the tradeskillId is not a valid tradeskill. Otherwise, returns 1.

Function.Name: ForgetTradeskill
Function.Desc: This function has no code and does nothing.

Function.Name: GetValidSocketItems
Function.InternalNotes: This very well may be depricated and replaced by CraftingLib.GetAvailableMicrochips
Function.Desc: Gets a list of microchips that are valid for a specific socket in a schematic.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The function will use the schematic with this id, in combination with the socket index, to get the list of valid items that can be added to the socket.

Param.Name: nSocketIdx
Param.Desc: The function will get a list of items that can be added to this socket.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains an array with every microchip in it.

Item.Name: arSkill
Item.Desc: An array that contains all the microchips available.

Function.Name: GetPreviewInfo
Function.InternalNotes: Thresholds should not be 0 based. Lots of depricated variables, but the function is not completely depricated.
Function.Desc: Gets information to draw a preview of the item that will be created by the specified schematic.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The id number for the schematic that we want to preview.

Param.Name: tMicrochips
Param.Desc: An array of item ids for each of the microchips placed in the item's sockets.

Param.Name: tThresholds
Param.Desc: An array of threshold numbers used for each socket. These numbers are currently 0 based.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains info on the finished item, if it is crafted in its current state.

Item.Name: itemPreview
Item.Desc: The item, if it was created in its current state.

Item.Name: tSockets
Item.Desc: Information on each of the item's sockets.

Item.Name: nPower
Item.Desc: The amount of power being used by this socket. This value is currently depricated.

Item.Name: nWaste
Item.Desc: The amount of waste being generated by the microchip in this socket. This value is currently depricated.

Item.Name: fMultiplier
Item.Desc: The multiplier applied to the amount of charge generated by this socket.

Item.Name: nCharge
Item.Desc: The amount of charge being used by this socket.

Item.Name: arProperties
Item.Desc: An array of properties that the item will grant the player when equipped.

Item.Name: nSortOrder
Item.Desc: Where the property should end up in a list of sorted properties.

Item.Name: eProperty
Item.Desc: The property that is referenced in this table.

Item.Name: nValue
Item.Desc: The amount of the property that the item will grant the player.

Item.Name: nDiff
Item.Desc: The difference in value between the item the player currently has equipped and the previewed item.

Item.Name: arDerived
Item.Desc: The sub-properties that the player gains from this property.

Item.Name: nSortOrder
Item.Desc: Where the property will end up in a sorted list of properties.

Item.Name: eProperty
Item.Desc: The property being referenced in this table.

Item.Name: nValue
Item.Desc: The amount of the property that the player would gain by equipping this item.

Item.Name: nDiff
Item.Desc: The difference in value between the item the player currently has equipped and the previewed item.

Item.Name: fSchematicBonus
Item.Desc: The bonus that the schematic gets from its sockets. This variable is depricated.

Function.Name: GetCurrentCraft
Function.Desc: If the player has an unfinished crafting attempt, this function will return information on that craft.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains information on the player's last crafting attempt. The variables in the table will differ based on what type of schematic the player was attempting to craft.

Item.Name: nSchematicId
Item.Desc: The id number for the schematic that the player was trying to craft.

Item.Name: nSchematicCount
Item.Desc: The number of items created ty the schematic.

Item.Name: fVectorX
Item.Desc: The X coordinate of the target marker for Coordinate Crafting. This variable is only used if the schematic that is referenced uses Coordinate Crafting.

Item.Name: fVectorY
Item.Desc: The Y coordinate of the target marker in Coordinate Crafting. This variable is only used if the schematic that is referenced uses Coordinate Crafting.

Item.Name: nSubSchematicId
Item.Desc: The id number of a sub schematic that the player has landed the target marker on. This variable is only used if the schematic that is referenced uses Coordinate Crafting.

Item.Name: nAdditiveCount
Item.Desc: The number of additives that the player has used on the schematic so far. This variable is only used if the schematic that is referenced uses Coordinate Crafting.

Item.Name: tCatalysts
Item.Desc: An array containing the catalyst items that the player has used on the schematic so far. This variable is only used if the schematic that is referenced uses Coordinate Crafting.

Item.Name: itemGlobalCatalyst
Item.Desc: The global catalyst that the player used on the schematic. This variable is only used if the schematic that is referenced uses Coordinate Crafting.

Item.Name: tMicrochips
Item.Desc: A table that contains a list of microchips that have been set in the schematic. This variable is only used if the schematic that is referenced uses Circuit Board Crafting.

Item.Name: itemChip
Item.Desc: A microchip that was set in the schematic.

Item.Name: nSlotIndex
Item.Desc: The index of the Glyph Slot that will be rerolled. This variable is only used if the the saved crafting attempt was a Glyph Slot Reroll.

Item.Name: itemSelected
Item.Desc: The item that is having its glyphs rerolled. This variable is only used if the the saved crafting attempt was a Glyph Slot Reroll.

Item.Name: arSlotTypes
Item.Desc: An array of Glyph Slot Types that the player is able to choose from when re-rolling the glyph slot. This variable is only used if the the saved crafting attempt was a Glyph Slot Reroll.

Function.Name: AddAdditive
Function.Desc: Attempts to add an additive to the current crafting attempt.
Function.Example: If the function is successful, the CraftingUpdateCurrent event will fire. Otherwise, the client will show the appropriate error message.

Param.Name: itemAdditive
Param.Desc: The additive that should be used for the current crafting session.

Function.Name: CompleteCraft
Function.InternalNotes: Thresholds should be allowed to be 1 based in Lua.
Function.Desc: Tells the client to complete the current schematic. If this is called on a non-equipment based crafting schematic, no parameters are needed.
Function.Example: This function will fire the CraftingSchematicComplete event if it is successful.

Param.Name: tMicrochips
Param.Desc: A table that contains Microchip items, indexed by the layout location they were placed in.

Item.Desc: A microchip that was used in the schematic.

Param.Name: tThresholds
Param.Desc: A table that contains the threshold counter for each socket location. These values need to be 0 based and are indexed by the socket location index.

Item.Desc: The threshold index for the specified socket. This index needs to be 0 based.

Function.Name: ShowTradeskillTutorial
Function.Desc: Starts up the tutorial for tradeskills if tutorials are not disabled and the tutorial is not flagged as "seen".
Function.Example: This will fire the ShowTutorial event if the player has not disabled tutorials and the tradeskill tutorial is not flagged as "seen". Otherwise, nothing will happen.

Function.Name: GetAchievementCategoryForTier
Function.Desc: Gets the achievement category id for the tradeskill tier's associated achievement.

Param.Name: eTradeskill
Param.Desc: The tradeskill that the function will use to find the achievement category.

Param.Name: eTier
Param.Desc: The tier that the function will return the achievement category id for.

ReturnValue.Desc: The id number for the achievement category that the tradeskill tier belongs to.

Function.Name: GetTierForAchievementCategory
Function.Desc: Gets the tradeskill tier that matches the achievement category that is passed in.

Param.Name: idCategory
Param.Desc: The id for the achievement category that the function will match to a tradeskill tier.

ReturnValue.Desc: The tier that corresponds with the achievement category that was passed in.

Function.Name: GetSchematicCraftableCount
Function.Desc: Gets the number of times a specified schematic can be crafted based on the items in the player's inventory, supply satchel, and bank.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The id number of the schematic.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of times the schematic can be created based on the items in the player's inventory, supply satchel, and bank.

Function.Name: IsAtCraftingStation
Function.Desc: Checks if the player is within range of a crafting station.

ReturnValue.Desc: Determines whether the player is within range of a crafting station or not.

Function.Name: GetTradeskillTalents
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all the talents for a particular tradeskill.
Function.Example:
If bDebugPrint is set to true, each talent tier for the tradeskill will be listed in chat in sequential order. The format for each line is: <Number of points needed to reach this talent tier>: <ID numbers for each talent in this tier>
Numbers with a * next to it are tiers that the player has reached, or talents that they have selected, depending on what type of number it is next to.

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The function will get the talents for the tradeskill with this ID.

Param.Name: bDebugPrint
Param.Desc: If this is set to true, then the player will see debug information in their chat log.

ReturnValue.Desc: Information on each of the talent tiers for the tradeskill that was passed in to this function.

Item.Name: nPointsRequired
Item.Desc: The number of points required to reach this talent tier.

Item.Name: tTalents
Item.Desc: Information on each talent in this tier.

Item.Name: nTalentId
Item.Desc: The id number for the talent.

Item.Name: bActive
Item.Desc: Whether the player has activated this talent or not.

Item.Name: strIcon
Item.Desc: The name of the icon that should be displayed for the talent.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The talent's name.

Item.Name: strTooltip
Item.Desc: The tooltip that should be displayed for the talent.

Function.Name: PickTradeskillTalent
Function.Desc: Attempts to activate the specified talent.
Function.Example:
If the talent is successfully activated, the TalentsChanged event will fire.
Note: Only one talent can be selected per tier. If one is already selected in this tier,

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The id of the tradeskill that the talent belongs to.

Param.Name: nTalentTier
Param.Desc: The talent tier that the talent belongs to.

Param.Name: idTalent
Param.Desc: The id number for the talent that was chosen.

Function.Name: ResetTradeskillTalents
Function.Desc: Attempts to reset the talents that are set for the specified tradeskill.
Function.Example: No event is fired if this function is successful. Instead, CraftingLib.GetTradeskillTalents should return a talent list where no talents are set.

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The function will attempt to reset the talents of the tradeskill with this id.

Function.Name: GetTradeskillTierXp
Function.Desc: Gets the amount of XP required to reach a specific tradeskill tier.

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The id number of the Tradeskill that this function query.

Param.Name: eTradeskillTier
Param.Desc: The function will return the XP amount required to reach this tier.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of XP required to reach the tradeskill / tier combination that was passed into the function.

Function.Name: GetTradeskillTalentRespecCost
Function.Desc: Gets the amount and type of currency needed to reset the tradeskill's talents.

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The function will check the talent respec cost for this tradeskill.

ReturnValue.Desc: The type and amount of currency needed to reset the tradeskill's talents.

Function.Name: GetAvailableAdditives
Function.Desc: Gets a list of the additives that are available for the specified schematic.

Param.Name: eTradeskill
Param.Desc: The tradeskill that the schematic belongs to.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The function will get the additives that can be used with the schematic with this id.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of the different additives that can be used with the schematic.

Function.Name: GetAvailableCatalysts
Function.Desc: Gets a list of the catalysts that are in the player's inventory and can be used with the specified schematic.

Param.Name: eTradeskill
Param.Desc: The tradeskill that the schematic belongs to.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The function will get a list of the catalysts that can be used with the schematic with this id.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array that contains both the catalyst items that can be used with the schematic and the number that the player has in their inventory.

Item.Name: nCount
Item.Desc: The number of this catalyst that is in the player's inventory.

Item.Name: itemCatalyst
Item.Desc: The catalyst that is in the player's inventory.

Function.Name: GetRelearnCooldown
Function.InternalNotes: May be depricated.
Function.Desc: Gets the amount of time (in milliseconds) before the player can swap their tradeskills.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of time (in milliseconds) before the player can swap their tradeskills again.

Function.Name: GetRelearnCost
Function.Desc: The amount of currency the player will have to spend to swap one of their tradeskills with another.

Param.Name: eTradeskillId
Param.Desc: The id of the tradeskill that the player wants to learn.

ReturnValue.Desc: The price to swap tradeskills.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumCraftingDiscoveryHotCold
EnumSet.Desc: A set of enums representing how close a player was to discovering a schematic while performing non-equipment based tradeskills.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumTradeskillResult
EnumSet.Desc: A list of possible outcomes for several tradeskill actions.

Function.Name: AddRuneSlot
Function.InternalNotes: Need to figure out what event is fired if this is successful.
Function.Desc: Attempts to add a rune slot to an item.

Param.Name: nNewSlotCount
Param.Desc: The number of rune slots on the item after adding a new one.

Function.Name: GetItemsWithRuneSlots
Function.Desc: Gets a list of each item with rune slots that the player owns.
Function.Remarks: If neither variable that is passed in is set to true, the list of items will be empty.

Param.Name: bIncludeEquipped
Param.Desc: Whether items that the player has equipped should be included in the list or not.

Param.Name: bIncludeBags
Param.Desc: Whether items that are in the player's bags should be included in the list or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of items that have rune slots and are in the specified locations.

Function.Name: GetAvailableProperties
Function.Desc: Gets a list of properties that the player can set microchips for on the schematic.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The function will return the properties that are available for the schematic with the specified id.

Param.Name: idPowerCore
Param.Desc: The item id for the power core that is set for the schematic. This defaults to 0 if this value is not passed in.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table of property ids that can be set for the specified schematic.

Function.Name: GetAvailableMicrochips
Function.Desc: Gets a list of the microchips that can be used with the specified schematic.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The schematic that the function will poll for the microchips that can be used.

Param.Name: eUnitProperty
Param.Desc: The microchips that are returned all share this property.

Param.Name: nOffset
Param.Desc: The starting index of the returned table.

Param.Name: nCount
Param.Desc: The number of entries in the table that is returned by the function. This value defaults to 1 if none is passed in.

Param.Name: nPowerCoreId
Param.Desc: The item id of the power core that is slotted for the recipe. This will affect the microchips that are returned. If no value is passed in, it defaults to 0.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains a list of microchips that are available for the schematic.

Function.Name: GetAvailablePowerCores
Function.Desc: Gets a list of power cores that can be used with the specified schematic.

Param.Name: idSchematic
Param.Desc: The function will return a list of power cores that are compatable with the schematic with this id.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains the item information for power cores that can be used for the specified schematic.

Function.Name: GetPropertyChipType
Function.InternalNotes: This doesn't appear to be called anywhere in our addons. Probably depricated.

Function.Name: ClearRuneSlot
Function.InternalNotes: Need to figure out what event is fired as a response.
Function.Desc: Attempts to remove the rune in the specified rune slot.

Param.Name: nSlotIdx
Param.Desc: The index of the rune slot that the function will attempt to clear.

Function.Name: GetCurrentOverchargeInfo
Function.Desc: Gets information on the current overcharge and various overcharge limits of the current Circuit Board schematic.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains information on all things overcharge related to the current schematic.

Item.Name: arMultipliers
Item.Desc: The property multipliers used for each microchip where the player matched the color of the chip with the slot.

Item.Name: fOverchargeCompleteSuccess
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of overcharge where the chance of success is 100%.

Item.Name: fOverchargeCompleteFailure
Item.Desc: The amount of overcharge where the chance to fail will reach 100%.

Item.Name: fCraftingOvercharge
Item.Desc: The current amount of overcharge for the schematic.

Item.Name: fOverchargeAllowable
Item.Desc: The maximum amount of overcharge that is allowed for the schematic.

Item.Name: fCraftingFailChance
Item.Desc: The chance that the crafting attempt will fail with the current amount of overcharge.

Item.Name: fFailureAtAllowable
Item.Desc: The failure chance when the maximum amount of overcharge is set for the schematic.

Param.Name: arMicrochipIds
Param.Desc: An array that contains the item ids of each microchip set in the schematic.

Param.Name: arThresholds
Param.Desc: An array that contains the thresholds used for each microchip slot.

Function.Name: GetEngravingInfo
Function.Desc: Gets information on adding, clearing, rerolling, and unlocking Rune Slots in an item.

Param.Name: itemSource
Param.Desc: The item that the function will query for information on its Rune Slots.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains information on the requirements to modify an item's Rune Slots.

Item.Name: tAddInfo
Item.Desc: Information on adding Rune Slots to the item.

Item.Name: itemReagent
Item.Desc: The reagent required to add a Rune Slot to the item.

Item.Name: nReagentCount
Item.Desc: The number of the reagent that the player has in their inventory and bank.

Item.Name: nMaximumSigils
Item.Desc: The maximum number of Rune Slots the item can have.

Item.Name: tCost
Item.Desc: The cost of adding a Rune Slot.

Item.Name: nReagents
Item.Desc: The number of reagents required for this item.

Item.Name: monCost
Item.Desc: The amount and type of currency required for this item.

Item.Name: nSuccessChance
Item.Desc: The percentage chance that the Rune Slot will be added to the item.

Item.Name: tClearInfo
Item.Desc: Information on clearing a Rune from a Rune Slot.

Item.Name: itemReagent
Item.Desc: The item needed to clear the Rune Slot.

Item.Name: nReagentCount
Item.Desc: The number of reagents that the player has in their inventory and bank.

Item.Name: arCosts
Item.Desc: An array that contains the cost to clear each of the item's Rune Slots.

Item.Name: nReagents
Item.Desc: The number of reagents required to clear the Rune Slot.

Item.Name: monCost
Item.Desc: The amount and type of currency needed to clear the Rune Slot.

Item.Name: tRerollInfo
Item.Desc: Information on rerolling a Rune Slot on the item.

Item.Name: itemReagent
Item.Desc: The reagent required to reroll the Rune Slot.

Item.Name: nReagentCount
Item.Desc: The number of reagents the player has in their inventory and bank.

Item.Name: arCosts
Item.Desc: The cost to reroll each Rune Slot on the item.

Item.Name: nReagents
Item.Desc: The number of reagents required to reroll the Rune Slot.

Item.Name: monCost
Item.Desc: The amount and type of currency required to reroll the Rune Slot.

Item.Name: nSuccessChance
Item.Desc: The percentage chance that the reroll attempt will succeed.

Item.Name: tUnlockInfo
Item.Desc: Information on unlocking the item's Rune Slots.

Item.Name: tCost
Item.Desc: The cost to unlock Rune Slots on this item.

Item.Name: monCost
Item.Desc: The amount and type of currency required to unlock a Rune Slot.

Item.Name: nSuccessChance
Item.Desc: The percentage chance that the unlock attempt will be successful.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumCraftingDirection
EnumSet.Desc: A list of directions used when performing non-equipment based tradeskills.

Function.Name: RerollRuneSlot
Function.Desc: Attempts to change a rune slot to a different type.
Function.Example: If this function is successful, the ItemModified event will fire.

Param.Name: itemSource
Param.Desc: The item that contains the rune slot that the function will attempt to reroll.

Param.Name: nSlotIdx
Param.Desc: The index of the rune slot that the function will attempt to reroll.

Function.Name: GetValidRuneItems
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all of the valid runes for a specific rune slot. This list filters based on slot type and removes duplicate runes.

Param.Name: itemSelected
Param.Desc: The function will return the valid runes for this item.

Param.Name: nSlot
Param.Desc: The function will return all of the valid runes for the rune slot at this index.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of runes that can be set to the specified rune slot.

Function.Name: UnlockRuneSlot
Function.Desc: Attempts to unlock a rune slot on an item.
Function.Example: Fires the ItemModified event if the slot is successfully unlocked.

Param.Name: itemSource
Param.Desc: The function will attempt to unlock a rune slot that belongs to this item.

Param.Name: nSlotIdx
Param.Desc: The index of the rune slot that the function will attempt to unlock.

Function.Name: InstallRuneIntoSlot
Function.Desc: Attempts to update the runes that should be installed on an item.
Function.Example: If the operation is successful, the ItemModified event should fire.

Param.Name: itemSource
Param.Desc: The item that the rune will be installed in.

Param.Name: tInstalledRunes
Param.Desc: An array of item ids for runes that should be installed on the item after the operation is complete.

Library.Name: CSIsLib
Library.Desc: Allows the UI to interact with Client Side Interaction minigames, such as patern matching and timed clicking.

Function.Name: GetActiveCSI
Function.Desc: Gets a table containing information on the active CSI. Returns nil if there is no active CSI.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table containing information on the current Client Side Interaction.

Item.Name: eType
Item.Desc: The type of CSI that is active.

Item.Name: strContext
Item.Desc: A string containing the text that should be displayed for the current CSI.

Item.Name: nThreshold
Item.Desc: The number of misses allowed for this CSI before the user fails. This variable only exists for Metronome CSIs.

Function.Name: StartActiveCSI
Function.Desc: Starts the currently active CSI.

Function.Name: CancelActiveCSI
Function.Desc: Stops the current Client Side Interaction

Function.Name: IsCSIRunning
Function.Desc: Determines if the active CSI has been started.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the active CSI is running or not.

Function.Name: CSIProcessInteraction
Function.Desc: Processes the user's input for the Client Side Interaction. Different types of Client Side Interactions behave differently
Function.Example:
Functionality per CSI type: Precision: Button Down: Informs the CSI of a button click. Button Up: Nothing
Metronome: Button Down: Informs the CSI of a button click ButtonUp: Nothing
Rapid Tap: Button Down: Starts the CSI if it wasn't already running. Informs the CSI of a button click. Button Up: Nothing
Press and Hold: Button Down: Starts the CSI if it wasn't already running. Tells the CSI that the button is being held. Button Up: Tells the CSI that the button isn't being held.
Yes/No: ButtonDown: Treats the CSI as if the player clicked "Yes" ButtonUp: Treats the CSI as if the player clicked "No"

Function.Name: GetTimeRemainingForActiveCSI
Function.Desc: Gets the time remaining before the user fails the current CSI.

EnumSet.Name: ClientSideInteractionType
EnumSet.Desc: An enumeration identifying the different types of Client Side Interactions

Library.Name: DatacubeLib
Library.Desc: A library that allows the player to interact with and get information on Datacubes, Journals, and Tales from Beyond the Fringe entries

Function.Name: IsDatacubeComplete
Function.Desc: Determines if an entry is complete. This generally means whether the player has found all of the unlocks / sub-entries for the specified entry.

Param.Name: idDatacube
Param.Desc: The id for the entry that the function will check.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player has interacted with each of the entry's unlocks / sub-entries or not.

Function.Name: GetVolumes
Function.Desc: Gets a info on each journal entry that the player has unlocked at least one entry for.

ReturnValue.Desc: Information on each journal entry that the player has unlocked at least one entry for.

Item.Name: nDatacubeId
Item.Desc: The journal's id number.

Item.Name: strTitle
Item.Desc: The journal's title.

Item.Name: strAsset
Item.Desc: The name of the asset associated with this journal entry.

Item.Name: bIsComplete
Item.Desc: Whether the player has unlocked all of the journal's sub-entries or not.

Item.Name: nNumCompleted
Item.Desc: The number of the journal's sub-entries that the player has unlocked.

Item.Name: nNumTotal
Item.Desc: The number of sub-entries that the player needs to unlock to complete the journal.

Function.Name: GetLastUpdatedDatacube
Function.Desc: Gets the information for the last datacube entry that was updated for the player.

ReturnValue.Desc: Information on the player's most recently updated datacube entry.

Item.Name: nDatacubeId
Item.Desc: The entry's id number.

Item.Name: eDatacubeType
Item.Desc: The type of entry. This value corresponds with the DatacubeLib.DatacubeType set of constants.

Item.Name: nWorldZoneId
Item.Desc: The id of the zone that this entry is associated with.

Item.Name: strZoneName
Item.Desc: The name of the zone that this journal is associated with.

Item.Name: nVolumeId
Item.Desc: The id of the journal that this entry belongs to, if any.

Item.Name: strText
Item.Desc: The entry's text.

Item.Name: bIsComplete
Item.Desc: Whether the entry has been unlocked or not.

Item.Name: bHasSound
Item.Desc: Whether the entry has a sound associated with it or not.

Item.Name: strTitle
Item.Desc: The entry's title.

Item.Name: nNumCompleted
Item.Desc: The number of unlocks the player has found for this entry. This variable only applies to Chronicle type entries.

Item.Name: nNumTotal
Item.Desc: The total number of unlocks needed to finish the entry. This variable only applies to Chronicle type entries.

Item.Name: strAsset
Item.Desc: The sprite used for the entry when it is completed. This variable only applies to Chronicle type entries.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of tables that contain information on each datacube entry in the specified zone.

Item.Name: nWorldZoneId

Item.Name: strText
Item.Desc: The datacube entry's text.

Item.Name: bIsComplete
Item.Desc: Whether the entry is completed or not.

Item.Name: bHasSound

Item.Name: strTitle

Item.Name: nNumTotal
Item.Desc: The number of unlocks required to complete the entry. This only exist for Chronicle type entries.

Item.Name: strAsset
