Function.Name: GetTalesForZone
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all of the Tales entries that the player has made progress on within a specific zone.

Param.Name: idZone
Param.Desc: The function will get a list of Tales that are associated with the zone with this id.

ReturnValue.Desc: Information on each of the Tales entries that the player has unlocked at least one entry for in the specified zone.

Item.Name: nDatacubeId
Item.Desc: The entry's id number.

Item.Name: eDatacubeType
Item.Desc: The entry's type. This value should always be DatacubeLib.DatacubeType_Chronicle for this entry.

Item.Name: nWorldZoneId
Item.Desc: The id of the zone that is associated with this entry.

Item.Name: strZoneName
Item.Desc: The name of the zone that the entry is associated with.

Item.Name: nVolumeId
Item.Desc: The id of the journal entry that serves as this entry's parent. This value should always be 0 for this entry.

Item.Name: strText
Item.Desc: The entry's text.

Item.Name: bIsComplete
Item.Desc: Whether the player has interacted with all of the unlocks for this entry or not.

Item.Name: bHasSound
Item.Desc: Whether the entry has a sound associated with it or not.

Item.Name: strTitle
Item.Desc: The entry's title.

Item.Name: nNumCompleted
Item.Desc: The number of this entry's unlocks that the player has activated.

Item.Name: nNumTotal
Item.Desc: The number of unlocks needed to complete this Tales entry.

Item.Name: strAsset
Item.Desc: The sprite that should be shown when this entry is complete.

Function.Name: GetTales
Function.Desc: Gets information on all the Tales from Beyond the Fringe entries that the player has unlocked at least one part of.

ReturnValue.Desc: Information on each Tales entry that the player has made progress on.

Item.Name: nDatacubeId
Item.Desc: The id number for the entry.

Item.Name: eDatacubeType
Item.Desc: The entry's type. This should be DatacubeLib.DatacubeType_Chronicle for every entry returned by this function.

Item.Name: nWorldZoneId
Item.Desc: The id of the zone that the entry is associated with.

Item.Name: strZoneName
Item.Desc: The name of the zone that the entry is associated with.

Item.Name: nVolumeId
Item.Desc: The id of the entry's parent journal entry. This value will be 0 if it has none.

Item.Name: strText
Item.Desc: The entry's text.

Item.Name: bIsComplete
Item.Desc: Whether the player has found all of the unlocks for this Tales entry or not.

Item.Name: bHasSound
Item.Desc: Whether the entry has sound or not.

Item.Name: nNumCompleted
Item.Desc: The number of unlocks the player has found for this entry.

Item.Name: nNumTotal
Item.Desc: The number of unlocks needed to complete this entry.

Item.Name: strAsset
Item.Desc: The sprite displayed when the entry is completed.

Function.Name: GetZonesWithJournals
Function.Desc: Gets a list of each zone that has a journal entry associated with it.

ReturnValue.Desc: The id number and name of each zone that has a journal entry associated with it.

Item.Name: nZoneId
Item.Desc: The zone's id number.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The zone's name.

Function.Name: GetZonesWithTales
Function.Desc: Gets a list of each zone with a Tales entry associated with it.

ReturnValue.Desc: A list with the id and name of each zone that has a Tales entry associated with it.

Item.Name: nZoneId
Item.Desc: The zone's id.

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The zone's name.

Function.Name: GetTotalDatacubesForZone
Function.Desc: Gets the number of entries within a zone that have the Datacube type.

Param.Name: idZone
Param.Desc: The function will get the number of Datacube entries in the zone with this id.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of datacube entries in the specified zone.

Function.Name: GetTotalJournalsForZone
Function.Desc: Gets the number of journal entries within a specific zone.

Param.Name: idZone
Param.Desc: The function will get the number of journal entries in the zone with this id.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of journal entries found in the specified zone.

Function.Name: GetTotalTalesForZone
Function.Desc: Gets the number of Tales entries in a specific zone.

Param.Name: idZone
Param.Desc: The function will get the number of Tales in the zone with this id.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of Tales entries in the specified zone.

Object.Name: CharacterTitle
Object.Desc: These are the titles that the character can set for themselves. These do not include guild tags.

Method.Name: GetCategory
Method.Desc: Gets the category that the CharacterTitle falls under.

ReturnValue.Desc: The CharacterTitle's category.

Method.Name: GetForUnit
Method.Desc: Checks what a unit's name would look like with the CharacterTitle.
Method.Example: If no unit is passed in, this will return a blank string.

Param.Name: unitChecked
Param.Desc: The function will add the CharacterTitle to this unit's name.

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit's name, if the CharacterTitle was applyed to it.

Method.Name: GetSpell
Method.Desc: Gets the spell that is granted to the player while the title is active.
Method.Example: If there is no associated spell, this will return nil.

ReturnValue.Desc: The spell that is granted to the player while the title is active.

Method.Name: GetLifetime
Method.InternalNotes: Why is this in milliseconds? Is this a thing?
Method.Desc: Gets the amount of time, in milliseconds, that the title will be active before it is removed from the player.
Method.Example: If this returns 0, the title will remain available to the player indefinitely.

ReturnValue.Desc: How long the title will remain active, in milliseconds.

Method.Name: CannotRemove
Method.InternalNotes: There are currently no non-testing titles with this flag. Is it still something that can be set?
Method.Desc: Determines whether the player is able to remove this CharacterTitle.
Method.Remarks: This will very very rarely be true.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player is able to remove this CharacterTitle or not

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Determines whether a variable is a CharacterTitle or not.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that the function will check.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable is a CharacterTitle or not.

Function.Name: GetAvailableTitles
Function.Desc: Gets a list of all of the titles that the player has unlocked.
Function.InternalNotes: Not using LuaTables in code.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of all of the titles that the player has unlocked.

Function.Name: SetTitle
Function.Desc: Sends a request to the server to make a CharacterTitle the active title.
Function.Example: If this is successful, the PlayerTitleChange event will be sent to the player.

Param.Name: titleActivated
Param.Desc: The title that the function will make active.

Function.Name: CanUseTitle
Function.Desc: Determines whether or not the player can use the specified title.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player can use the title or not.

Function.Name: IsActiveTitle
Function.Desc: Checks whether the a title is the one that the player has set as the active title.

Param.Name: titleChecked
Param.Desc: The function will check if this title is currently active.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the CharacterTitle is the active title.

Method.Name: GetTitle
Method.Desc: Gets the string that is added to the player's name while the title is active.

ReturnValue.Desc: The string that is added to the player's name when the title is active.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Compares a CharacterTitle to the one that called this function to make sure that they are equal.

Param.Name: titleComparison
Param.Desc: The function will compare this CharacterTitle to the one that the function was called from.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the CharacterTitles were the same or not.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: CharacterTitle's garbage collection function. This will delete the CharacterTitle from memory.

Method.Name: RequestScoreboard
Method.Desc: Toggles whether the PublicEventLiveStatsUpdate event will fire for this public event.
Method.Remarks: This is primarily done to throttle how often we should call the GetLiveStats event.

Param.Name: bRegister
Param.Desc: Registers or unregisters the public event for the PublicEventLiveStatsUpdate event.

Object.Name: ApolloCursor
Object.Desc: ApolloCursors are the sprites that are used on the cursor in different situations.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Determines if the variable is an ApolloCursor.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that the function will check.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable is an ApolloCursor or not.

Function.Name: new
Function.Desc: Creates a new ApolloCursor with no cursor set.

ReturnValue.Desc: A fresh, empty ApolloCursor.

Function.Name: GetCursor
Function.Desc: Returns the ApolloCursor with the specified name.
Function.Example:
ApolloCursors that are returned from this function can be passed into Apollo.SetCursor() to change the window cursor.
function Example:ForceChangeCursor() local unitHover = GetMouseOverUnit() local unitPlayer = GameLib.GetPlayerUnit() local acForcedCursor = nil if unitPlayer and unitHover then local eDisposition = unitPlayer:GetDispositionTo(unitHover) if unitPlayer:GetClassId() == GameLib.CodeEnumClass.Warrior and eDisposition == Unit.CodeEnumDisposition.Hostile or eDisposition == Unit.CodeEnumDisposition.Neutral then acForcedCursor = ApolloCursor.GetCursor(AttackWarrior) else acForcedCursor = ApolloCursor.GetCursor(Attack) end end
if acForcedCursor then Apollo.SetCursor(acForcedCursor) end end
Function.Remarks: The values that can be passed in for this are: Attack AttackWarrior AttackSpellslinger Attack ESPer (this is not a typo) AttackMedic Default DefaultGame DefaultResizeNS DefaultResizeEW DefaultResizeNESW DefaultResizeNWSE DragDropIgnore DragDropValid DragDropInvalid DragDropTrash DragDropTrade Feather FeatherInactive Gossip GossipInactive Hammer HammerInactive Instance InstanceInactive Interact InteractInactive Link Loot LootInactive NewQuest NewQuestInactive PathExplorer PathExplorerInactive PathScientist PathScientistInactive PathSettler PathSettlerInactive PathSoldier PathSoldierInactive PendingSpell PendingSpellInvalid QuestContinue QuestContinueInactive QuestReward QuestRewardInactive Recall RecallInactive Vendor VendorInactive

Param.Name: strCursorName
Param.Desc: The name of the cursor that should be returned.

ReturnValue.Desc: The cursor that was requested. If no cursor was found, this returns nil.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.InternalNotes: Is there ever a reason to explicitly call this?
Method.Desc: The ApolloCursor's garbage collection function. This will delete the ApolloCursor and free up the memory used for it.

Object.Name: CColor
Object.Desc: CColors are an older way of using colors in addons. All colors are in ARGB format, with all values being between 0.0 and 1.0. While this functionality is not yet depricated, it may be in the future. We highly recommend that developers use ApolloColors instead.

Method.Name: Saturate
Method.Desc: Locks the values in the color to values between 0.0 and 1.0.

ReturnValue.Desc: A new color that has been bound to values between 0.0 and 1.0.

Method.Name: Complement
Method.Desc: Creates a new CColor that is complementary to the one that calls this function.
Method.Remarks: The values of the CColor that is returned are all 1.0 - value.

ReturnValue.Desc: A color that complements the one that called the function.

Function.Name: new
Function.Desc: Creates a new CColor using the specified values.

Param.Name: r
Param.Desc: The red value of the color.

Param.Name: g
Param.Desc: The green value of the color.

Param.Name: b
Param.Desc: The blue value of the color.

Param.Name: a
Param.Desc: The alpha value of the color. This value defaults to 1.0 if no alpha value is passed in.

ReturnValue.Desc: A CColor with the rgba values that were passed in.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Detects whether a variable is a CColor or not.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that the function will check.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable is a CColor or not.

Function.Name: Complement
Function.Desc: Returns a CColor that complements the color that is passed in.
Function.Remarks: The values of the CColor that is returned are all 1.0 - value.

Param.Name: ccBaseColor
Param.Desc: The color that the complement is made from.

ReturnValue.Desc: A color that complements the one that was passed in.

Method.Name: __unm
Method.Desc: Multiplies each of the CColor's color values by -1.

ReturnValue.Desc: The new CColor created by the function.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Checks if a CColor matches this CColor.

Param.Name: ccCompare
Param.Desc: The CColor that is being compared to the one that called the function.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the two CColors matched or not.

Method.Name: __tostring
Method.Desc: Converts a CColor to a string with the CColor's values

ReturnValue.Desc: A string with the CColor's values. The string's format is "CColor(alpha,red,green,blue)

Method.Name: __add
Method.Desc: Adds another CColor's values to the CColor that called this function.

Param.Name: ccModifier
Param.Desc: The CColor that the current CColor will be modified by.

ReturnValue.Desc: The sum of the two CColors.

Method.Name: __div
Method.Desc: Scales each value in the CColor by the given amount.

Param.Name: fScale
Param.Desc: The amount that each value in the CColor will be scaled by.

ReturnValue.Desc: The modified CColor.

Method.Name: __mul
Method.Desc: Scales the values in the CColor by the value passed in.

Param.Name: fScale
Param.Desc: The amount that each value in the CColor will be scaled by. Only a float or CColor needs to be passed in.

Param.Name: ccMultiplier
Param.Desc: The CColor that the source color is multiplied by. Each value is multiplied by the corresponding value, so red x red, blue x blue, etc. Only a float or CColor should be passed in to the function, not both.

ReturnValue.Desc: The result of multiplying the original CColor with the value that was passed in.

Method.Name: __sub
Method.Desc: Subtracts a CColor's values from the CColor that called the function.

Param.Name: ccSubtractor
Param.Desc: The color values of the CColor that called the function are subtracted by this CColor's color values.

ReturnValue.Desc: The CColor made up of the difference of the two CColors.

Method.Name: __index
Method.Desc: Gets the CColor's value for one of its primary colors or alpha.

Param.Name: strIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the value that the function will return. This can be: "r" = red value "b" = blue value "g" = green value "a" = alpha value

Method.Name: __newindex
Method.Desc: Sets one of the CColor's color values.

Param.Name: strIndex
Param.Desc: The color value that the function will update. "r" = red "g" = green "b" = blue "a" = alpha

Param.Name: fValue
Param.Desc: The color's new value.

ReturnValue.Desc: An error string is sent if an invalid index is used. Otherwise, this function has no return value.

Object.Name: AaRect
Object.InternalNotes: No clue what these are. We don't seem to be using these anywhere.

Function.Name: New
Function.Desc: Creates a new AaRect
Function.InternalNotes: Does this really exist?

Function.Name: Is
Function.Desc: Checks if the given variable is an AARect.

Function.Name: Empty
Function.InternalNotes: Unsure if this class has any use.
Function.Desc: Returns an empty AARect.

Object.Name: EulerAngles
Object.InternalNotes: Gonna skip this one until I understand them better...we aren't really using them yet anyways.

Object.Name: Challenges
Object.Desc: Challenges are timed goals that the player will unlock as they kill NPCs and explore Nexus. Most challenges are repeatable and offer rewards, such as crafting materials, decor, and equipment.

Method.Name: GetId
Method.Desc: Returns the id number of the challenge

ReturnValue.Desc: The Challenge's id number.

Method.Name: GetType
Method.InternalNotes: ChallengeLib.ChallengeType needs to be turned into an enum.
Method.Desc: Gets a challenge's type.
Method.Remarks: Only one challenge of each type can be active at a given time.

ReturnValue.Desc: The challenge's type. This corresponds with the ChallengeLib.ChallengeType set of int constants.

Method.Name: GetCurrentCount
Method.Desc: Gets the player's progress towards this Challenge.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of progress the player has made towards the current challenge.

Method.Name: GetTotalCount
Method.Desc: Gets the total amount of progress the player has to earn to complete the current tier of the challenge.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of progress needed to complete the current challenge tier. This value is 100 for percentage based progress, or a smaller number for challenges that require a fixed amount of progress.

Method.Name: GetCurrentTier
Method.Desc: Gets the tier of this Challenge that the player is working towards.

ReturnValue.Desc: The challege tier that the player is working towards.

Method.Name: GetCompletionCount
Method.Desc: Gets the number of times the player has completed the challenge.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of times the player has completed the challenge.

Method.Name: GetCompletionTotal
Method.Desc: Gets the number of times this Challenge can be completed.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of times the player can complete the challenge. If this value is -1, then the challenge can be completed an infinate number of times.

Method.Name: GetLastRewardTier
Method.Desc: Returns the last tier of the Challenge that the player completed during the current attempt.

ReturnValue.Desc: The last tier that was completed of the challenge during the current attempt.

Method.Name: IsTimeTiered
Method.Desc: Determines whether the reward tiers are based on the player's completion time or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the reward tiers are based on the player's completion time or not.

Method.Name: IsActivated
Method.Desc: Finds out whether the challenge is currently running or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the challenge is currently running or not.

Method.Name: IsInCooldown
Method.Desc: Determines whether the challenge is currently on cooldown.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the challenge is on cooldown or not.

Method.Name: ShouldCollectReward
Method.Desc: Determines if the player has not collected their reward for the challenge.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player has an uncollected reward or not.

Method.Name: IsFullyComplete
Method.Desc: Determines if the challenge has been completed the maximum number of times or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the challenge has been completed the maximum number of times or not.

Method.Name: GetName
Method.Desc: Gets the challenge's name.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the challenge.

Method.Name: GetDescription
Method.Desc: Gets the text that describes the challenge.

ReturnValue.Desc: The Challenge's description.

Method.Name: GetZoneInfo
Method.Desc: Gets information on the zone where the challenge is found.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table with information on where the challenge is located.

Item.Name: idZone
Item.Desc: The id number of the zone where the challenge can be found.

Item.Name: strZoneName
Item.Desc: The name of the zone where the challenge is located.

Method.Name: GetZoneRestrictionInfo
Method.Desc: Gets information on the area that the challenge is restricted to.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table with information on the area that the challenge is restricted to.

Item.Name: idSubZone
Item.Desc: The id number of the subzone that the challenge is restricted to.

Item.Name: strLocationName
Item.Desc: The name of the area that the challenge is restricted to.

Item.Name: strSubZoneName
Item.Desc: The name of the subzone that the challenge is restricted to.

Method.Name: GetTimeStr
Method.Desc: Gets the challenge's current timer and returns it in string form.
Method.Example: This timer is context sensitive. If the challenge is active, it shows the amount of time the player has to complete it. If the player has left the challenge area, it shows the amount of time before the player fails the challenge because they left the area. If the challenge is on cooldown, it returns the amount of time until it is no longer on cooldown.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of time left on the timer, in "minute:second" format.

Method.Name: GetAllTierCounts
Method.Desc: Returns the goal number for each tier of the Challenge

ReturnValue.Desc: An array that contains the amount of progress that the player must reach for each of the Challenge's tiers.

Item.Name: nGoalCount
Item.Desc: The amount of progression required for the challenge. If the challenge is percentage based, this value is 100. Otherwise, it is an exact number of objectives that the player must reach.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Determines if the variable is a Challenge or not.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that the function will check.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable is a Challenge or not.

Method.Name: NeedsHintArrow
Method.Desc: Determines whether the challenge has a set starting area or zone restrictions.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the challenge needs to have a hint arrow or not.

Method.Name: GetMapStartLocation
Method.Desc: Gets the coordinates where the Challenge can be started

ReturnValue.Desc: The coordinates where the challenge can be started.

Item.Name: x
Item.Desc: The X coordinate

Item.Name: y
Item.Desc: The Y coordinate

Item.Name: z
Item.Desc: The Z coordinate

Method.Name: GetMapStartRegions
Method.Desc: Returns the coordinates for the hexes where the Challenge takes place

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of hex coordinates where the objectives for the challenge can be found.

Method.Name: GetMapLocation
Method.Desc: The location that the hint arrow points the player towards for the challenge.

ReturnValue.Desc: The X, Y, and Z coordinates that the hint arrow leads the player to.

Item.Name: x
Item.Desc: The X coordinate

Item.Name: y
Item.Desc: The Y coordinate

Item.Name: z
Item.Desc: The Z coordinate

Method.Name: GetMapRegions
Method.Desc: Gets the point that the helper arrow leads to and a list of all of the hexes that the challenge uses.

ReturnValue.Desc: A list that contains map info on the challenge.

Item.Name: tHexes
Item.Desc: A list of x/y coordinates for the hexes where the Challenge takes place

Item.Name: tIndicator
Item.Desc: The x/y/z coordinates where the Challenge can be started

Method.Name: GetDisplayTier
Method.Desc: Returns the current tier for the Challenge that the UI should display as active.

ReturnValue.Desc: The tier that the UI should display as active.

Method.Name: GetStartLocationRestrictionId
Method.InternalNotes: This is a terrible and probably inaccurate description. We need to find out what this is.
Method.Desc: Gets the id number for the challenge's start location.

ReturnValue.Desc: The id number of the challenge's start location.

Method.Name: ShouldDisplayPercentProgress
Method.Desc: Determines whether the challenge displays its progress as a percent or as an exact number.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player's progress should be shown as a percent or not.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.InternalNotes: Unsure if this is used or not. Could not find any functionality for it.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: Challenge's garbage collection function. This will delete the Challenge from memory.

Library.Name: ActionSetLib
Library.Desc: This library contains functions for validating and saving the player's Limited Action Set.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumLimitedActionSetResult
EnumSet.Desc: The possible results that the UI can receive when trying to save an Action Set or AMP loadout.

Function.Name: IsSlotUnlocked
Function.Desc: Determines if the specified slot is unlocked for the player.

Param.Name: nSlotIdx
Param.Desc: The slot number that the function should check.

ReturnValue.Desc: This value will be Ok if the slot is unlocked or SlotUnlockPrereqFalse if it is locked.

Function.Name: IsSpellCompatibleWithSlot
Function.Desc: Checks to make sure that a spell is compatible with the specified slot in the action bar.
Function.Remarks: This function does not account for other spells in the current action set. Because of this, it may return a result of Ok when passing in the id of a spell that the player already has on their action bar even though having multiple copies of the same spell on the action bar is not valid.

Param.Name: idSpell
Param.Desc: The id number for the spell that the function is validating against the action bar slot.

Param.Name: nSlotIdx
Param.Desc: The action bar slot that the function is checking the spell against.

ReturnValue.Desc: The result of the validation. If the spell can be added to the slot, this value is Ok. Otherwise, it contains the error that explains why the spell could not be added to the slot.

Function.Name: IsSpellCompatibleWithActionSet
Function.Desc: Checks to make sure that a spell is compatible with an action set.
Function.Example:
-- Attempting to add the Stalker's "Stagger" ability to the current action set
local eCanAddToSpec = ActionSetLib.IsSpellCompatibleWithActionSet(23173, ActionSetLib.GetCurrentActionSet())
if eCanAddToSpec == ActionSetLib.CodeEnumLimitedActionSetResult.Ok then Print("Stagger can be added to the current action set") else Print("Stagger can not be added to the current action set. Error: " .. eCanAddToSpec) end

Param.Name: idSpell
Param.Desc: The id number of the spell that the UI wants to place in the action set.

Param.Name: arActionSet
Param.Desc: An array of spell ids in the current action set. The array's index lines up with the slot with the same number.

ReturnValue.Desc: The result of the check. If the spell is valid in the action set, the return value will be Ok. Otherwise, this value will contain the error that would prevent the spell from being added to the action set.

Function.Name: RequestActionSetChanges
Function.Desc: Attempts to make changes to the current action set.
Function.Remarks: If the result is Ok, then the server will fire the AbilityBookChange and CharacterEldanAugmentationUpdated events.

ReturnValue.Desc: A table that contains the result and other data that is relevant to the result.

Item.Name: eResult
Item.Desc: The result of the UI's attempt to change the action set. If the change was successful, this value will be Ok. Otherwise, it will list the error that prevented it from being set.

Item.Name: tTags
Item.Desc: An array that contains the name of every spell category that was required but was not found in the action set. This table is only relevant if eResult is MissingTag.

Param.Name: arActionSet
Param.Desc: An array of spell ids that represent the proposed action set. The array's index lines up with the slot number in the action bar.

Function.Name: DoesActionSetMeetRequirements
Function.InternalNotes: Not quite sure what this is... We're checking categories to make sure that the Action Set Lib doesn't require certain types of abilities.

ReturnValue.Desc: Either the reason that the Action Set is invalid, or OK if it is valid.

Function.Name: GetCurrentActionSet
Function.Desc: Gets a list of the spell ids used in the player's current action set.

ReturnValue.Desc: A list of spell ids for the player's current action set. If a slot has no spell assigned to it, the id is 0.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumShortcutSet
EnumSet.Desc: These values represent what each Action Bar Shortcut is used for.

Library.Name: AttributeMilestonesLib
Library.Desc: This library contains functions for viewing a character's Attribute Milestones. These milestones are reached when the player's attribute reaches a specific threshold.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumAttributeMilestoneResult
EnumSet.Desc: The possible results when attempting to get an Attribute Milestone's info.

Function.Name: GetAttributeMilestoneInfo
Function.Desc: Gets information on all of the Attribute Milestones for the given class.
Function.InternalNotes: Do we still care about mini vs major milestones?
Function.Remarks: Major milestones are an outdated concept. Any milestones where bIsMini is false should be ignored for the time being.

Param.Name: eClass
Param.Desc: The function will return the Attribute Milestones for this class.

ReturnValue.Desc: The Attribute Milestones and stat gains for the class.

Item.Name: eResult
Item.Desc: This value will contain any errors found when trying to get a class' Milestone info. If this value is not "Ok", then no other values will be found in the table.

Item.Name: tMilestones
Item.Desc: A table that contains all of the milestones for the class.

Item.Name: strength
Item.Desc: The class's Brutality milestones.

Item.Name: tAttributeMilestones
Item.Desc: The milestones for the attribute.

Item.Name: bIsMini
Item.Desc: Whether the milestone provides a secondary stat bonus or not.

Item.Name: nRequiredAmount
Item.Desc: The amount of the attribute that a unit needs to reach the milestone.

Item.Name: eUnitProperty
Item.Desc: The property that is modified when the player reaches the milestone. This value only exists if bIsMini is true.

Item.Name: fModifier
Item.Desc: The amount of the specified property that the unit gains when they reach the milestone. This only exists if bIsMini is true.

Item.Name: nSpellId
Item.Desc: The id number for the spell that is granted when the player reaches the milestone. This value only exists if bIsMini is false.

Item.Name: nTier
Item.Desc: The tier of the spell that is granted by the milestone. This only exists if bIsMini is false.

Item.Name: tSecondaryStats
Item.Desc: The secondary stats that the class gains per attribute point.

Item.Name: eUnitProperty
Item.Desc: The stat that a player gains whenever they gain a point in this attribute.

Item.Name: fBonus
Item.Desc: The amount of the stat that is gained per attribute point.

Item.Name: dexterity
Item.Desc: The class's Finesse milestones.

Item.Name: technology
Item.Desc: The class's Tech milestones.

Item.Name: magic
Item.Desc: The class's Insight milestones.

Item.Name: wisdom
Item.Desc: The class's Moxie milestones.

Item.Name: stamina
Item.Desc: The class's Grit milestones.

Object.Name: Achievement
Object.Desc: Achievements are tasks that can be completed to gain various rewards. These include the standard Achievements that you find in the AchievementLog, as well as the elements of the Tradeskill Tech Tree.

Method.Name: GetId
Method.Desc: Returns the achievement's ID number.
Method.Example: function Example::GetAchievement(idSource) local tAchievements = AchievementsLib.GetAchievements() for idx = 1, #tAchievements do achCurrent = tAchievements[idx] if achCurrent:GetId() == idSource then return achCurrent end end

Method.Name: GetName
Method.Desc: Returns the name of the achievement
Method.Example: function Example::DisplayNames() local tAchievements = AchievementsLib.GetAchievements() for idx = 1, #tAchievements do local achCurrent = tAchievements[idx] Print(achCurrent:GetName() end

Method.Name: GetDescription
Method.Desc: Returns the description text for the achievement when it is completed. This function is not to be confused with Achievement:GetProgressText(), which returns the description text for the achievement before it is complete
Method.Example:
function Example:PrintAchievementText(achSource)
if achSource:IsComplete() then
Print(achSource:GetDescription())
else
Print(achSource:GetProgressText())
end
end

Method.Name: GetProgressText
Method.Desc: Returns the description text that the achievement shows when it is not complete. This function is not to be confused with Achievement:GetDescription(), which returns the text for the achievement when it is complete
Method.Example: function Example:PrintAchievementText(achSource) if achSource:IsComplete() then Print(achSource:GetDescription()) else Print(achSource:GetProgressText()) end end

Method.Name: GetCategory
Method.Desc: Returns the name of the category that the achievement belongs to.
Method.Example:
function Example:IsTradeskillAchievement(achSource)
strCategoryName = achSource:GetCagetory() or ""
if strCategoryName == "Tradeskill" or strCategoryName == "Hobby" then
return true
else
return false
end
end

Method.Name: GetCategoryFullName
Method.Desc: Returns the long version of the name of the category that the achievement belongs to

Method.Name: GetCategoryId
Method.Desc: Returns the id number for the category that the achievement belongs to

Method.Name: GetGroup
Method.Desc: Gets the name of the tradeskill that the achievement belongs to, if any.

Method.Name: GetSubGroup
Method.Desc: Returns the name of the subgroup that the achievement belongs to.

Method.Name: GetTradeskillLayout
Method.Desc: Returns the position information for the achievement and its parents.

Item.Name: nX
Item.Desc: The X coordinate of the Achievement node

Item.Name: nY
Item.Desc: The Y coordinate of the Achievement node

Item.Name: arParents
Item.Desc: The position of the parent

Item.Name: x
Item.Desc: The X coordinate of the parent

Item.Name: y
Item.Desc: The Y coordinate of the parent

Method.Name: IsComplete
Method.Desc: Determines whether or not the Achievement has been completed.

Method.Name: GetDateCompleted
Method.Desc: Returns a string with the date that the achievement was completed. The formatting for the date varies based on which language is being used on the client

ReturnValue.Desc: The date that the achievement was completed. This date is localized for different regions.

Method.Name: GetPoints
Method.Desc: Returns the number of achievement points granted when the achievement is completed

Method.Name: GetParentTier
Method.Desc: Returns the parent achievement of a multi-tier achievement.

Method.Name: GetChildTier
Method.Desc: Returns the previous step of a multi-stage achievement.
Method.Remarks: Multi-stage achievements are ones that have multiple tiers of progression. A good example of this is the PvP Achievement "Cracked Your First Skull".

Method.Name: GetWorldZoneId
Method.Desc: Returns the zone id where this achievement can be completed.

Method.Name: GetNumCompleted
Method.Desc: Returns the character's progress on this achievement.

Method.Name: GetNumNeeded
Method.Desc: Returns the amount of progress that is required to complete this achievement

Method.Name: IsChecklist
Method.Desc: Determines if the Achievement requires multiple different steps to complete it

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the achievmemnt is a checklist or not.

Method.Name: GetChecklistItems
Method.Desc: Returns a list of things required to complete this achievement

Item.Name: strChecklistEntry
Item.Desc: The name of this checklist item. This can be a description of a step of the achievement, the name of an item that must be crafted, or the name of a schematic that must be learned.

Item.Name: bIsComplete
Item.Desc: Whether or not this step of the achievement is complete

Item.Name: idSchematic
Item.Desc: The id number of the schematic that must be learned or is the source of the item required for this part of the achievement.

Method.Name: GetRewards
Method.Desc: Returns any title that is granted when the achievement is completed.

Method.Name: GetTradeskillRewards
Method.Desc: Returns a description of various rewards that a tradeskill achievement grants

Item.Name: idFaction
Item.Desc: The id for the faction that the achievement gives rep with

Item.Name: nFactionAmount
Item.Desc: The amount of reputation granted by the tradeskill

Item.Name: nTalentPoints
Item.Desc: The number of tradeskill talent points granted by the Achievement

Item.Name: arSchematics
Item.Desc: A list of tradeskill schematics that are unlocked by this Achievement

Item.Name: idSchematic
Item.Desc: The id number for the schematic that the Achievement grants

Item.Name: itemCrafted
Item.Desc: The item created by the schematic that is granted by the Achievement

Item.Name: arBonuses
Item.Desc: A list of Tradeskill bonuses granted by this Achievement

Item.Name: strIcon
Item.Desc: The name of the icon used for the bonus granted by this Achievement

Item.Name: strName
Item.Desc: The name of the bonus granted by this Achievement

Item.Name: strTooltip
Item.Desc: The tooltip string for the bonus granted by this Achievement

Method.Name: GetTradeskillSchematicsRequired
Method.Desc: Returns a list of schematic ids that the character must know before unlocking this Achievement.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of schematic ids the character must know before the achievement is unlocked.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Determines whether the given variable is an Achievement

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that is being checked.

Method.Name: IsGuildAchievement
Method.Desc: Determines if an Achievement is a Guild Achievement

Method.Name: GetSubGroupId
Method.Desc: Returns the id number of the subgroup that the achievement belongs to.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Determines if the Achievement that is passed in is the same as the achievement that called this function.

Param.Name: achCompare
Param.Desc: The achievement that will be compared to the one that called this function.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the two Achievements were the same or not.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: Manually calls the Achievement's garbage collector.

Method.Name: IsCurrencyShown
Method.Desc: Determines whether the achievent requires currency to be completed.

ReturnValue.Desc: If the achievement requires currency, this will return true.

Method.Name: GetCurrencySystem
Method.Desc: Gets the type of currency required to progress the spefied Achievement.

ReturnValue.Desc: The type of money the player

Function.Name: GetSelectedRoles
Function.Remarks: Known Issue: The values returned from this function carry over to characters with the same name on the same realm and same account. Because of this, the selected roles may be different than the roles the new character is eligible for.

Object.Name: ApolloColor
Object.Desc: ApolloColors are the primary way that the UI uses colors. There are a number predefined colors, which can be found under Virtual colors section of Houston's color chooser. Addon developers can also create their own ApolloColors using a string with the color's ARGB values in hex format.

Function.Name: new
Function.Desc: Creates a new ApolloColor object.
Function.InternalNotes: This is a pain to write simply because there are so many different options for what kinds of variables can be passed in.
Function.Remarks: This can be created using a string with the ApolloColor's name, a string with the color's ARGB values in hex, a table with the color's ARGB values, or a set of integers using the ARGB values.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Validates that the variable passed in is an ApolloColor.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that we are checking.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable is an ApolloColor or not.

Function.Name: SetColor
Function.Desc: Sets a named ApolloColor to the value of a CColor.

Param.Name: strColorName
Param.Desc: The name of the ApolloColor that is being updated.

Param.Name: crUpdatedValues
Param.Desc: The CColor that the ApolloColor is being updated to.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the ApolloColor was successfully updated or not.

Method.Name: IsSameColorAs
Method.Desc: Checks if two ApolloColors share the same color.
Method.Example: This function can compare virtual colors and hardcoded colors successfully.

Param.Name: crChecking
Param.Desc: The ApolloColor that we are checking against.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the ApolloColors share the same color.

Method.Name: ToTable
Method.Desc: Returns a table with the ApolloColor's RGBA values.

ReturnValue.Desc: The color's RGBA values.

Item.Name: r
Item.Desc: The color's red value.

Item.Name: g
Item.Desc: The color's green value.

Item.Name: b
Item.Desc: The color's blue value.

Item.Name: a
Item.Desc: The color's alpha value.

Method.Name: IsLinked
Method.Desc: Determines whether the ApolloColor is using a virtual color or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the ApolloColor is set to a virtual color or a hardcoded value.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Checks if two ApolloColors are the same.
Method.InternalNotes: Is this necessary when we have the IsSameColorAs function?

Param.Name: crChecking
Param.Desc: The ApolloColor that the function will check against.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the two ApolloColors are equal or not.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: ApolloColor's garbage collection function. This will delete the ApolloColor from memory.
Method.InternalNotes: Do we ever want to explicitly call a garbage collection function in Lua?

Method.Name: __index
Method.InternalNotes: Is this necessary when we can convert it to a table?
Method.Desc: Returns the ApolloColor's value at the specified index.

Param.Name: strIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the value that should be returned. This will either be "r" for the color's red value, "b" for the color's blue value, "g" for the color's green value, or "a" for the color's alpha value.

ReturnValue.Desc: The color value at the specified index.

Object.Name: CommodityOrder
Object.Desc: A buy or sell order on the commodities exchange.

Method.Name: GetItem
Method.Desc: Gets the item that the CommodityOrder is trying to buy or sell.

ReturnValue.Desc: The item that the CommodityOrder is looking for or selling.

Method.Name: GetCount
Method.Desc: Gets the number of items left in the CommodityOrder

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of items that the CommodityOrder will try to buy or sell before it ends.

Method.Name: GetPricePerUnit
Method.Desc: Gets the amount of money that the CommodityOrder is buying or selling its associated item for.

ReturnValue.Desc: How much the Commodity Order is trying to buy or sell its item for.

Method.Name: GetReservePricePerUnit
Method.InternalNotes: Unsure, but I don't think these have a reserve price.

Method.Name: GetListTime
Method.InternalNotes: Why are Time objects so bad!?!?!
Method.Desc: Gets the amount of time between Jan 1st, 1970 and when the Commodity Order was posted, in seconds.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of seconds between Jan 1st, 1970 and when the Commodity Order was posted

Method.Name: GetExpirationTime
Method.InternalNotes: We should really be getting the exact number of seconds before passing this to Lua
Method.Desc: Gets the number of seconds between Jan 1st, 1970 and when the commodity order will expire.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of seconds between Jan 1st, 1970 and when the commodity order will expire.

Method.Name: IsBuy
Method.Desc: Determines if a CommodityOrder is a buy order or sell order.

ReturnValue.Desc: If this is true, then the order is a buy order. Otherwise, it's a sell order.

Method.Name: IsForceImmediate
Method.Desc: Determines if the buy or sell order is set up to find the CommodityOrder of the opposite type with the best price for the same item so it completes immediately.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the CommodityOrder is trying to buy or sell the item immediately.

Method.Name: SetCount
Method.Desc: Sets the number of items that the CommodityOrder is looking to buy or sell before it is completed.

Param.Name: nNewCount
Param.Desc: The value that the function will try to change the CommodityOrder's count to.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the count was successfully updated or not.

Method.Name: SetPrices
Method.Desc: Sets the price that the CommodityOrder will try to buy or sell its items for.

Param.Name: monPrice
Param.Desc: The amount that the commodity order will attempt to buy or sell its items for per unit.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the price was successfully set or not.

Method.Name: SetForceImmediate
Method.Desc: Changes the CommodityOrder so it attempts to buy or sell its items for the best price when it is posted.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the CommodityOrder's "force immediate" flag was successfully set or not.

Param.Name: bSellNow
Param.Desc: The value that the CommodityOrder's "force immediate" flag will be changed to.

Method.Name: IsPosted
Method.Desc: Determines if the CommodityOrder is already posted or not.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the CommodityOrder was already posted or not.

Method.Name: CanPost
Method.Desc: Determines if the CommodityOrder can be posted.
Method.Remarks: A CommodityOrder cannot be posted if it is already posted, if the order is for less than 1 item, if the price per unit is less than 1 copper, or if the player is already at their maximum number of commodity orders.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the CommodityOrder can be posted or not.

Method.Name: Post
Method.Desc: Attempts to post the CommodityOrder on the Commodities Market.
Method.Remarks: The PostCommodityOrderResult event will fire in response to this function.

Method.Name: Cancel
Method.Desc: Cancels an active CommodityOrder
Method.Remarks: Any items or money remaining in the order will be mailed to the player after it is canceled.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Determines if a variable is a CommodityOrder or not.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that the function will check.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable is a CommodityOrder or not.

Function.Name: newBuyOrder
Function.Desc: Creates a new Buy order for the given item.
Function.Remarks: The new order will have a count, and price per unit of 1 after it is created.

Param.Name: itemTarget
Param.Desc: The item that the buy order will try to purchase.

ReturnValue.Desc: The new buy order that was created.

Function.Name: newSellOrder
Function.Desc: Creates a new Sell order for the given item.
Function.Remarks: The new order will have a count, and price per unit of 1 after it is created.

Param.Name: itemSelling
Param.Desc: The item that the sell order will attempt to sell.

ReturnValue.Desc: A new Sell order for the given item.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Checks whether the given CommodityOrder is equal to the one that called this function.

Param.Name: orderCompare
Param.Desc: The CommodityOrder that will be compared to the one that called this function.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the two CommodityOrders are the same.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: The garbage collection function for the CommodityOrder. This should never have to be called from Lua.

Method.Name: GetTax
Method.Desc: Gets the amount of money that the player has to pay to post a Sell order.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount of money that is required to post the sell order.

Library.Name: GuildLib
Library.Desc: This library contains functions and enumerations having to do with guilds and arena teams

Object.Name: DialogSys
Object.Desc: Dialogs are the chat bubbles that appear when speaking with an NPC. They can be used for accepting and turning in quests and other conversations with NPCs. This library allows the player to get information on the currently displayed dialog.

Function.Name: GetState
Function.Desc: Gets the dialog's current state.
Function.InternalNotes: Need to make DialogSys.DialogState an enum.

ReturnValue.Desc: The dialog's current state. This value lines up with the DialogSys_DialogState set of constants.

Function.Name: GetResponses
Function.Desc: Gets a list of possible responses that the player can send.

Param.Name: idQuest
Param.Desc: The id number of the quest that is giving the player responses.

ReturnValue.Desc: The list of responses the player can select for the dialog.

Function.Name: End
Function.Desc: Cancels the current dialog.

Function.Name: GetViewableQuest
Function.Desc: Grabs the quest with the specified id if it is the one that the dialog is using.
Function.InternalNotes: This should be moved to the quest library or game library or somewhere other than dialogsys

Param.Name: idQuest
Param.Desc: The id number of the quest that the function will try to match with any quest that the current dialog is displaying.

ReturnValue.Desc: The quest with the specified id. If the dialog was not showing a quest or was showing a quest with a different id, this will be nil.

Function.Name: GetCommCreatureId
Function.Desc: Gets the id number of the NPC associated with the current dialog.

ReturnValue.Desc: The id number of the NPC that is tied to the dialog.

Function.Name: GetNPC
Function.Desc: Gets the unit associated with the dialog.

ReturnValue.Desc: The unit associated with the dialog.

Function.Name: GetNPCText
Function.Desc: Gets the string that contains the NPC's text. This will also play any VO associated with this dialog.

Param.Name: idQuest
Param.Desc: The id number of the quest that the dialog is associated with.

ReturnValue.Desc: The text that the dialog should show for the NPC.

Function.Name: GetResponseText
Function.Desc: Gets the text that the player is responding to.

ReturnValue.Desc: The text that the player's responses o

Function.Name: IsItemQuestGiver
Function.Desc: Checks if the dialog was triggered by an item that is granting a quest.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the quest is granted by an item or not.

Param.Name: bResponse
Param.Desc: Was the matching game accepted or declined

Library.Name: AccountItemLib
Library.InternalNotes: Temporarily skipping this since idk much about how this works.

Library.Name: CREDDExchangeLib
Library.Desc: This library is one of the primary ways that the player interacts with the CREDD Exchange. This does not include creating and fulfilling orders, which is handled by the ActionConfirmButton.

Function.Name: RequestExchangeInfo
Function.Desc: Requests a list for the CREDD Exchange's stats and CREDDExchangeOrders.
Function.Example: The server will fire the CREDDExchangeInfoResults event in response

Function.Name: CancelOrder
Function.Desc: Removes a CREDD Exchange Order from the Exchange.
Function.Example: The CREDDExchangeInfoResults event is fired in response to this, informing the UI of the status of the operation.

Param.Name: crdOrder
Param.Desc: The order that the player wishes to cancel.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumAccountOperationResult
EnumSet.Desc: Results of various account operations. This includes reasons the operation might have failed, as well as "Ok" for successful operations.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumAccountOperation
EnumSet.Desc: The different types of account operations that the player can perform.

Function.Name: GetCREDDHistory
Function.Desc: Requests player's buy and sell history from the server.
Function.Example: The server will send the results in the CREDDOperationHistoryResults event.

Object.Name: CREDDExchangeOrder
Object.Desc: Individual orders on the CREDD Exchange.

Method.Name: GetPrice
Method.Desc: Gets the price that the order was set for.

ReturnValue.Desc: The amount and type of money that the order is requesting or offering for a CREDD.

Method.Name: GetListTime
Method.Desc: Gets the time that the order was posted.
Method.Example:
The full date/time can be converted to a string using the Time object's _tostring function:
local crdNewOrder = CCExchangeOrder.newBuyOrder() local monPrice = Money.new() monPrice:SetAmount(1)
crdNewOrder:SetPrice(monPrice) crdNewOrder:Post()
local timeExpiration = crdNewOrder:GetListTime() Print(timeExpiration:_tostring())

ReturnValue.Desc: A time object for when the order was posted.

Method.Name: GetExpirationTime
Method.Desc: Gets the amount of time that the order will remain on the CREDD Exchange.
Method.Example:
The full date/time can be converted to a string using the Time object's _tostring function:
local crdNewOrder = CCExchangeOrder.newBuyOrder() local monPrice = Money.new() monPrice:SetAmount(1)
crdNewOrder:SetPrice(monPrice) crdNewOrder:Post()
local timeExpiration = crdNewOrder:GetExpirationTime() Print(timeExpiration:_tostring())

ReturnValue.Desc: A Time object that states when the order will expire.

Method.Name: IsBuy
Method.Desc: Determines if the order is a buy order.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the order is a buy order or not.

Method.Name: SetPrice
Method.Desc: Sets the price that the order asks for once it is posted on the CREDD Exchange.
Method.Example: Note that the Money has to be in credits and the amount has to be greater than 0.

Param.Name: monPrice
Param.Desc: The amount of money that the order will pay for / accept for CREDD.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the price was set successfully or not.

Method.Name: IsPosted
Method.Desc: Checks if the order is posted on the CREDD Exchange.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the order is posted on the CREDD Exchange or not.

Method.Name: CanPost
Method.Desc: Validates that the order is set for a valid number ( > 0 ) of credits and is not currently posted on the CREDD Exchange.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the order can be posted on the CREDD Exchange or not.

Method.Name: Post
Method.Desc: Posts the order on the CREDD Exchange.

Method.Name: Cancel
Method.Desc: Removes the order from the CREDD Exchange.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Checks if the variable that was passed in is a CREDDExchangeOrder.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The variable that this function will check.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable that was passed in is a CREDDExchangeOrder or not.

Function.Name: newBuyOrder
Function.Desc: Creates a new CREDDExchangeOrder that is a buy order.
Function.Example: This is largely unused since CREDDExchangeOrders are created using the ActionConfirmButton.

ReturnValue.Desc: A new CREDD Exchange buy order.

Function.Name: newSellOrder
Function.Desc: Creates a new CREDDExchangeOrder that is a sell order.
Function.Example: This is largely unused since CREDDExchangeOrders are created using the ActionConfirmButton.

ReturnValue.Desc: A new sell order for the CREDD Exchange.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Determines if another CREDDExchangeOrder is the same as this one.

Param.Name: crdCompare
Param.Desc: The CREDDExchangeOrder that is being compared to the one calling this function.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the two CREDDExchangeOrders are the same order or not.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: Forces the garbage collector to be called on the CREDDExchangeOrder that called the function.

Library.Name: DemoSummary
Library.InternalNotes: Temporarily skipping since it's Dev Only and possibly depricated.

Library.Name: CustomerSurveyLib
Library.Desc: A library that allows the player to interact with queued customer surveys.

Function.Name: GetPending
Function.Desc: Gets a pending customer survey that the player has not filled out.

Param.Name: nIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the survey that will be returned. If no value is provided, the function will get the first pending survey.

ReturnValue.Desc: The pending survey.

Function.Name: GetPendingCount
Function.Desc: Gets the number of surveys that are waiting to be filled out by the player.

ReturnValue.Desc: The number of surveys that are waiting to be filled out by the player.

EnumSet.Name: CodeEnumSurveyType
EnumSet.Desc: The different types of surveys that the player can receive.

Object.Name: ChatChannel
Object.Desc: One of the channels that chat messages can be sent to.

Method.Name: GetName
Method.Desc: Gets the ChatChannel's name.

ReturnValue.Desc: The name of the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: GetCommand
Method.Desc: Gets the slash command used to select the ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: The command used to select the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: GetAbbreviation
Method.Desc: Gets an abbreviation for the ChatChannel that can be used in slash commands to quickly select the channel.

ReturnValue.Desc: The ChatChannel's abbreviation.

Method.Name: GetAlternate
Method.Desc: Checks for alternate abbreviations for the ChatChannel.

Param.Name: nIndex
Param.Desc: The index of the alternate abbreviation for the ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: The alternate abbreviation for the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: GetType
Method.Desc: Gets the ChatChannel's id number.

ReturnValue.Desc: The channel's id number.

Method.Name: IsCustom
Method.Desc: Determines if the ChatChannel is a player made channel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the ChatChannel is a player made channel or not.

Method.Name: IsOwner
Method.Desc: Determines if the player owns the ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player owns the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: IsModerator
Method.Desc: Checks if the player is a moderator of the ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player is a moderator of the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: IsMuted
Method.Desc: Determines if the player is muted in the ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player is muted or not.

Method.Name: CanSend
Method.Desc: Determines if the player is able to send messages on this ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player is able to send chat messages on this ChatChannel or not.

Method.Name: Send
Method.Desc: Sends a message over the ChatChannel.
Method.Example: Players in the ChatChannel will receive the ChatMessage event after this function has finished.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: The message that will be sent over the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: SetData
Method.Desc: Saves data in the ChatChannel. This data can be accessed again by calling the GetData function.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The data that will be tied to the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: GetData
Method.Desc: Gets the data that was added to the channel with SetData()

ReturnValue.Desc: The data that was added to the ChatChannel with SetData.

Method.Name: SetProfanity
Method.Desc: Attempts to change the ChatChannel's Profanity Filter status.

Param.Name: bProfanityFilterOn
Param.Desc: Whether the Profanity Filter should be turned on or off for the channel.

Method.Name: GetProfanity
Method.Desc: Checks whether the Profanity Filter is turned on for the ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the Profanity Filter is turned on for the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: GetMembers
Method.Desc: Gets a list of players that are in the ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array that contains information on all of the players that are in the ChatChannel.

Item.Name: strMemberName
Item.Desc: The name of the player.

Item.Name: bIsChannelOwner
Item.Desc: Whether the player owns the channel.

Item.Name: bIsModerator
Item.Desc: Whether the player is a moderator of the channel.

Item.Name: bIsMuted
Item.Desc: Whether the character has been muted.

Method.Name: GetBans
Method.Desc: Gets a list of players who are banned in this ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of information about the players that have been banned from the channel.

Item.Name: strMemberName
Item.Desc: The player's name.

Item.Name: bIsChannelOwner
Item.Desc: Whether the player owns the channel or not.

Item.Name: bIsModerator
Item.Desc: Whether the player is a moderator of the channel or not.

Item.Name: bIsMuted
Item.Desc: Whether the player is muted in the channel or not.

Method.Name: RequestMembers
Method.Desc: Requests a list of the players in the ChatChannel.
Method.Example: If this is successful, the player will receive the ChatList event.

Method.Name: SetModerator
Method.Desc: Attempts to set a player's Moderator status in the ChatChannel.
Method.Example: If the player's Moderator status was successfully changed, the ChatAction event will be fired.

Param.Name: strPlayerName
Param.Desc: The name of the player whose Moderator status will be updated by this function.

Param.Name: bMakeModerator
Param.Desc: Whether the player's Moderator flag should be granted (true) or removed (false). This defaults to false if no value is passed in.

Method.Name: SetMute
Method.Desc: Attempts to set a player's Mute status for the ChatChannel.
Method.Example: If this function is successful, the ChatAction event will be fired.

Param.Name: strPlayerName
Param.Desc: The player whose Mute flag should be changed by the function.

Param.Name: bMuted
Param.Desc: Whether the Mute flag should be added to the player (true) or removed (false). This defaults to false if no value is passed in.

Method.Name: PassOwner
Method.Desc: Attempts to make another player the owner of the ChatChannel.
Method.Example: If ownership was successfully passed, the ChatAction event will fire.

Param.Name: strPlayerName
Param.Desc: The name of the player that the function will attempt to transfer ownership to.

Method.Name: Leave
Method.Desc: Attempts to remove the player from the ChatChannel.
Method.Example: If the attempt was successful, the player will receive the ChatLeave event.

Method.Name: CanLeave
Method.Desc: Checks if the player is able to leave the ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the player is able to leave the ChatChannel or not.

Method.Name: Kick
Method.Desc: Attempts to remove a player from the ChatChannel.
Method.Example: If this call is successful, players will receive the ChatAction event.

Param.Name: strPlayerName
Param.Desc: The name of the player that the function will attempt to remove from the ChatChannel.

Method.Name: SetPassword
Method.Desc: Attempts to add a password to the ChatChannel or modify an existing one.
Method.Example: If this is successful, the ChatAction event will be fired.

Param.Name: strPassword
Param.Desc: The ChatChannel's new password.

Method.Name: Post
Method.Desc: Attempts to send a string to all members of the ChatChannel.
Method.Example: If this function is successful, then players in the channel will receive the ChatMessage event.

Param.Name: strMessage
Param.Desc: The message that will be sent through the ChatChannel.

Param.Name: strSenderName
Param.Desc: The name of the player that sent the message. This value defaults to an empty string.

Param.Name: unitSpeaker
Param.Desc: The unit that entered the message.

Param.Name: bTextBubble
Param.Desc: Whether a text bubble should be shown for this piece of text.

Function.Name: is
Function.Desc: Checks whether a variable is a ChatChannel or not.

Param.Name: oVariable
Param.Desc: The function will verify that this variable is a ChatChannel.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the variable is a ChatChannel or not.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Checks whether a ChatChannel is equal to the ChatChannel that called this function.

Param.Name: chanComparison
Param.Desc: The ChatChannel that will be compared to the one that called this function.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the two ChatChannels are equal or not.

Method.Name: __gc
Method.Desc: ChatChannel's garbage collection function. This will delete the ChatChannel from memory.

Object.Name: CustomerSurveyTypeLib
Object.InternalNotes: This really needs to be renamed
Object.Desc: Surveys that are sent out to players during betas and on the PTR. These are disabled in the live game.

Method.Name: isCustomerSurvey
Method.InternalNotes: This is a method. If it wasn't a CustomerSurvey, it wouldn't be able to call this.
Method.Desc: Checks if this variable is a CustomerSurvey.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether this is a CustomerSurvey or not.

Method.Name: GetTitle
Method.Desc: Gets the survey's title.

ReturnValue.Desc: The survey's title.

Method.Name: GetSurveyType
Method.Desc: Gets the survey's type.
Method.Remarks: The survey's type corresponds with what triggered it.

ReturnValue.Desc: The survey's type.

Method.Name: GetQuestions
Method.Desc: Gets the text for the questions on the survey.

Param.Name: nIndex
Param.Desc: If this is passed in, the function will return a single string for the question at this index.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of all of the survey's questions. If nIndex was set, this will be a single string and not an array.

Method.Name: GetResults
Method.Desc: Gets a list of the player's responses to the survey.

Param.Name: nIndex
Param.Desc: If this is passed in, the function will only return the result for the question at this index.

ReturnValue.Desc: An array of integers with the player's responses to the survey. If nIndex was set, then this will be a single integer instead of an array.

Method.Name: GetComment
Method.Desc: Gets the text from the Comment section of the survey.

ReturnValue.Desc: The text that is in the Comment section of the survey.

Method.Name: SetResults
Method.InternalNotes: This is returning 1 for some reason. It probably shouldn't be.
Method.Desc: Sets a result for each question in the survey.

Param.Name: arResponses
Param.Desc: An array that contains responses for each of the survey's questions.

Method.Name: SetComment
Method.InternalNotes: This is returning 1 when it probably shouldn't be.
Method.Desc: Sets the survey's comment section.

Param.Name: strComment
Param.Desc: The text that will become the survey's comment.

Method.Name: SendResult
Method.Desc: Attempts to send the CustomerSurvey to Carbine.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the CustomerSurvey was successfully sent or not.

Method.Name: Cancel
Method.Desc: Cancels the current survey. If the survey stopped the player from leaving the game, they will now be able to leave.

Method.Name: __eq
Method.Desc: Determines if two CustomerSurveys are the same.

Param.Name: svyCompare
Param.Desc: The CustomerSurvey that is being compared to the one that called this function.

ReturnValue.Desc: Whether the two CustomerSurveys are the same or not.

Method.Name: SetResults
Method.InternalNotes: This returns 1 and it probably shouldn't.
Method.Desc: Sets the result for a specific question in the survey.

Param.Name: nQuestion
Param.Desc: The index for the question that the response belongs to.

Param.Name: nResponse
Param.Desc: The index of the response.

Library.Name: CharacterScreenLib
Library.Desc: A library that is used during the character creation and character select. This library is not publicly available.

Event.Name: CharacterCreateFailed
Event.Desc: Fires whenever the server rejected the player's attempt at character creation.

Library.Name: CombatFloaters
Library.InternalNotes: Why is this a thing? CombatFloaters vs. CombatFloater is retarded naming convention. This isn't used in our current Lua and may be depricated.

Object.Name: FriendshipLib
Object.Desc: A library that contains functions for interacting with the game's Friend and Account Friend systems.

Function.Name: AddByName
Function.Desc: Changes the friendship type with the player with the specified name.
Function.Example: If the Friendship Type is Friend or Account Friend, an invite will be sent to the player. Other changes in Friend status do not need confirmation from the other player.

Param.Name: eFriendshipType
Param.Desc: The friendship type that the player will change to. This value lines up with FriendshipLib.CharacterFriendshipType set of constants.

Param.Name: strName
Param.Desc: The name of the player whose friendship type will be updated.

Param.Name: strRealmName
Param.Desc: The name of the realm that the player is on. This is only necessary for players that are not on the same realm.

Param.Name: strNote
Param.Desc: A note that will be sent to the specified player if the friendship type is either Friend or Account Friend. This note will be visible in the invite that the player receives.

Function.Name: AddByGroupIndex
Function.Desc: Attempts to change the friendship status of a player in your current group.
Function.Example: This will send an invite if the type sent is Friend or Account friend.

Param.Name: eType
Param.Desc: The friendship status that the player wants to add to the specified group member. This value lines up with the FriendshipLib.CharacterFriendshipType set of constants.

Param.Name: nMemberIdx
Param.Desc: The index of the player within the group.

Function.Name: AccountAddByEmail
Function.Desc: Attempts to send an account friend invite to the account that is registered to the specified email address.

Param.Name: strAddress
Param.Desc: The email address associated with the account that the player wants to send the invite to.

Param.Name: strNote
Param.Desc: A note that will be sent to the player that receives the account friend invite.

Function.Name: AccountAddByUpgrade
Function.Desc: Attempts to send an invitation to upgrade a Friend to an Account Friend.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The Friend id of the player that will receive the Account Friend Invite.

Param.Name: strNote
Param.Desc: A note that the person who receives the Account Friend invite will see in the invite.

Function.Name: AccountInviteMarkSeen
Function.Desc: Marks an account invite as "Seen" by the system.
Function.Remarks: This flag has no set use, however the UI tends to use it to inform the player that they have pending invites.

Function.Name: AccountInviteRespond
Function.Desc: Sends a response to an Account Invite that the player has received.

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The id of the friend invite that the player is responding to.

Param.Name: bAccepted
Param.Desc: Whether the player accepted the invite or not.

Function.Name: AccountRemove
Function.Desc: Removes the specified Account Friend from the player's friends' list

Param.Name: idFriend
Param.Desc: The Friend id of the Account Friend that the player wants to remove.

Object.Name: ChatChannelLib
Object.InternalNotes: This is the exact same as ChatChannel. We aren't using this library and should probably remove it.

Event.Name: ColorChanged
Event.Desc: Fired whent he player selects a color from the ColorPicker window
Event.InternalNotes: Uses CColor instead of ApolloColor

Param.Name: crNewColor
Param.Desc: The color that was selected when this event was fired.
